Reviews.Title: “Marcella royal hotel..”
Reviews.Author: eLjencee
Reviews.Content: Marcella royal hotel wasn't as close to sites as I was told. For example, Spanish steps is suppose to be 10 min walk and it took me about 25 minutes to get there and I wasn't taking my time either. The trevi fountain is only a good 10 min walk from the Spanish steps and the colosseum is probably a good 20 minute from the trevi fountain. the train and metro is a 15-20 minute walk. However, the bus stop is right down the block to the left which made it convenient to get to places. The rooms were pretty small but not a big issue. As for noise, i didnt have a problem but my room wasn't at the front of the building as every reviewers was saying. Daily breakfast included cereal, coffee, tea, (cappuccino - has to be specially ordered). Scrambled eggs, bacon, assorted ham and cheese, pastries, bread, toast, butter & jelly. my last stay they had hard boiled eggs as well. I honestly didn't mind the breakfast but I can see how it can become sickening after eating the same thing day after day. I was advised by the receptionist of the hotel to take the bus the colosseum and the vatican. I had a tour booked with viator.com for both sites. I took the #60 bus to the colosseum and it was perfect made my tour in good time. However taking the #492 bus the colosseum was a big mistake. It took About 45 minutes to get there and missed my tour! I was then told by the tour people that the metro would have been better because it's only 5 stops as oppose to the bus which was 15+ stops. The hotel sells single ride bus passes at the front desk which were convenient. Tip eat at mamma Angela's about 10 min walk from hotel ask if they can make a reservation for you as well because it's always packed. Good affordable, homemade food, no ridiculous bread charge. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: lynda m
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have just returned from Rome to celebrate a rather large birthday and we were not dissapointed in this hotel. THe room was large, clean and with a big window overlooking Via Flavia, a street with delis, bakers and good restaurants. The staff were friendly and the breakfast varied and tasty and served on the roof terace overlooking rosy Rome. At night the terrace affords spectacular views over the city towards the setting sun and the cocktails are good too! The staff are very helpful and you can buy bus tickets in reception, 1euro a journey. It is a 15 minute walk from Termini station and in a very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and shabby, not worth the high price”
Reviews.Author: Nicola M
Reviews.Content: Having paid 170Euros per night and having read the reviews, we were astounded when we arrived at the Marcella Royal. The decor and furniture in both the communal areas and the bedroom was fairly low standard and did not look as if had been updated much in the last 20 years. The bedroom was small, dark, old-fashioned, with artificial flowers that had clearly been there for many years, plastic cups rather than glasses, a full ashtray on the window-ledge, and a TV that didn't work properly. It was also pretty noisy during the night. The breakfast was basic at best, very limited choice, no fresh fruit, and the furniture on the much-hyped terrace was like basic garden furniture. Nice views on the terrace, and the one receptionist we spoke to the most was helpful and pleasant. It is not in the 'central' area of Rome, it is probably at least 20 minutes walk to the shops/Spanish Steps/TrevI Fountain area, and although there are a few nice restaurants on the Via Flavia, it is pretty quiet and you are far from being in the 'hub' of Rome. If you think paying a steep price per night, a 4 star rating, and positive reviews mean you are guaranteed a comfortable luxurious stay, be prepared to be disappointed with the Marcella Royal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian Review March 23-31 2012”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCalgaryfamily
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marcella Royal Hotel booked through Expedia March 23. Book a private car through Limousine Systems online. 45 minutes to and from Fiumicino airport from the hotel. Everything went well and the contact is through Tina Hernandez. It beats all the scamming by taxis in Rome and all contact/reservation can be done online. We had no problems and recommend this service. The front desk speaks perfect english, and all were good, but special commendations to Lorella and Medi. They were especially friendly, helpful, and made our trip easy. We booked a family suite #416 and #418. They were connected with separate bathrooms, and two twin beds in each room. Beds were firm like I them. The rooms have older furnishings and finishings. But super clean, and prices are reasonable. Excellent maid service. Would be a 3 star hotel based on furnishings, but I would rate it 4 stars overall for all its other positives. All bathrooms were fully stocked with clean towels, shampoo, soap, moisturizer, hair dryer. They are tiny and awkward. Only 1 person can use at a time. The hotel has free breakfast every morning. Bacon, eggs, cold cuts, fruits, milk, yogurt, cereal, pastries, great red orange juice, coffee, tea. Plenty to eat but has the same items each day but will save you 50 euros a day on breakfast and time. The free wifi is good but is most effective in the early morning and later evenings. Internet traffic must affect its signals. Location is away from the traffic and noise. Neighbourhood is safe. Have to walk 20 minutes to Trevi Fountain, and Villa Borghese. 10 minutes to Termini station. Rome is a walking city. Can walk to all sites and see the beautiful homes and Italian life. Don’t bother with hop on and hop off buses, just ask the front desk on the public buses and they go by all the sites for 1 Euro each person each way. If I was to do it again, I would walk to all the sites, and just take the bus back. The subways are too far away from the sites. Buses are safe and saw no pickpocketers at anytime in Rome. Food nearby at La Taglio Pizza right across the front entrance of hotel. La Locanda da Bacco is on Via Flavia(same street as hotel) has great food. Any item on menu is good. Other restaurants in area we tried but food was either not good or too expensive. Service at any restaurant(or retail stores) in Italy is not as good as Canada. I Caruso is on Via Collina just on the corner has great fresh made Gelato. Order a tub instead of single samples as it is more cost effective. Also use a Persian market on Via Flavia which has the most reasonable prices on juice, water(you will need lots of water), and fruits. The tourist sites in Rome are awesome. But be prepared to see a filthy city. There are smokers everywhere so there is not much fresh air, and cigarette buttes are everywhere. Rome is full of spitters, litterers, and dog feces. So watch where you are stepping. Public bathrooms in restaurants and other facilities are dirty, and most have no toilet seats on the toilets, bring your own soap/sanitizer, and toilet paper. Bring money as Rome is expensive. Hope this helps everyone. It is not clean and friendly like Canada, but one has to come see Rome. Architecture, history, art, food.

Reviews.Title: “Marcella , Excella”
Reviews.Author: whelan1966
Reviews.Content: Middle aged couple stayed 4 nights March 2012. The hotel is situated in a middle class area,with a well lit street away from the main traffic. The street has an assortment of restaurant/bars/cafe's with a variety of price ranges. The tube (safe) is within 15 minutes steady walk of the hotel. We used a combination of walking and the tube to cover all the main vistor attractions.Reception is helpful ,pleasant with good tips on how to plan your days and nights. The hotel is as described,rooms are decorated to a high standard, impeccably clean and compact, our bed was comfortable but firm. Breakfast is self service with hot and cold options. The roof terrace is a fabulous extra, although the bar prices were above the local average. Summary - Small Room - High Standard Decor - Great base for your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hannah F
Reviews.Content: Young couple, Stayed from friday 23rd to monday 26th March, hotel staff were so friendly and helpful, we were given a map on arrival with a route drawn out to all the major sites worth seeing, as well as bus stops and routes to the further sites, lifesaver and we kept it close all holiday. Our room was beautiful, some may say a bit small but how long do you spend in your room in a city like Rome. We loved it!! Kept beautifully clean and was comfortable and beautifully decorated. Roof terrace was lovely, breakfast was always well stocked and the views are great, drink prices are a bit steep (16 euros for 2 beers!) so would avoid if possible. Great location, 15 minute walk to spanish steps and colosseum (our trusty map never failed) They kept our bags all day free of charge as we checked out at 12 and flight wasnt until 22:00. pre-booked a taxi. all in all an amazing trip and the perfect hotel, would 100% recommend and return :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel close to the action”
Reviews.Author: PrincessVCD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely property March 2012. There were 20 individuals in a variety of rooms. The rooms were clean, bathrooms spotless and the service extraordinary! The rooftop bar and restaurant was a wonderful place to relax in the evening and offered a nice selection of items for breakfast (included). Salvatore was a superstar as he attended to our requests in the evening. Every staff member was a pleasure to speak to or work with. I would and will stay at this property again. Close to Via Veneto and within walking distance of most everything!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable little place well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurTT
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on the edge of the main sightseeing area but we enjoyed the quiter location. For anyone reasonably fit all the main sights are within walking distance, Trevi Fountain 20 mins, Spanish Steps 25 mins, Colloseum 25 mins, Vatican or Trastevere 1 hour, If you can do it, walking is certainly the best way to see Rome, otherwise a 2 day pass on the red "110 Open Bus" is a good way to get about. There are a number of nearby restaurants, we tried La Locanda di Bacco and Pentolaccia, both good. Reception was friendly with good English. Our room 514 was high up at the back so no street noise at all. The room was fairly small but nicely presented, carpets looked brand new and although the bed at first felt rock hard it was surprisingly comfortable and with really good pillows. The bathroom was large with a shower cubicle rather than a bath, (this suited us) and had been recently refurbished. The Hotel is clearly keeping up good standards of maintenance in the rooms and public areas. The roof top bar and garden has panoramic views including St Peters, but is the only bar in the hotel so hope for fine evenings. Barmen Salvatore and Dalio were excellent, first class service with a good sense of humour. Prices were a little high on the roof, 8 Euro for a beer, 14 Euro for G&T or an Amaretto, 8 Euro for a glass of wine. Mini Bar in the room was much cheaper, 5 Euro for a beer. Breakfast is also served on the roof but in a covered area so no problems with weather. Choices are the usual bacon & eggs, cold meats, fruits and cereals and some hard to resist Italian chocolate cake. All the staff we dealt with were very friendly polite and helpful, taxis appeared within about three minutes. Just one man we took a dislike to, possibly management? ( large sun glasses and permanent fag in mouth) who chastised us like naughty children for offering a peanut to an inquisitive Pigeon on the roof. Overall we really enjoyed our visit to Rome and the Marcella, we would very happily return. If you dont need to be dead centre this cosy little place is highly recommended. But dont feed the Pigeons!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: The site shows that everyone has different expectations, and some reviews seem malicious. We can only say that having taken the adivce of the site, the hotel lived up to its praise. We listened to those who complained of the size of the rooms, and booked a premium room, which turned out a small suite. It was comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff were all extremely helpful and cheerful, and when we asked them for help with a taxi for the airport, it was there within 5 minutes. Breakfast is served on the roof, with a good panoramic view of Rome. We felt that the price we paid for 3 nights at 439 Euro was very competitive ebaring in mind we were in the centre of a major capital city, and are already planning our next trip. The hotel is located just off the Via Septembre XX, and close to station. Good walking distance from the Opera, not so close if the Vatican is your major reason for visiting Rome. Believe the good reviews, discount the poor ones is my advice

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay experience!!”
Reviews.Author: brooke i
Reviews.Content: the moment we arrived at the marcella we loved it! the staff at the hotel were great, our room was clean and nice, our favourite part was the roof top bar which has the best buffet breakfast in the mornings! would 100% stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emmalouise222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in march 2012. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are small but perfectly formed with a shower in the bathroom. Comfy bed, nice enough decor. The rooms aircon seemed to not be working (326) which wasnt too much of an issue because of the time of year. However the only thing that was bad about the hotel was the awful noise during the WHOLE NIGHT!!! Whether you had the window open or closed there really was no difference in the noise that came from the street below at ALL HOURS! Bins being emptied during the night, people walking past in heels, glass being broken, traffic,people talking, you really could hear it all. I would advise anyone to ask for a room away from the road, or take earplugs. The hotel has a lovely garden rooftop area which is nice to relax on if the sun is out, a cappacino costs 4 euros and the drinks can add up a bit. The breakfast is from 7-10am and is adequate as included in the price. The hotel is within walking distance of most attractions, although we got a tour bus to the vatican which was a fair way. Over the road was a nice place for tea, which had a lovely lit up outside area which served great value food starting at 14 euros, for which you got stacks to eat. Also not too far a walk was a lovely restaurant called Lo stil novo, a great place for a more stylish evening out, around a ten minute walk away and voted no 23 on TA.

Reviews.Title: “Charged 80 euros for a late check out”
Reviews.Author: lewis107
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is lovely and Salvatore the barman was the star. Thanks to Salvatore he made the stay special. The Hotel is really central (can walk to most of the major sites) and the roof terrace is a really nice place to relax. It was my husband's 60th birthday whilst we were there and I was a bit disappointed that the hotel itself did not put itself out in any way. For example the taxi they had confirmed had been booked did not turn up at the airport when we arrived. Even although this is a service the hotel states it provides. The manager charged us an additional charge of 80 euros to keep the room for a few extra hours as we had a late flight. A bit more effort and this hotel could be excellent instead of just good. Rome was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God, I´m in love! :-)”
Reviews.Author: pyff
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for the first time ever this March and I simply fell in love with this beautiful city! Hotel Marcella Royal did make our stay even better since we were simply overwhelmed by the service of this hotel. The rooms are not big, but meticulously cleened every day (one day we had the "do not disturb sign" on the door until 1 pm since my friend wasn´t feeling well, and still they had cleened our room when we came back at night). The room decor is..........special :-), we had mirrors everywere in our room but we just thought that it was funny. The beds are suprisingly comfortable fot southern Europe.The shower cabin wasn´t big but adequate and there was always hot water. All the common areas in the hotel is as cleen as the rooms. Breakfast is wonderful and plentiful, there are bread, ham, cheese, sausage, yoghurt, cereal, pastries, bacon and the best scrambled eggs I have ever tasted! You can order espresso or capucino from the waiters at no extra cost. The breakfast area isn´t big, but the view is!! The street is small and kind of quiet but there are still at least 10 restaurants on the street. We thought that the hotel was situated perfectly. The staff at this hotel is wonderful, helpful, extremely nice an service minded, they are just fantastic!! I can´t praise them enough actually. I would definitly recomend everyone to choose hotel for a stay in Rome. I will surely return to the Marcella Royal at my next visit to this beautiful city. I´m in love with both Rome and the Marcella Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Three times....still a winner”
Reviews.Author: rpell1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on 3 separate occassions over the past 6 years. Each and every time, we are completely delighted with not only the room, but the service, the staff the concierge, the restaurant, the bar and the general feeling of comfort. This is not a 5 star hotel....but frankly, I am more comfortable in this hotel. Should we return to Rome again.....guess where we plan to stay....again?

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views and Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Viking59Orkney
Reviews.Content: On a recent short break we stayed at the Marcella Royal. This hotel is located very close to the Termini train station, which is the hub for everything in Rome, and to get to the countryside or another city. It's also located within a 10-20 min walk to everything, and the furthest landmark, the Vatican, is about a 45-1hr walk. The breakfast was a particular highlight with many options offered on the buffet; items were very quickly restocked by attentive staff when necessary. However, it is the roof terrace where the breakfasts and other meals are served which steals the show with stunning panoramic views across the skyline of Rome. If you are lucky you'll see a magnificent sunset. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean and all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I would definately recommend to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellerfr0mgreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in January 2012 in a double room at the 5th floor. The room was medium size with large bathroom and LCD TV. The staff were friendly and entertaining. The roof top is the best place to start your day in Rome! The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from Piazza Barberini (& metro station) and 15 minutes from Repubblica metro station. Tip: Restaurant La Pentollacia is a nice restaurant to visit for a romantic dinner! Maybe you need to make a reservation if you want to go to eat between 20.00-21.30 Cons: Internet connection was slow :( during all the days we stayed...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: janye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in October 2011. The roof top became our start and end to the day. Good drinks, and the view is great

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: 2togo2enjoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marcella Royal in March for an anniversary treat. Not a bad little hotel, away from the main hustle of Rome. Check in was quite efficient and our room was ok, although was quite dark as it had shutters on the windows that would not stay open and our window looked out onto the wall of other buildings. The roof terrace was too cold to use in March and as there isn't another bar we ended up getting our drinks and taking them down to the reception to drink which was ok but not ideal, also the drinks are very pricey, if we had realised how expensive we would have stayed at the restaurant where we had dinner for after dinner drinks. Breakfast was ok if you only want continental breakfast, wasn't over impressed with their cooked breakfast but maybe we have been spoilt by british hotels full english. The restaurant overlooks the rooftops of Rome which sounds idealic but in reality is a view of more satelite dishes than you can count. We visited all the usual tourist traps and had a guided tour of the Vatican which we prebooked with Viators which was really good and well worth the money as our tour guide was really good and it enabled us to beat the queues, however we also booked a selfguided tour which was good as we wanted to backtrack over some of the things we had seen with the Viator guide but if you are not with a tour guide you cannot follow exactly the same route which was a bit annoying. St Peters is huge and everything is Rome is enormous. Visited the Colleseum but was more impressed by the one that we had seen in Tunisia. The Roma pass is well worth getting as it covers all your travel on the Metro and the buses, if you have only every been on the London Underground you MUST experience the Rome Metro, it only has 2 lines, A and B but they are very efficient and the buskers on them have to be seen. Castel S'Angelo is worth a visit although thier coffee shop is expensive as is everywhere in Rome for eating and drinking. A lot of the museums etc are shut on Mondays which is worth noting if you are on a short break and want to see as much as possible don't include Monday as a day to visit attractions. We used a restaurant just down the road from the hotel that they recommended called La Pentollacia which was really nice and very friendly and although not cheap was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel (but noisy at night)”
Reviews.Author: Tami_Sutcliffe
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights from November 4 to 7, 2011. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful, We took the Leonardo Express from FCO to the Termini station when we flew into Rome, then walked to the hotel. It was bit of a hike with luggage, but not incredibly difficult as the streets are fairly oedestrian-friendly. Our room (#326) was ready at 10 in the morning when we arrived and the service throughout the stay was great. The breakfast in the morning on the terrace was amazing: even in November, the views are inspiring. Each day was the same, but that is usually the case in buffet-style breakfasts: eggs, bacon, bagels, tea, free cappuccino, fresh juice, yogurt and muffins. No fresh fruit, but not much is in season in November so we were happy with canned peaches. We were catching a cruise out of Civitavecchia (the port about an hour from Rome), so we took the train to the port, also, which was an easy and uneventful experience ( 7 euros each versus $100 USD for shuttles or cabs) It can be challenging getting heavy bags off the steep, narrow train stairs alone, though, so be prepared. Do NOT miss the gelato shop around the corner from the Marcella Royal: Caruso's at 13 Via Collina (literally half a block away.) There are ATMs near the hotel, and several good cafes with pizza and salads at reasonable prices. Our only complaints were that the room was tiny (very nice, quite comfortable and perfectly clean, just very very small) and the noise at night outside in the city can be astonishing (trash trucks, motor bikes, noisy walkers and heaven knows what else.) Ask for a room AWAY from the street if possible. The street views are great but the noise was intense. ALso, at times the free wifi in the room was spotty (so we wnet downstairs to the free PC in the lobby) but the good cafe right next door made up for that: try the linguini with clams for 4 euros along with a huge glass of white wine- ah- Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good quality”
Reviews.Author: UncleGobo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Nov. 2011 and found it perfect for my needs. - Staff and reception were very friendly and helpful - Location isn't in middle of tourist areas but is about a 15 minute walk from most - General good quality of rooms and decor etc. - Nice roof terrace for breakfast or a drink - I can't remember comparisons exactly, but I think it was good value compared to similar hotels in other areas of the city

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TR2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the begining of November, it is tucked away in a small road but only 10 minutes walk to most attractions, the Vatican being one of the further takes about 15 - 20 minutes to walk, although there is a metro station nearby if you wanted to take that. The lobby is very well appointed and the staff were very prompt and efficient. The room we stayed in, although compact, was very well furnished and clean. Breakfast is served in the roof terrace which also has a conservatory type room for when the weather is inclement. Breakfast is buffet style and consisted on bacon and eggs, continental pastries, meats and cheeses. The view from the roof is very nice as well as you can see most of the city from here. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rome in the summer”
Reviews.Author: nfero
Reviews.Content: my brother and i had the week offf and wanted to spend a few days in rome. I have visted Rome many times but this had his first trip. the Hotel came up as a good choice as it was situated really near the sites and everything was easy to get to from the Hotel. The lobby looked great,i also liked the roof-top area where we had our breakfast it gave a great view of the city and was lovely. the staff were pleasant and helpful. we were given basic tourist advice and how to get around which made us feel confident and helped us plan our stay. the hotel is mainly a bed and breakfast and serves a limited food menu if needed but as we were out most of the time this suited us. the hotel rooms were clean and well kept. i woould love to visit rome again and stay at the same place its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: catfishgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Marcella Royal Hotel, Rome, (to celebrate her 'special' birthday) for 3 nights recently and had a lovely time. The room was larger than average on the 6th floor (616) It was furnished to a high standard and was immaculately clean. The beds were on the firm side, but that, obviously, is a personal choice. It was the little touches that counted, such as the turn down service, complete with sweets left on the pillow and a little card wishing us a goodnight's sleep. The staff were very friendly, in particular Salvatore,Marco and Manuel. The girls on the desk (sorry-didn't get your names) were very helpful with directions and suggestions. Not to mention the Italian lessons! Breakfast was more than adequate. Cereals, fruit (fresh) yoghurts,various breads,cakes, croissants, cold meats, cheese, scrambled eggs and bacon, toast, not to mention coffee and various teas. The service was excellent with plates cleared away quickly, but you were not rushed. I got the impression that it was very much a family run hotel, with 'family' checking that everything was running smoothly - which it was - like clockwork, The roof terrace was delightful be it for breakfast, lunch, dinner or just a drink. We made use the terrace as often as we could as the views were wonderful, particularly the sunsets over St Peter's. The hotel is not too far from the main attractions. The stop for the city hop-on tour bus is a 10 minute walk away, the tickets for this can be bought from the hotel reception desk. There are a few restaurants close to the hotel and a cash machine. As two women travelling alone, we felt completely safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and indeed intend to return one day. Do take good walking shoes as you can see something around every corner when walking, which you would miss using the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Italy”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: We stayed int this hotel for one week in April and we found it to be abxolutly charming and a very good value for the money. The breakfast was upstairs on the top floor overlooking the entire city and was delicious and quite ample to say the least. We will definatly go back to this hotel and stay again.Close to termini train station and out of the way quiet in the evening. Good restaurants closeby.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, charming hotel. Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nappywanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised by how lovely it was. I had chosen it based on the comments here on TripAdvisor, but you never know what you're going to get until you arrive. Fortunately, I was not disappointed. It is a great value for your money. I had to wait about a half an hour for my room, but they upgraded me from a single room to a double at no extra cost, which was great. I had a nice, quiet room (214) at the end of the second floor, which was small, but suited my needs perfectly. The room was recently revovated so it was very modern and clean, with a super comfortable bed, and a terrific bathroom and shower. The wi-fi for the most part worked very well in the room and throughout the hotel although it was not as reliable late at night. The multilingual staff at the front desk were all very knowledgeable and helpful. On my first day, they recommended a fabulous restaurant (La Pentolaccia), which was by far my favorite restaurant during the trip. The 7th floor patio was also exceptionally nice. The breakfast is basic, but again, it suited my needs perfectly with eggs, bread, cheese, pastries and other items. It was definitely better than just a regular continental breakfast. After a long d of ay of sight seeing it was always nice to visit the patio for a late-night drink. Salvatore who serves the drinks is an absolute sweetheart! He will keep you entertained and give you lots of helpful tourist advice if you need it. The hotel location is perfect and it is very easy to walk to most locations like the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The Vatican is a bit further, but very easy to reach with the local transportation. And if you're up for a nice long walk, it's very doable. I walked back from the Vatican to the hotel stopping at the Pantheon and the Piazza Navona on the way and it was fine. As a female traveling solo, it was very important that I felt safe, and the hotel is in a great area and not once during my walks around town did I feel worried. An great trip overall and I have to thank the Marcella Royal for making it such a special one. I look forward to staying here again. P.S.: Just a warning, if you are taking a cab from FCO airport, make sure you get a licensed cab with a meter. I was charged a $75 flat rate when I should have paid $40-50. If you want to be safe, Book airport transportation directly with the hotel since it is a service that they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Centre of Rome near trevi fountain and transport”
Reviews.Author: Deisebabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and found it to be: reasonably priced, clean and lovely rooms, comfy bed, fantastic shower. Hotel has a rooftop restaurant where you have breakfast (a nice breakfast, fresh food and juices etc). Its close to the trevi fountain (walking distance) and close to metro station. 1euro to get a metro straight to the vatican. Same for the colosseum. Its close to lots of nice restaurants. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki W
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fortnight in Italy the first week being spent in Rome. We were delighted with the hotel, the room was clean, the rooftop terrace a luxury in the warm weather and the staff ready to help in any way. We ordered a basket of fruit for our arrival which was very refreshing and welcome particularly at the end of the day as there were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Everything was within walking distance and the metro easy to use especially with three day ticket. The ice cream parlour just around the corner was lovely and Salvatore in the bar will recommend some excellent restaurants within the immediate vicinity. We would recommend this hotel and stay here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Andyd9
Reviews.Content: Firstly the two slightly negative points been mentioned before. The location, yes a walk to main sights but as hotel says only 8 minutes to main train station for tube and we walked to Trevino fountain in just over 15 minutes. However the area is an upmarket area and when open there are some great delis and restaurants. Secondly the room size, small but at the end of the day do you need a big room? Surely if making the most of the trip the time spent in the hotel room should be minimal. We enjoyed our stayed got some good recommendations and when a transport strike hit were given advice on which buses should be working and which wouldn't. Would recommend this place for anyone not looking to really splash out.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Roma”
Reviews.Author: PATravelbugg
Reviews.Content: Wow - you will get more than you can imagine from this hotel. The view is incredible, the staff is exceptional, the breakfast is plentiful (be sure and ask for cappuccino) and the rooms are large. We stayed 3 different times in 3 weeks and had room 530 for the first 2 stays which is a very large corner room with 2 balconies. It needs a little face lift and will be getting one soon. Our 3rd stay was on the second floor, rooms have all been renovated and they are WONDERFUL. We had a quiet room overlooking Il Caruso Geleteria which is obviously Rome's most popular gelato. It is open from 12 - 12 and it is always busy and you must go - you will see why. It is the most delicious food product on the planet! The staff at the bar was so welcoming and drinks were pricey but the view makes it all worth while. Hotel is very walkable to most sights and the metro is not far away. One of my favorite sights while visiting Rome this time was the Villa Borghese. It is a museum in a beautiful park near the zoo. You can walk here from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TheQuailes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella Royal for four nights in Semptember 2011. When we first arrived the staff were very helpful and were happy to confirm an excursion we had pre booked. Once we had dropped the bags off in the room, we went straight to the roof terrace for a drink and we were blown away by the view (the dome of St Peters Basilica and the rooftops of Rome). The drinks were a little pricey at the hotel, but which hotel bars aren't (we were offered cocktails at a reduced price between 4:30pm and 10:00pm). The room was decorated very tastefully and was plenty spacious, air con worked well and was very welcome, as when we visited the temperatures were between 35/36 degrees celcius (as with most European rooms there were no tea/coffee making facilities, but it's a minor point, however there was a mini bar in the room - not badly priced). The breakfast was a nice self service buffet style, the staff are just there to repenish or remove dishes and re-dress the tables, so don't expect them to serve you; they will wish you a good day if you make the slightest effort towards them. The location of the hotel was good, there are many restaurants in the nearby streets, if you walk around a little and if you were staying for a week you still won't have enough evenings to have eaten in all of them. The metro is a short 5/10 minute walk away (at Repubblica) and we found this the easiest way to get from the hotel to central Rome or anywhere in Rome that you would wish to go (we purchased a three day travel pass for €11 each, which covers unlimited use of the metro and the buses - possibly even covers travel on the tram, but we did not use it, a single metro journey is only one euro each) so the location we thought was good. I am almost certain that the closer you stay to the centre of Rome the more expensive everything will be, so for that reason this is an very good hotel in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: aobrien33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the Termini train station, which is the hub for everything in Rome, and to get to the countryside or another city. It's also located within a 10-20 min walk to everything, and the furthest landmark, the Vatican, is about a 45-1hr walk. Rome is beautiful, take it in with walking trips. If you can't, bus is great. The hotel is located on a quiet side street, very nice lobby, and decorated with traditional Italian grandiose colours and patterns. Rooms are spacious, well appointed, and the bathrooms are very nice, and new. The rooftop terrace on the 7th floor (also where they serve the free, large buffett breakfast) is breathtaking during the day, and very nice at night as well. You can see the entire city from up there, and it's a wonderful spot to have a drink with the lovely and knowledgable Salvatore! He is the bartender/waiter go to guy on the top deck, and he's an absolute pleasure to be around. He goes out of his way to chat, and to do everything he can to make your time there pleasant. When ordering a Nastro Azzura pint from Salvatore, he'll always remind you, "It's the best beer in the world my friend!" Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pam C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 4 nights before and after a trip to Sorrento. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel very welcome, and all of the staff were extremely friendly and very willing to help. Our room was immaculately clean and we had been allocated a quiet location as requested - overlooking the side strreet where the amazing Il Caruso Gelateria was situated. The continental breakfast was adequate, as were the light meals offered on the evening menu. The staff were happy to tell us about other restaurants in the area and we enjoyed a meal at La Pentolaccia which was recommended by Salvatore. The hotel is a litttle way out of the centre, but Termini station is not too far away, and we took advantage of the open topped bus tour to get our bearings and then managed to walk to most of the sights we wanted to see. Bring a good pair of walking shoes and plenty of sun cream as it was very hot!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and free wireless internet.”
Reviews.Author: Wandering03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only two nights, but we had a comfortable stay. The room was comfortable enough and all the required amenities were provided. The breakfast was a particular highlight with many options offered on the buffet; items were very quickly restocked by attentive staff when necessary. The rooftop bar was beautiful, but we didn't have time to take much advantage of it. The location was convenient enough...walking distance from the Termini train station. This was our third visit to Rome, so we didn't take too much advantage of the reception. However, they were extremely helpful when we needed assistance with arranging our return airport transfer. The free wireless internet in the rooms was a treat with a fast connection. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, pity about the beds!”
Reviews.Author: regulartraveller61
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful trip from Rome and a Cruise on the Royal Clipper Tall Ship for my 50th. Stayed 3 nights prior and 1 night on return from the cruise. The hotel is within walking distance of the termini and close enough to the majority of the attractions, just make sure you are wearing comfortable shoes. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. The rooms were elegantly furnished and having stayed in two different rooms we realised that they had their own individuality. The only down side was the lack of comfort when it came to the beds. I sleep on a firm mattress but have to admit that the beds were hard even for me. The breakfasts were adequate and were held on the top floor which was made into a garden terrace (there was a covered area if you didn't want to eat outside). Like most of Rome the prices for their drinks and evening meals were a little expensive for what you got, but never the less it was acceptable. The location of the hotel's rooftop restaurant gave rather a nice view of the sunsets and you could see St Peters along with the rest of the city's skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely roof terrace - loud music at breakfast spoiled it.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerNick
Reviews.Content: Room was OK, clean and good shower. Hotel was nice enough and they had an outstanding roof terrace. Had very pleasant waiter in the evening when we had cocktails who looked after us really well and it was a great location to watch the sun go down. We had a different experience in the morning when we went for breakfast. Firstly there was very loud music going on at 8.00 am and a major reluctance by the rather indifferent waiting staff to turn it down. Tea and coffee were available to help yourself to but you had to specifically ask for a freshly made cappuccino which they did not initially volunteer. There was also a major wasp problem up there with about 6-8 around the table at any one time. I later went and spoke to a senior looking gentleman on reception about both the wasps and the loud music at breakfast and he was indifferent and shrugged his shoulders and said he would pass it on but clearly was not going to do anything. It is a nice enough hotel but wasps and music did not enhance our enjoyment of breakfast on lovely terrace. Also there are two restaurants next to each other just opposite as you turn right out of hotel. One was excellent and the other awful. Avoid the one furthest from hotel with hard sell people outside. Go for first one nearest hotel which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: Svein
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a short taxi ride from Roma termini station, € 6. From the hotel to Colossem, I paid € 8. From the hotel to the airport Rome FCO I paid € 40. Room was very nice, and bigger than I had expected. Flat screen tv, nice furniture, and modern bathroom. I stayed in the 6th. floor. The 7.th floor is the roof terrace, where also the free breakfast area is. Since most houses in Rome are not higher than this, you can see a long distance from the roof. In the evening, there was a one-man live music band, and it was nice to sit there watching the sundown with a glass of wine from the rooftop bar. Recetion employees very helpful. A few restaurants near by, within less than 5 min walk. The hotel has an elegant appearance, and i got the doubleroom for € 78 using Priceline. Room was very quiet, no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best out of a bad bunch”
Reviews.Author: trooper777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella in November 2010 for my wife's 40th. Took about 55 minutes from the airport to reach this hotel, bearing in mind this was about 10am in the morning, so a little rush hour traffic. Located in a quiet residential area which we liked. Very nicely laid out reception and friendly staff I have to stay and are keen to speak englilsh. Rooms are beautifully decorated, the only this was that our room had a view of the court yard..not a big deal realy as we were not in the room long, only to drop bags, and sleep! Within walking distance of good amenities, like small bars, bus stops and some local shops. Breakfast could have been better but that's down to choice. located on the roof top with beautiful view of room. There is internet availble but at a cost, around 10euro..but the voucher will last for 24 hours of usage, doesn't mean it will run out in 24 hours time, so it's worth it...even at a small premium. I've checked many hotels around Rome, and to be honest, Marcella ticked most of the boxes for us, so if you are looking and don't mind a little bit of walking to see some of the local sites, then book yourself in!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICO!! ..... honest review from a BRIT.”
Reviews.Author: ClanKelly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is wonderful. We had room 530 and therefore had a lounge area and 2 balconies. The bed a little hard but all destinations and hotels have hard beds. Extremeley clean. Air con very much appeciated after a day out. Turned it off at night otherwise we would have got cold, turned it back on in the morning.. Shower worked very very well, bathroom excellent. Quiet location but not too far away to be able to walk to where it is busy. Staff very lovely, kind, helpful and will do anything for you. The roof terrace is fabulous, spending breakfast looking over Rome. In the evening it is a delightful place to be supping drinks and chatting. Salvatori, the head barman is brilliant. The Terrace is a perfect place to re-charge your batteries after a day of sightseeing or coming back from dinner at the numerous places to eat. Piazza Narvona - Dolce Vito I would highly reccommend. Osteria next to the Trivi Fountain is another lovely place to eat. YOU MUST like walking. Rome is small compared to alot of cities and the best way to travel is to walk. Advisable to have an Open Bus Tour. we got the '110' 2 day pass for 18 Euros each... they are all much of a muchness. Great way to get your barings and to see the sights. The Spanish Steps are beautiful also. Shopping is expensive and so is eating out, however, look around, there are places suited to every purse. If you have anything...... make it a Gelleto (Italian Ice Cream)... it is to die for and very refreshing. Heaven in a cone! We went to Roma 20th until 24th July. A celebration of my 40th birthday. It was wonderful. It was hot 29', but not sticky. If you go to the Vatican, I would reccommend that you have a pre-paid guided tour. (book this on the internet before you go). There is so much History that you will not be able to take it all in, however it does give you a great insight to the histories that surround it. Well worth the money. Nothing worse than wondering around a landmark and not knowing anything about it. So book a tour!! Remember, no bare legs or shoulders. So short shorts are a no no and cover up the shoulders with a small shawl. There is always someone around to sell you this outside for a few Euros. Because of the nature of our trip, we didn't take our children, saying that, it would not have been a holiday for children unless your kids love walking, people watching at cafes and being drowned in history and looking at many many statues. Our kids are 14 and 12yrs and this would not have been their cuppa tea whatsoever. At the main attractions, they get very busy. Patience is a virtue, you need virtues. Remember you are on holiday, there is no time limit, there is no rush... When eating out, the waiters love you to stay so when asking for the bill, they may take some time getting it, this is normal... We loved it. The Hotel, the area and the whole ambience of Roma. We will deffo be going back and to that very hotel also..... so that speaks volumes in itself!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but felt a little more remote than we expected”
Reviews.Author: ReadingDave
Reviews.Content: We booked our visit through Osprey Holidays. The trip went very smoothly and the hotel was very pleasant. We were attracted by the roof terrace, which is a nice feature. The hotel itself is a good standard and the buffet breakfast is very good. My only real comment about the hotel itself is that the staff were helpful, but some of the reception staff seemed a little cool. Apart from the roof terrace, the other feature that attracted us to this hotel was the location. It seemed to be reasonably close to a number of the tourist spots, although when we were in Rome it felt as though it was a little more remote. The hotel is described as being a 10 minute walk from the Termini station, but I would suggest you would need to walk pretty quickly to achieve that. We bought 3 day Metro tickets, so usually walked to the Repubblica metro station and travelled from there. The hotel doesn't do evening meals (although they can do snacks), so you need to eat out. There are a few restaurants nearby and an excellent gelateria in the street at the side of the hotel. During our stay there was a protest march that travelled up from the Colosseum (where we saw it pass by during the morning) and ended in Via XX Settembre, where there a quite a few government buildings. It meant that there were a lot of people in the area that day and when we were out we could occasionally hear the protest, but it didn't affect our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend too highly!”
Reviews.Author: PAK777
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favourite Rome hotel. I visit Rome at least twice each year and every now and then I test out somewhere different for a night or two (before returning up the hill to the Marcella for the rest of my stay!) Most recently tried were 1) a hotel near the Pantheon and 2) one overlooking the Vatican - both of one more star than the Marcella. They were each close to the historic centre, so the crush of people and the noise was high: restaurants crowded. Rooms were the same size as the Marcella, one had no proper wardrobe. Neither had rooftop gardens. Each was well furnished and well reviewed. At the bigger hotel of the two, staff failed to recognise me or acknowledge me at all during my stay! SO - yes it is a little out of the action and yes you may have to walk (or catch a cab; they are not expensive!) BUT -The outweighing Marcella Royal factors for me: great staff, wonderful rooftop, well cared- for rooms and away from the madding crowd!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, safe, and quiet but away from main tourist sites.”
Reviews.Author: IronmanNC
Reviews.Content: Typical european sized rooms, small for US standards. Very clean bathrooms, tiny shower in our double room. Safe neighborhood, good non touristy places to eat, excellent gellato place around corner, and atm right across street. On bus line, easy to use. Very friendly an helpful staff. Skip the coffee @ breakfast and ask for a capacinno, they are complimenary and better than starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with amazing rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: paulie13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel from 08th to the 11th of July and would certainly stay here again should we be lucky enough to find ourselves back in Rome. The room we stayed in was basic, but spotless, and the air conditioning ensured we returned to a lovely cool room each evening, after a days walking in the sweltering sun. We never ate dinner in the restaurant (there are many lovely restaurants nearby) but loved ending each evening with a drink on the beautiful rooftop terrace, which provided beautiful views across Rome. Breakfast was lovely, with a wide choice on offer. Within walking distance to the Metro (Repubblica) but still far away from the hustle and bustle, the location is perfect. The only downside was the price of a beer, which, at €8, does add up. Overall, we were both extremely happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: handpb
Reviews.Content: On arrival at hotel, our room was not ready, however this was because we arrived earlier than planned. We were able to leave our bags while we went for lunch close by. The concierge and bell-boy were fantastic. We received lots of knowledgable information about sights/walking routes/restaurants, with a sense of humour. We stayed three nights, breakfast was adequate, the rooftop terrace was fantastic (but a little pricey) and The location was convenient for walking to/from most attractions. The room itself was clean (if not a little outdated), the shower was quite powerful. The only thing was we had a locked, adjoining room, and our neighbours were quite noisy. All-in-all, a good hotel for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it, don't understand the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: across92
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of July. Multilingual staff are friendly and helpful, and the rooms are very clean and spacious, if a little old fashioned in the decor. Air con works fine, showers are hot etc. A lovely gesture was when the roses we had bought and put in a plastic cup from the bathroom were put in a vase by the maid when we were out. Breakfast is the sort of standard you would expect to be charged extra for, lots of variety (pastries, cheese, meat, cereal toast etc) and always plenty even if you don't get there till 9.40. Bacon and eggs was a nice surprise. Lovely view from the restaurant, can see over all the houses, there is a view of st paul's and the sunset is lovely. Only ate there one night as the food and drinks are more expensive than in the restaurants surrounding the hotel. Nice for a coffee though. The hotel is not RIGHT in the centre, but it is only a short walk from the Trevi fountain (15 mins), and the train station in the other direction (5 mins). We got around fine by walking and occasionally catching the metro to get to the sights which are a bit further out like the Colosseum. Really easy and we saw everything we wanted to. If you do choose to stay here I would really recommend the restaurants in the area. One in particular is il sorriso just opposite the hotel. Very simple, lovely italian food, (my boyfriend said the steak was the best he ever had) set menus from 14 euros, friendly staff (especially the younger girl who works there) and little extras such as a plate of biscotti and a glass of house wine which come with the bill. So nice we went back on the last night. It surprises me that there are any bad reviews for this hotel, none of them reflect our experience and some of them are downright weird. (a ghost?) I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are a couple and it is your first visit, as was with us. I only wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: leroy_mrtn
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you like tiny rooms, dirty carpet, bathrooms that are falling apart and air conditioners that don't work. Oh, I forgot to mention you'll be walking a lot, too. It's far away from anything you would want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: purdypjs
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights before moving on to Paris and out of 3 hotels in 3 countries this was outstanding. The staff make you feel important! Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. If ever in Rome again I will book at Marcella Royal Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the Rooftop Garden/Bar/Restaurant was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: blic57
Reviews.Content: Started our trip there, left for the Cinque Terre and had to come back to Marcella. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be staying here again. Dont stay here if you dont want your passport stolen”
Reviews.Author: tac0matraveler
Reviews.Content: First, lets start off with the location. Although on the website and in person they say many things are 15 minutes way, add another 15 to 30 minutes to any amount they give you. It is really as east in the city as you can get. Also, dont let the pictures of the roof garden fool you. I think there was zooming and photoshoping involved. Second, within the time we went from checking in to going to our room our passports got stolen. The staff was very unhelpful (they were more helpful to the woman who needed to change her hair appointment). We spend our first night walking to the local police station (which was not 15 minutes away like the staff said). However, after throwing a fit and continually raising the issue with the staff and Pino the bellhop (who when we asked about the people we thought may have taken them, all of the sudden didnt speak English), we found all three passports (minus a missing map) under the the bed spread of the bed we did not have a chance to undue (this is after Pino indicated that we would find the passports in our room). Third, the roof top garden is nice and the breakfest is nice. However if you get seconds, leave someone behind because the wait staff is quick and will clear your stuff and papers before you get back. Finally, the room was small with a nice bathroom, and had cable tv with a few channels in English. The view was into the into an inner court yard facing other buildings so we kept the window closed. However, given its small size it was suprising that the AC wont cool the room. Also the first night, room service did not replenish the shampoos which we needed.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I'd return.”
Reviews.Author: AaronRadez
Reviews.Content: It wasn't awful. It just wasn't good. This property is in a fair location, providing fair accommodations at less than fair prices. It was dated and dusty with cramped rooms and bathrooms, the linens and carpet looked worn. It'll do the trick for a few nights, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: bterway
Reviews.Content: The room had a terrible odor in it, no vent in the bathroom. Breakfast was good, location was ok. Biggest surprise was the 600 Euro bill they hit me with when I was leaving. I challenged them on it, but they said it is in the computer so I challenged them to produce receipts that I signed for so much. It took a while, but it finally came down to the 140 that I charged for food and drinks in my five day stay. For the price, it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: SDEERE
Reviews.Content: This place is hostel quality. In fact, I have stayed at nicer hostels than this supposed "boutique" hotel. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Would have liked to recommend - if not for the mattress”
Reviews.Author: fairguy
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with good service and value for the price. The staff is friendly and both breakfast and nightcap drinks are held at the rooftop bar/restaurant. The only real issue we had was the our mattress was unusually hard - such that we had a hard time sleeping. We requested a padded foam to cover it with but that was not done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marcella Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olie079
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella Royal Hotel for 4 days before our cruise. We loved it. The location was great, we were able to walk to all the sights, including the Colosseum. Breakfasts were excellent and it was most enjoyable overlooking the sights of Rome and there was a good choice of both hot and cold. We always looked forward to a quiet drink at the Rooftop Garden Terrace after a day out pounding the pavements and Salvatore` was always very welcoming and friendly. The rooms were very clean and our room was a lot more spacious than I thought it would be, after reading reviews on European Hotel ... highly recommended. We found a great little Pizza place just around the corner and there were several lovely restaurants in the same street. We would definitely stay here again if ever we get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Joro70
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet. We really enjoyed our stay. Helpfull staff. Rooms a little bit small but confortable. Pool on the roof terrase. Fabulous roof garden full of blooming flowers. Amazing view from the restaurant( it is lokated on the last floor) very ramantic in the evening . We highly recommend it. We were with two kinds and and a grandmother and we all liked it. We went to Pompei by bus, it was amazing!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palola12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome which is a fantastic city but this hotel was a huge disappointment. We were in a suite didn't even rech the standrard of a basic room in the 4 star hotels we have stayedin previously, plastic glasses, cold shower, no bathrobes, not even any conditioner in the shower. The decore was very old fashioned and the breakfast was so terrible we didn't even bother with it after the first morning, Yes the hotel has a roof terrace but mostly offers a view of all the arials on the surrounding properties. On departing the hotel no one even thanked us or said goodbye so I'm afraid I would not be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunsets From The Rooftop Terrace Restaurant....”
Reviews.Author: TerriDougherty
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable little boutique hotel located in the heart of Rome. Our room was spacious and so was the the bathroom with a bedat! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious every morning. Awesome coffe and pastries, they had anything you could ever want! I would definately stay here again. You could walk to The Spanish Stepps, and lots of shopping areas. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location - but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: pinchas7
Reviews.Content: Good location within easy reach of attractions. Clean room, though not quite the size for a 4-star hotel. Reasonable breakfast. But - very noisy with scooter/motorcycle park right under the window, and noise at all times with wondows tightly closed. Don't count on getting accurate information at the reception. We were misguided on 3 occasions (in fact we got 1 correct answer out of 4 questions) - We arrived at 6pm and asked if we could return the car that evening; receptionist said it was too late without checking; only the next morning we found that the neraby Hertz location receives cars until well after midnight! We asked about the MAXXI and were directed to the metro that goes to the far South of city, luckily found out in time that it is in fact at the far North! Asked about the departure terminal for ElAl at Fiumicino and were told it was no. 3, whereas it is no. 5.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: Ronny67
Reviews.Content: went for 3 days 31st march 2011 -2nd april, lovely hotel would definately recommend it. Staff very friendly. Roof bar & eating area lovely. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip. Hotel was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: lifestooshortsoenjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two year old daughter for three nights. Staff were very helpful and supplied a cot in the room for free. The bus stop is right near the hotel and can take you to the main sights no problem. Travelling with a buggy and infant on the buses is interesting... buses are used by the locals and get very busy!! It didnt put us off though. You can purchace a bus ticket (one way) at the hotel desk for 1 euro so great value. Remember to validate the ticket on the bus yourself using the yellow machine. Get a decent street map and you can walk to most of the sights too. (where comfy shoes though!). The only bad thing I can say is the price of a pint of beer at the roof top bar! 8 Euros!!! you can enjoy the view without a drink, then go and get a drink somewhere cheaper :) Breakfast was delicious and also at the roof top resturant. There is a couple of really nice good value resturants just across from the hotel too. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, and not in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust520
Reviews.Content: <i have done a lot of traveling around the world and have not received this poor of service in many places. You can get a much better value many other places in Rome for this price point. The rooms are very outdated, the beds are hard and the front desk service is the worst I have had just about anywhere (except for the very nice young Filipino bellman). Skip this one for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellethwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The location was a bit far from the main sights (almost 15 minutes from Fontana di Trevi) but the bus stop is really close to the hotel. The stuff was excellent. They were very polite, helpful and friendly, especially the male morning receptionist and the bar waiter in the evenings. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The only drawback was that it was a bit small but adequate. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious with all the necessities provided. The breakfast was served on the roof terrace with amazing view. It was delicious. They served both european and american breakfast. It was worth the 120E per night . Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: MTL8
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel for those that like to stay out of the hustle and bustle but want to be within walking distance of the city. It is situated about 10mins walk from the Termini in a quiet street with coffee bars, Deli's and Restaurants close by (The hotel staff recommended some good inexpensive ones). The rooms are clean, the buffet breakfast fresh and tasty and the roof top bar a bonus. We walked to all the major sights, the Vatican the furthest away taking 45mins (probably minutes on the metro and maybe a bit longer on the bus as a result of all the traffic). The Coliseum is awesome - 12 Euros entrance fee and an extra 4 euros for a guided tour (recommended not only as you jump queue but also get the opportunity to experience walking in to the arena) Will definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in rome!”
Reviews.Author: seat_4G
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. First rate staff, large room, and a great breakfast buffet, which included bacon and eggs. Nice quiet street and location. Not the place if you want to be in the middle of the nightlife. Accessability is wonderful with the bus -- the hotel sell single tickets. The tobacco shop around the corner will see you a day ticket. About a 10 -- 15 minute walk to the train station. Bus is easier. When you exit the hotel, turn left, go to the corner. Take a right, and there is a bus stop on the next corner. Or take a left, and it is a bit further up that way. In Dec 2010, at least the 38 bus and the 86 bus (I think) will take you to Termini station (endstop for the lines that way, so you can't miss it). And, one street over is the 92 bus (ask at the front desk), which will take you across town to the Vatican. Definitely learn the bus system -- it beats the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but a little far from the sites”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl089
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was extremely friendly. Breakfast was great. Room was nice. However, the hotel is in a weird location...a little too far away from the center of things. If you like walking/taking buses/cab then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel – simply beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TigEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our week long stay in Italy, Rome was our first stop before going onto Florence. The Marcella Royal hotel was the perfect start to our holiday and was simply beautiful! Our room was at the front of the hotel but was still very quite looking onto a side street. The room had two levels and large comfortable bed, the bathroom as equally large with nice clean towels and good shower. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and the reception area was very pleasant. The highlight has to the be the balcony bar area situated at the top of the hotel which looks over the city and was a great place to sit back with a beer after a long day site seeing! The top floor also houses the breakfast room so once again you get to see the city in its beauty when you start you day. The hotel is located a short walk from the central station and is a nice quite area of Rome with good local restaurants nearby and feels very safe. Overall an excellent hotel and would highly recommend to anyone planning visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: SummerTravelerx4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exquisite! The staff was amazing, helpful, friendly, & attentive. Traveling with four people, I was concerned about the size of the room and when we got there, I was pleasantly surprised. The location was convenient to all public transporation and plenty to see and do within walking distance as well. It was quiet, clean and a great value for our money! The dining area is on the roof which is a breathtaking bonus! Relaxing and enjoyable, it is a wonderful place to begin each day and then gather around again in the evening to talk about the day's adventures! Food was great too. Fresh and a good variety. Love this place!!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel by any standards”
Reviews.Author: PeterDrinkwater
Reviews.Content: The front of hotel is acceptable in a good location but that is where the good stuff stops. Firstly the lifts are some of the smallest that we have every seen in the world and we were on the 6th floor. The bedroom was dirty, untidy and shabby to say the best. There were broken tiles in the small bathroom and the carpet in the bedroom was literally thread bare. The room looked over onto somebody else's balcony and with solid white plastic shutter in the bedroom there was no option but to close them for any privacy. The breakfast was poor being served by waiters that showed little interest and in fact seemed borderline rude. This horrible hotel was so shabby that we only stayed for one night of the three that we had booked and decanted ourselves to a proper 4 star hotel literally just around the corner which was fantastic. If you want expensive rubbish and to pretend that you are in a 4 star hotel then book this place, otherwise save your money and go elsewhere in Rome, there are many better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, not a boutique 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis6723
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects: Very good location, rooftop terrace with nice view, clean rooms Negative aspects : Tiny and dated "double" rooms for 250 Euro each with walls lacking any sound proofing properties, breakfast below average and mostly "tired" staff at the rooftop restaurant. Among the front desk staff, Cinzia distinguished herself as a very polite, friendly, helpful and attentive young lady. I don't think that this hotel really qualifies as a 4-star boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rosequilib
Reviews.Content: A good, friendly and spotlessly clean hotel. One enjoyable feature was that breakfast was served in the attractive rooftop setting where we also sat in the evening for drinks. The room we were originally given was small and uninspiring but after requesting a change of room we were moved to a larger and well-appointed bedroom with a modern bathroom with shower which met our expectations. The breakfasts were adequate. We appreciated the toaster facility, scrambled eggs, urns of coffee, hot water and milk, cereal etc but felt that a wider range of food should have been available for a hotel of this calibre. The hotel manager was most professional and personable, sorting out efficiently our problem with the non-appearance of our taxi to take us to the airport. and keeping us in good humour. A computer is available for guests' use. There were quite a few restaurants of a reasonable standard in the vicinity .

Reviews.Title: “A Clean quite hotel Excellent roof terrace. Handy for many sights”
Reviews.Author: juleseastyorks
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant Hotel that is off the main road and therefore quite. It is near enough to walk to many famous sights and the main buss route is 100 yds away. The roof garden of the hotel for breakfast,evening meals & drinks gives good views over Rome towards the Vatician. Evening meals are only light,but plenty of resturaunts within 100 yds. Staff very helpful and an excellent command of English.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: kray001
Reviews.Content: Whilst there was no particularly negative aspect to register, the whole experience was very average to say the least. Small room, small tv, very small bathroom with no bath, tacky decor - mixture of gold, red and emerald green and very uninspiring breakfast. Room was kept clean and location whilst not prime is close to the train station and the main sites are easily accessible by using the public transport which passes through the parallel 20th September Avenue. Roof garden whilst not having great views is still pretty. Drinks however are a rip off at €8 per liquor. The whole experience was overall disappointing considering the hotel charges €200 per night for a standard double room and bills itself as a first class boutique hotel in the heart of Rome. It was found wanting on every count and at best is to be considered an average 3 star hotel but believes nonetheless they should charge upmarket 4 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good food, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Glevumblues
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff. The roof terrace is a real bonus -an excellent place to eat an excellent breakfast! The bar prices are not the cheapest, but we enjoyed the food and the banter with the bartenders. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. We would have liked a view but we would expect to pay extra for that. The hotel is situated in an area full of government buildings, but it was only a ten minute walk to the nearest metro station and slightly longer to the main railway station. There are several restaurants in the area. They were ok, but nothing special. Overall, we enjoyed our four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A grand place for the grand tour!”
Reviews.Author: GandM2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marcella Royal Hotel as part of our honeymoon trip. We choose the location because of its proximity to Gallery Borghese and within walking distance from the station. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The roof terrace was perfect for a quiet drink with views over Rome although slightly expensive. The room was a little on the small side but clean and elegant. Located on a quiet street with about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ToogyOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in Rome! The rooms were great, and having a drink at the rooftop garden in the late afternoon was perfection! The staff were kind and helpful. This hotel's location is perfect for sightseeing/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda12062710
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. our room was a good size and had a lovely bathroom. The staff on the reception desk made the holiday as they were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them (they spoke excellent english) and were happy to make recommendations on places to eat or visit. The roof top breakfast room is a lovely place to start the day and the breakfast was very good. I would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance personified with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: handing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding anniversary in the Marcella Royal and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The room we had was large, clean, comfortable and furnished to a very high standard. The walls were not papered, but covered in silk fabric with a thin layer of padding underneath - quite exotic really. The staff were extremely helpful, we lost our camera and the reception staff did more than could be expected to try to recover it. When that proved to be impossible they sorted out what needed to be done to report the matter for insurance purposes and phoned several police stations for us to ensure that we found English speaking officers to deal with the situation. The air con in our room failed, and though this may be seen as a problem, it was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The staff moved our belongings to another room for the night, repaired the unit, then moved us back into our original room whilst we were out during the day. Mechanical problems happen, but the way that this was dealt with minimised it to the level of a very minor irritation. The roof terrace at the hotel is magical. For a pre-dinner cocktail or an after dinner drink, it is wonderful. The view over the city skyline, whilst not beautiful in the conventional sense, is amazing and St Peters Basillica can be seen in the distance. The bar staff were always smart, friendly and helpful. There were several bars and restaurants locally, but not in the numbers that are found in the tourist centres. This is reflected in the fact that I have only awarded 4 out of 5 for location. Some places of interest, like the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Berberossa and the Pantheon were within easy walking distance but Piazza Navona and the Vatican required the use of public transport. However a bus stop was situated within 300 yards of the hotel and fares were cheap with tickets on sale at the hotel reception. The walking situation was not helped by the fact that we chose to marry in July and so have to celebrate our anniversary then. Temperatures of 96degrees F do not encourage walking and we would have probably walked more if it had been cooler. The price we paid seemed quite reasonable and probably reflects the location of the hotel relative to the sites of the city. However, I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for a very good standard of acommodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Rome rewarding”
Reviews.Author: puddockStevenston
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel is one I would gladly recommend to anyone. It may not be sited close to the major attractions but it is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest underground station. This means you can access most of the major sites yet retreat to peace and quiet at the end of the evening. The roof terrace is great to eat breakfast on and also to enjoy a glass of wine in the evening before setting off or on your return. Wine is better priced than other drinks. The bar staff are absolute gems - old fashioned courtesy abounds. Hotel rooms in Rome can be small so it is better to book a Superior room as we did. The local area is full of small restaurants. We only had one bad meal in a week which is pretty good. There is also a fantastic wine bar at the end of the street called Marchetti. The owner is Marco - a true gentleman. It's not cheap as he only serves the best wines, spirits and food but we went there at the end of each evening. As in any big city, you have to beware of pickpockets and scams. Don't t accept the 'free' rose from the people in the main tourist areas as it is probably marking you out and beware of gypsies with 'babies' in the underground. Apart from that - enjoy. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our Italian vacation”
Reviews.Author: janetlcam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in four hotels in four Italian cities on our recent trip, all supposedly 4 star, and Marcella Royal was by far the best. Great location, helpful staff, beautiful rooftop dining and drinking with a great breakfast. Near to many things yet you feel secluded. Extremently HOT in July and A/C in our other hotel rooms was non-existent, but here worked great. We found the beds at each Italian hotel to be very hard, including here, but this bed was slightly more comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel.
