Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DermWill
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel was excellent. The hotel is located on a sidestreet off of the main roads but in walking distance to major attractions (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Colosseum) and the subway. Rooms were fine (you're not getting a large room in Rome). The rooftoop garden was a great way to relax and have a drink after a long day of walking. The staff were great in recommending and making reservations at restaurants, arranging taxis, and pointing us in the right direction for our daily jaunts throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ljh50806
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor reviews are spot on for this hotel & for cocktail waiter Salvatore's hospitality and his cocktails. You get what you pay for - worth every penny - could not fault rooms, service etc. Being fit, you can walk to most of the main sights. You must eat at La Pentolaccia, on Via Flavia, just along from the hotel - wonderful food & service.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Karen013
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel! It was my second visit and the service and style was just as I remembered. The beauty of this hotel is in part its location - it is just outside of the mayhem of the Trevi but within a 10 minute stroll. This means you have all of the ease of access but without the noise and traffic. It's on a quiet street that is literally packed with lovely places to eat without necessarily having to break the bank. The real jewel of this hotel is the rooftop restaurant and bar. There is nothing better after a day of sightseeing to relax on the terrace looking out towards the dome of the Vatican as the sun sets. It's worth the stay alone! The G&T's are a bit pricey but the wine is very reasonable! The rooms aren't huge but they are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. For me though, the service is beyond compare. I want to give a big mention to Chiara who was excellent in dealing with us when we thought we may have to cancel the booking at late notice because the volcanic ash cloud had stopped all flights out of the UK. In the end we got there safe and sound but her professionalism and prompt replies really put us at ease should we have had to cancel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn´t deserve 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: cdn07
Reviews.Content: Had a business trip to Rome this month and due to over-booking in a other hotel, I was sent to this 4 star hotel. Inspite of the good service (reception, room service), I found that the room was very small with a big problem: you hear everthing that happens in the room next door. Unfortunatly I had a baby crying as 3 am on both of my nights stay next door. It was impossible to sleep. Breakfast is also weak. Positive aspects: Location and excelent ice cream shop (Il Caruso) next to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spring break”
Reviews.Author: Nothdevonian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely four night stay at the Marcello Royal. The hotel is positioned in a smart and quiet part of the City slightly away from the main tourist attractions. Don't be put off as we walked everywhere and never needed to use public transport. The weather was great and we enjoyed eating our breakfast al fresco on their wonderful rooftop terrace. Drinks and food purchased at the bar are expensive but there is a Spar shop a few minutes walk away where a large bottle of beer can be bought for one Euro and a bottle of wine for about 5 euros. The Villa Borghese Park just north of the hotel is worth a visit for a stroll around (also contains the zoo) Our rooms were a little small but they were clean and comfortable. The sound proofing isn't great and we could hear next door using the bathroom! Took a white taxi from Ciampino airport which was at a set cost of 40 euro. The hotel organised the taxi back (not a white taxi) and this cost us 55 euro so it might be best to sort this out for yourself. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, very clean and staff were so lovely”
Reviews.Author: ellefrench
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable stay here for 3 nights and although was not as central as anticipated, the hotel in itself really made up for that. The staff were really polite, helpful and very attentive and the bedroom was cleaned to a very high standard, with fresh towels and linen every day. We will definitly return here.

Reviews.Title: “What a value for money find. Stay there if you can”
Reviews.Author: Montbelle
Reviews.Content: Good location - close enough to Termini and Repubblica stations, but just far enough away to be in a quiet street. Staff were helpful and friendly throughout. Room quite large for a city-centre hotel; daily cleaning spotless. We loved the variety of breakfast offered - enough to satisfy a vegetarian and a non-vegetarian! This was a real find - about £100 per night B&B through Expedia. We will recommend to all our friends (and tell them Bill Clinton stayed there), and stay there again. Only down-side - as others have said - the roof bar. Wonderful setting and views, but £8 for a pint of beer or other drink is unnecessarily high. They coulkd do better on gthis.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base from which to explore Rome - friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lou76Manchester
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel and I would certainly go back and stay there. The staff were so friendly and helpful (especially in chasing up my lost luggage at the airport for me!!!). The rooftop terrace was lovely for breakfast. The room was immaculate (if a little small) and the bed was made up twice a day!!! The hotel was ideally situated for the sights - 15min walk to Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. The only thing I would like improved is tea/coffee making facilities in the room and a bath as we only had a shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Position and good value”
Reviews.Author: LondonNaomi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel fairly last minute and were pleased to get a reasonable deal on the room price on a busy weekend in Rome with a major rugby international game being played. The bedrooms were a little small but very modern, clean and well equipped and this is a great hotel for a Rome City centre visit. You can walk to the centre from here and there are loads of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The staff in the hotel were excellent and extremely helpful - would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinbug7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently during our trip to Italy. Of all the hotels we stayed at in the various cities of Italy, this was probably the least nice in appearance. However, the staff is great--very helpful and enthusiastic about their city. The room size was slightly small (but not too unusual for Europe) but clean. The breakfast was great--hot eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, yogurt, meats, coffee, juice, and fresh fruit. The hotel is located on a quiet street and is within walking distance of just about anywhere you would want to go. We were even able to walk back from the Vatican without too much difficulty. There are multiple restaurants very close by and it is also very close to the Termini train station. We never tried the terrace bar due to cold weather, but heard it was nice. There was a computer available for use in the lobby but did not need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... BUT... very expensive”
Reviews.Author: clairealex0
Reviews.Content: OK... On arrival greeted very warmly and even though we were early for check in, we received our keys promptly. Roof top Garden is really lovely.. But .. be prepared to pay 8 eur for a pint of beer. To be honest this really did spoil the hotel for us, Would have definatley spent more time relaxing there in the evening if it was not for this. Salvatore the bar man up there is Fantastic, very friendly. Wifi available but again at an extortionate rate... 6eur for 1 hour access. Breakfast very nice, Great coffee, pastries, meats and cheeses, toast machine (needs a coup[le of turns) fruit juices, cereals but also eggs and bacon.. All very nice. Rooms adequate but nothing out the ordinary for a 4 star hotel. Dont touch the mini bar.. unaffordable!! Location is brilliant, easily reachable from Termini station. about 10 mins walk to Trevi fountain, bit further to pantheon. Bus stop at the end of the road to collosseum. So would I reccommend this hotel to a friend? well being from sheffield probably not.. but only on the basis of the expensive drinks. If you dont mind being ripped off or if you dont want to use the rooftop bar or wifi then definatley YES.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: appian_way_9
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean room. Ideally located/walking distance to Borghese Museum, Porta Pia, Visitor Center, Metro Stop and the Santa Maria Della Victoria Church( well worth the visit). While there, the hotel expanded the roof top dining to include a new indoor area. Staff very accomodating. There are nearby family owned resturants. View of the city, including the Vatican from the roof top. On a quiet one way side street.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Octomore
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal is a very fine hotel with a lovely roofgarden overlooking Rome.It is situated just five minutes walk to Piatza Republica and it´s not far to Fontana di Trevi It´s good service and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: LGBC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotels in London, Tokyo, New York and other City's too numerous to mention but The Marcello Royal is definitely one of the very best. The service and staff were first class. Every one of the staff were pleasant, corteous and very helpful with excellent English. Our room was beautifully furnished with a big bed and although at the front of the Hotel, really quiet. The breakfast had a wide choice and set you up for the day. The roof top bar and breakfast room had really great views of Rome. The Spanish steps and The Trevi fountain were a short walk away. I'm sick of staying in large impersonal Hotels and this cosy boutique Hotel really lived up to its four star rating. My 2 teenage daughters had no complaints and that in itself speaks volumes. I will return to Rome sooner rather than later and I will most definitely return to the Marcella Royal Hotel, FANTASTIC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sunnyScarborough
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and was not disappointed. Hotel staff friendly. Room very good. Breakfast excellent. All very clean. Internet should be free these days and why no English papers. Whilst the roof bar has great views it goes with great prices like £10 for an Irish coffee. I'm sure that if the prices were more reasonable they would of taken far more money out of my wallet as i spent the cash elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cosy hotel with a beautiful roof garden”
Reviews.Author: Mims17
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter 16-years old -and myself spent 4 days at Marcella Royal Hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, particularly the barman, Mr Salvatore, at the roof terrace, who also provided us with an address of a nice restaurant near to the hotel. The roof terrace offers a wonderful view on the city and smoking is allowed. Spacious (triple) room-2 balconies- nice complimentary breakfast with fresh fruit and bread, cereals, ham and eggs, cheese, salami, donuts, and other different kind of pastry and cakes. The well known city attractions such as Trevi, Colloseum, Piazza Navona etc, can easily be reached within a 15-30 minutes walk. A taxi to/from Fiumicino costs EUR 40-50 whilst a private car arranged by the hotel is between 55-65 EUR. We enjoyed our stay at Marcella Royal !

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: machr64
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel in Rome was wonderful,our room was nice,The service was excellent.The front desk staff was great,very helpful with all their suggestions( they spoke english which was very helpful to us) the rooftop garden was beautiful,They served a very nice buffet beakfast in the morning and served a light menu at night,prices are high on drinks and menu, But we found that quite a bit in Rome.One of the gems at the Marcella Royal is the bartender Salvatore at the rooftop bar,he is terrific we had the best time talking with him ,he was so very nice he gave us quite a few suggestion of things to do.,He is a very nice gentleman.The hotel is on a quiet side street,about a 15 min walk to train station .Overall we had a wonderful time at the Marcella Royal Hotel, and we would stay there again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It does the trick”
Reviews.Author: ForeverLove927
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal was our final destination after our 2 week Honeymoon in Italy. The hotel is in a nice location. Very quiet area compared to the heart of Rome with all the main attractions. We were very disappointed with our hotel room because it was right behind the elevator so all we kept hearing was how it went up and down. However, they were very accomodating when we asked to be switched to another room.....a room that did not accomodate us and our luggage. It was very small...but it did the trick and was quiet. We had breakfast every day at the hotel and we were not happy with it and opted to have breakfast outside the hotel. It does the trick for an overnight stay. You don't really spend that much time in the room in Rome....you're out and about sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Beachdogg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short ( 3 day ) stay at the Marcella Royal . Very nice hotel , the room was quiet and comfortable , breakfast was very good , and the dining patio was very beautiful . Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful . We found the walk back to the hotel from many of the sights in the heart of Rome was a bit tiring after a long day of sightseeing . I would go back there in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy hotel a little off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: usefactor50
Reviews.Content: The location for us was the only and slight downfall of this hotel, but i doubt you'd find a better hotel in a more central location for anywhere near the same price. It's not a huge distance to the trevi fountain or spanish steps (20mins probably) but after a long day walking around Rome it does feel a bit of a trek home. The area of the hotel is fine however. It's safe,quiet and with a reasonable selection of places to eat. Nearby there's also a nice department store, supermarket and it's extremely easy to reach from the train station (we arrived by terravision bus from ciampino - a bargain at 4 euros per person). We asked to be upgraded from the standard room when we arrived and they gave us a junior suite at the very reasonable price of 170 euros per night. It was beautiful and I would've paid more for such a lot of space. We had room 428 - it's just lovely! The service was faultless. The rooms were spotless, as were the other areas. The roof top garden is lovely and going on other advice from this website, we tended to go there last thing and enjoy a hot choc with stunning views, in a peaceful atmosphere. The staff were all very helpful, although the open top bus tour recommended by reception wasn't such a hit. Hardly any of the connections for the headsets to hear the commentary worked, so i'd avoid the green buses and try another company. The hotel has a relaxed but classy and welcoming feel - we noted a thank you letter from bill clinton who stayed in the 1990's! A couple of other recommendations for your trip - we had a fantastic guide around the vatican which we were lucky enough to come across by chance, but would be worth booking in advance (www.livitaly.com or [--]). The guide was kathy and what she didn't know about the vatican wasn't worth knowing in our humble opinion! Also a nice restaurant in the lovely square facing the pantheon - m.agrippa restaurant (nice food and reasonable prices for such a fabulous location). So, yes I'd recommend this hotel for those that don't mind a bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home while in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: andiamo2roma
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal is our hotel of choice not only because of its access to Termini Station, various buses and the metro, but also because of its location in a lovely quiet Roman neighborhood. We have just returned from our third stay and the greetings we received upon our arrival and departure was like that of a family reunion. Each of the front desk staff, including Andrea, Micheala and Roberta, were friendly, courteous, professional and ready to help with directions, recommendations, reservations, bus tickets, currency exchange and some friendly conversation. We only wish our "CD Italiano" was as good as their English. We have always found our rooms clean and comfortable and all the common areas immaculately kept and are astounded at how the housekeeping staff always manages to perform their duties site unseen. The rooftop terrace is our oasis! At breakfast each morning we are greeted with a genuine "Buongiorno!" by the staff who always keep the buffet fresh and tables ready if we chose to sleep in. In the evenings we find the terrace is a great place to relax with our favorite cocktail served by Signores Salavatore and/or Dahli. Both gentlemen are very gracious and attentive. Also, after the hustle and bustle of a day of touring the sights and shopping we had the option of dining on a light supper on the terrace, or walk a short distance to several restaurants in the area. As the title suggests, Marcella Royal is our home away from home while in Rome and we are certainly anticipating future visits to see our Roman Family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca01London
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an absolute joy. The room was not overly large but perfectly adequate for a short stay and was extremely clean with beautiful bed linen. We had a view across the city as requested & the air conditioning was extremely effective as it was so hot during our stay. The staff could not have been more pleasant & helpful & made our stay a truly memorable occassion! We would return any day!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Terry091
Reviews.Content: We found the Marcella Royal to be a refreshing experience as compared with larger more impersonal hotels.The management and staff were outstanding and happy to go out of their way to assist.The accommodation is comfortable without being luxurious but the real gem of a facility was the rooftop garden and bar.There are interesting views across the surrounding rooftops and Salvatore is the head barman and a charming man always anxious to assist.The location on Via Flavia is also excellent being within very easy reach of the Via Veneto,Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain.We will always stay there when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The top floor dining area saves this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gring0mama
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very disappointing, beginning with the surly staff at the front desk. Our room was barely adequate, but definitely not 4-star. No room service, no bath towels, no concierge service. The saving grace of this hotel is the top floor dining area, and the very friendly waiter, Salvatore. The hotel is not near anything--even the Spanish Steps is a hearty long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Childwall56
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Rome and stayed here. Its a ten minute walk to Termini Station and the hotel is close to the Britsh Embassy and teh Italian government district. Its on Via Flavia (just behind xx Septembre) and is by Rome standards a quiet area at night but Via Flavia has seveal good restaurants to choose from with more smattered around the side roads. The hotel is close to main bus routes into Rome, if you dont want to walk down to them. The hotel itself was in our view excellent, having stayed in Rome several times it compares with the best. The rooms are, as with so many in Rome, compact but very well appointed with good facilities and services offerred inside the room. Reception were always helpful and check in and check out were dealt with highly efficiently. When we stayed the air conditioning was a must with average day temeraturs of 36 degree leaving very warm evenings. The breakfast on offer was the normal layout of selected meats and cheese, hot eggs and bacon along with fruit and pastries, all well stocked. The rooftop breakfast room and bar is a joy both in morning and evening with views across the city to St Peters and Castle St Angelo. Again as with all Rome hotels the cost of drinks at the bar are not cheap but worth it just to enjoy the evening ambience and Salvatore, the bars head man is charm, helpfulness and good service at its best . Without doubt we'll return to Rome and we expect to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay,but not great”
Reviews.Author: texasag03
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, I was expecting a lot more. I guess hotels in Italy are a little bit different than other countries I've traveled too. I also think our travel agent hyped this place up a bit. She told us we had to pay the extra money and stay here while we were in Rome. Some of the front desk people were very friendly and some were not. One lady who worked mostly in the mornings made me feel like I was bothering her when asking for help, but another guy working there in the afternoons was very kind and helpful. Gave us directions, booked us a tour and even got a driver to come pick us up to take us to the airport at 4 am. The rooms are really, really small, but that is to be expected. I felt like I was transformed back into the 1950s. I did not feel like the room was that clean because of some stains I saw on the pillows, but it was okay. Apparently Bill Clinton stayed here back when he was in office. Maybe they should update this place a bit? There is an awesome view update to take advantage of every morning for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: loopyloui23
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left nothing was too much trouble. The staff took the time to get to know us and what we wanted from our trip. The room was compact but very clean and comfortable (we didn't intend to be spending to much time in the room anyway). Located in Northern Rome the surrounding area was quiet. It took us about 15-20 minutes to walk to the colosseum and a lovely walk it was with lots on the way to see. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room which was a disapointment but there was a mini bar. With a lovely roof terrace you can watch the sun set with a cocktail, beer or coffee. The food was lovely but not much choice for dinner. There was a great choice for breakfast on the other hand. We would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: bassing-jersey
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed for two nights prior to joining a cruise. The staff were friendly and helpful, The rooms were clean but small with only one of the 3 rooms having a bath. Rooftop bar was nice but the view consisted of rooftop aerials. On balance I think the hotel is overpriced

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with great Italian hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeScribbler
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel where nothing was too much trouble. Rooms and facilities were extremely clean. The roof terrace made a lovely breakfast location and came into its own in the evening for drinks. Lovely weather gave us the opportunity to enjoy the views across Rome. Recommendations by staff for local restaurants were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Peolple and Rome at their Best”
Reviews.Author: profemeritus
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff. Knowledgable, accomodating, genuinely affable, and with a charming sense of humor. Rooms are clean, spacious, and quiet; a welcome respite after a long day. Our room had the same view as the rooftop to the Vatican. Excellent full-breakfast, either open or glass enclosed with view was what clinched our initial hotel choice and we were not disappointed. A bit of a walk to Metro and Termini Rail Station, but bus is only a short distance. Cabs are quick, comfortable, friendly, and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mandalLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a beautiful stay in Rome, the hotel is ideally situated for a sight seeing vacation with in walking distance of all main attractions 20 minutes from the trevi fountain about 40 minutes from the Colosseum all easily accessible from this hotel,the hotel itself is a classic italian vintage style hotel,the breakfast was a buffet style which was o the 7th floor of the hotel which over looked the whole city of Rome, the roof top terrace was beautiful and a lovely place to relax with a glass of wine after a long day sight seeing,the only down part to this was drinks were ridiculously expensive a gin and tonic costing £14 sterling, staff were extremely helpful and very friendly I would return to this hotel if i was to return to Rome and would recommend it fully to anyone wanting to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Alab_9
Reviews.Content: From the inside this is a nice and friendly hotel. It is also quite central without being in the thick of the tourist action or too near the station. The staff are nice--they allowed me a late checkout at 5pm without any fuss--and the hotel itself is clean. But the views are well, small street urban, so you are pretty much looking into others' windows or balconies. Some rooms are small--no bigger than a King-sized bed and open into a narrow open courtyard. So if you really want to enjoy your stay here, rather than looking for a crash-pad for a few nights as I was, it is important you get a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff, Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in October 2008. The hotel is situated fairly close (short taxi ride) from Termini station which is the main station in Rome. Would have been a trouble free arrival if we hadn't been ripped off by the taxi driver. 40euro for a 5 minute journey. Be careful of this and arrange a fee up front or make sure it is on the meter. On arrival, the hotel was lovely, the staff were helpful and showed us to our room. As expected, the room was small (you are in Rome remember), although it was nicely decorated and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was in keeping although a slighty 80's shower curtain brought it down a little. Once in bed there was an evident droning buzz as I remember that would start and stop every couple of minutes. Very annoying but we put up with this. The location is OK. It is quiet on an evening but quite a walk to the main attractions. I'd say about 20 minutes at a leisurely pace. Maybe too much for some. It suited us as the quietness on an evening made up for it. The hotel has a roof bar which is excellent on a nice evening. Very impressive. We were going to eat in the piano bar on our last night but we were the only people in the whole place which put us off a little to say the leaset so it was just a drink and then out. The breakfast is served in the piano bar. The breakfast was acceptable but I wasn't blown away by it. Still, I would recommend the hotel, providing you don't mind a walk into the main area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacaranda43
Reviews.Content: I specified this was to be a special Anniversary trip and booked a special room 6 months in advance. Though the room was spacious with a separate sitting area, the decor was tired , with scuffed paintwork . It had no dressing table area to sit at and no bathrobes etc. We have stayed in boutique hotels in Madrid, England & Venice and this is not what I expected. ~ Disappointed and moved after one night to a delightful hotel which was half the price, and we still had a courtyard & roof terrace and very close to Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but quite a walk from the main tourist sights”
Reviews.Author: AG&MG
Reviews.Content: Just thought I'd write a short review after noticing that other reviewers find the hotel location to be central to the sights. This is not quite true. My husband and I stayed at the hotel in 2007 and found the hotel staff to be very helpful, the rooftop terrace view amazing and the breakfasts plentiful and delicious. We did however feel the bedrooms were small and the walk to the centre to be a good 20 minutes away. After sight seeing all day and returning back to the hotel to shower and dress for the evening - it was too far to walk back to the centre and we ate close to the hotel in the evenings. When I return to Rome, whilst the hotel was ok, I would not stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Par4Life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned our trip to Italy largely based on Trip Advisor recommendations. We spent our first four nights at the Marcella Royal Hotel. The corner suite was suggested and we are so glad we spent a little extra Euro and got the larger room with two balconies! The decorating is different than I would have expected, with bright blue flowered fabric walls, but still very clean and very spacious by any standards. The staff was wonderful, friendly and extremely helpful by answering our endless "tourist" questions. Our room was always perfectly made up each day and always turned down at night. One evening we had trouble with our Internet connection and they sent someone up TWICE to help us, and extended the Internet time we purchased. That is the only suggestion we would make.... free internet should be included. We found the other hotels around Italy that we stayed in, which actually cost less, provided in-room, free internet , but here they charge to connect. A small detail, but it did seemed significant at the time. The location of the hotel is not centrally located, but we found it was convenient for walking to the train station and to a tour bus pickup location. Also a nice stroll to several tourist attractions. No huge crouds to deal with and the area had some very nice little restaurants/cafes/bars... some were excellent with great food and friendly staff. One was awful, (Lorenzo's I think) but that's apt to happen anywhere. We did not eat dinner in the hotel restaurant, so I can't comment on the evening meals. Every morning we enjoyed the roof top breakfast buffet, which was very good. Everything was fresh and well presented. Since it is very expensive to eat breakfast out each day, the buffet is an excellent value and great battery charger before heading out for a long day of sight seeing. We loved Rome and The Vatican (use Angel Tours) and would highly recommend this hotel whether it be your first trip to Rome or your tenth.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with a beautiful roof-top restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: JBog
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel was fairly priced. The rooms were a little small, but clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was not exactly central, but still good for access to the subway and center of Rome. They have a nice roof-top restaurant with beautiful views and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Kahoona39
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Marcella Royal for our honeymoon and we weren't disappointed. We had originally booked a standard double room but I emailed the hotel beforehand to explain that it was our honeymoon and I'm sure we were upgraded to a superior room (Room 648). The bed was large, the bathroom was also large and well appointed with a separate bath and shower cubicle and the room was spacious. We also had a large window that opened at the touch of a button along with an electric shutter. The flat screen TV was great although not many English channels, but we weren't there to watch TV ! The week we visited was particularly hot for April and the room was a little warm at night (air con didn't seem to do much) but later in the week the room suddenly got cooler. The roof bar is a great added feature and what attracted us to the hotel, although views from some angles were not the most attractive and drinks were extremely expensive but then the whole of Rome is much more expensive than we are used to! The location of the hotel is a little way out from the centre and when you've walked all day a central hotel might have been nice but it was in a relatively quiet area and all the hotel staff were so friendly and helpful that we are glad we stayed there. There are some restaurants very close to the hotel if you don't want to walk far in the evening. All in all I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and Rome is a great city, just be prepared to walk a lot and spend a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel - Friendly & Professional Staff - Breathtaking Views”
Reviews.Author: Pags-n-Laurie
Reviews.Content: Quintessential Italian. Very clean and tasteful rooms. Outstanding service from friendly staff who all speak very good English. Rooftop restaurant/bar is fabulous and provides breathtaking views of the city (especially to the West and Southwest towards the Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wearing good walking shoes!!”
Reviews.Author: Emr2006
Reviews.Content: Took my boyfriend to Rome for this birthday, stayed here for 3nights. Location: Really good location, 5-10 minute walk from the main train station. Hotel is loacted in a small one way side street, so very little traffic (if any) through out the day or night. We decided to walk through out our stay as majority of attractions were close by. Rooms: We were lucky to get a room on the 5th Floor, so were graced with a mini balcony. Rooms were clean as was the bathroom. Maybe a lil small but we only planned to sleep and shower so wasn't really a problem. Good flat screen TV, shame there was only 2 english speaking channels both of which were news channels. Think the only problem was the hair dryer in the bathroom, girls take you're own, sat by the balcony most nights to let it dry naturally. You'll find the plug points behind the bed side tables or by un-plugging the TV Staff: Very helpful and polite. Can't fault them. Bar staff on the roof were easy to chat to. Took me ages to chose a hotel in Rome and I'm sure I made the right choice. If I do go again, I would stay clear of the roof bar at night 14 euros(about £13) for one drink, it think is crazy. It worked out less than half as much if you took it from the Mini Bar in your room......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but small rooms and, contrary to reviews here, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPat
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having read the unanimously positive reviews on this website. Whilst we enjoyed our stay, I think it's only fair to present a realistic view of the Marcella Royal. Specifically, potential visitors should be aware that the standard double is very small (the size of the double bed with 50cm walking space around). There was also quite a lot of noise from neighbouring rooms (shower, taps, toilet flush). Most importantly, re: location, it's not quite as central as the other reviews suggest. Whilst it is 12-15 minutes walk from the main railway station (Rome Termini), it is just the wrong side of the centre for a lot of the main sights (20-25 mins to the Trevi Fountain - not that close after you've developed blisters from the first day of sight seeing!!). If you're not too worried about the price, it would be better to pay a bit more for a better location. Having said this, it's not a bad hotel, decent value for the price and overall we had a wonderful long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, quiet location away from centre”
Reviews.Author: Jules1066
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and welcoming, with good English. The room was quiet and comfortable, although not very large. A comprehensive breakfast was included in the price and was served in the rooftop bar/restaurant. It was a 10 to 15 min walk to the city centre. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Marcella”
Reviews.Author: RajEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel an hour earlier than check-in and were told that our room was ready and available at no extra cost, which was a great start!!. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and more than happy to help with anything we needed. The room we stayed in was a double which was a bit on the small side but had everything we needed. It was spotlessley clean and well maintained. The decor was lovely and stylish and very italian. we were on the 6th floor and could still here the traffic outside but i would expect that from any city. The room fitted in well with the rest of the hotel, as the lobby is very nice and welcoming and the best part of the hotel has to be the roof-top piano bar and breakfast room. You can see St Peters basilica in the distance while you have a relaxing drink and something to eat. The location is pretty good if you dont mind walking. The main station in is Termini and only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The trevi Fountain and spanish steps are about 15 minutes walk, but you can easily get about on the Metro which is 4 euros for a day ticket so you can jump on and off as many times as you like which is great value for money. Try to stay away from cab drivers as we got ripped off and paid 30 euros for a trip which shouldnt have cost more than 10 euros. You can ask the hotel staff for recomendations on places to eat and they will point you in the right direction one place i would recommend is on the same road as the hotel and is called 'annicinquanta pizzeria' which has great food for a good price, and is full of local italians with queues out of the door which is a good sign. Rome is a beautiful city with lots to see and do. One minute you can walk through and beautiful market place and then the next street can be full of boutiques. the people are very friendly and hospitable. Be very careful with your wallet and pick pocketers, also keep away from quiet streets. The metro underground is pretty basic but gets you about, Stay away from cabs if you can because they are dodgy,the meter was clocking up as we were getting into the car. Our flight was the early hours of the morning so we had the hotel arrange a cab at a set price which i would recommend. Rome is very expensive especially as the pound is not worth much at the moment but you are easily looking spending 40euros per person per meal, unless you hunt around for something more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... and amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Mup3t
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Marcella Royal Hotel last week (February 14th-17th) and I must say I absolutely loved this Hotel... When we arrived, the lady on the front desk couldn't be nicer and gave us all the information regarding both the hotel and Rome in general (and also gave as a city map for us to get around). The room was small but exactly what we expected... It had a classic decoration with some modern elements (like the LCD in the desk). The bathroom was nice... Nothing in particullary to add. Then there were some nice details to the hotel like the fact that, when we returned at the end of the day, the maid had opened our beds, put a chocolat in each pillow and a card wishing us a good night. Other aspect that must be refered is the roof top when we had our breakfast (and some times a drink in the evening)... It has the most amazing view. You can see the entire city with St. Peters Catedral in the end. Overall, I must recommend this hotel to every traveller who wants to spend and amazing vacation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: Badger541
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find at first but when you do its well worth it. Only a short walk from the main railway station and not too far into the centre. A small hotel with excellent decor. nice rooftop resturant,with stunning views over the city. This trip was our 40th wedding anniversary so it had to be special. We asked the concierge to recomend 2 resturantss during our stay. 1. a typical pizza resturant within walking distance this was excellent 2. a resturant for our anniversary that would be special this was booked for us and a taxi also,needless to say the resturant was fabulous. Our stay was made much better by the help of the concierge use him if you visit,give him a good tip he is well worth it

Reviews.Title: “A really good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: bertha007
Reviews.Content: Went on a four night break Booked through lastminute.com really reasonable deal. We were told it was an eight minute walk from Termini station maybe on roller skates more like 20 minutes. Reception on arrival was very good very friendly and effecient in fact very helpful throughout our stay. The room was standard size but perfectly acceptable as was the bathroom. Very clean and kept like that by "Rosa" There was also a "turn down"service along with the obligitary chocolate just a nice little extra touch.Breakfast was okay wiith a selection of bread cheese ham cereal tinned fruit also scrambled eggs forget the bacon. The breakfast room acts as a bar in the evening and the night time view is very pretty. A glass of wine was 6 euros and because nof the exchange rate it worked out at £6 a glass All in all I would return to this hotel because of the high standards maintained by the hotel staff and their helpful attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend to Rome and stayed here, its a lovely hotel, really big rooms and nice and clean. Going back in May for a wedding so looking forward to staying here again. Breakfast is nice up on the roof, small selection but it does. One think I wasn't happy about was we were checking out and asked the staff member that was working to call us a taxi, he said that will be 50 euro, we said its a fixed charge to the airport that is too much. I said we only paid 35 coming, he said fine 35 it is. When the taxi arrived it wasn't a real taxi but just a driver they obviously use who splits the extra they cream on the fair if you pay the 50. Left a bit of a bad taste but at least we spoke up and paid 35.

Reviews.Title: “It doesnt get better”
Reviews.Author: Yvon_G
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I have just returned from an amazing 4 night stay in the beautiful city of Rome, we enjoyed every second of it and the Marcella Royal Hotel added that extra special touch to it! We booked this hotel after reading numours excellent reviews on trip advisor, and we where not dissapointed!! We arrived from Dublin into Leonardo Da Vinci airport and took the Leonardo express into termini, we decided to brave it and walk from the station to the hotel with the help of our guide book, the walk with suit cases (Make sure you have one on wheels, they are a god send) was about 15 minutes. The hotel is located on a quiet side street just off a main road, and is very quiet. The staff were very welcoming and we where shown to our room by the porter who brought up our bags a few minutes later. We were giving a different map with all the main attractions on it they also marked things like good restraunts, and a supermarket on it for us! Our Room (Standard Double) was on the 4th floor and was newly refurbished, state of the art bathroom features the lot! The rooms where spotless and was cleaned every day new towels and sheets. The nearest Metro station is Republicca About 7 mins away and is serviced by the metro line A wich goes in the direction of the trevi fountain/vatican/spanish steps however Termini is just an extra 2 minutes walk and is serviced by both lines A&B (B going towards the ancient city) I would advise to get a Biglietto giornaliero B.I.G it's a days travel on the metro and Bus and costs €4 - the 3 day one costs €11. The Hotel has a lovely breakfast room on the 7th floor, with amazing views over the city St. Peters Basilica is visible over the roof tops. Breakfast is ample to set you up for a day of adventure, with cerals, toast, cold meats, tea and coffee, ( I had a chocolate Crossant every morning too, :)!) There is a lovely little Pizzeria right across the road, lovely fresh and well priced! other than that all the restraunts are amazing and the receptionist will reccomend a few. Overall, the hotel was as amazing as the city is's self and I couldn't fault the building or staff one bit.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rosemarea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were with 2 other couples on a trip through Italy after taking a Greek Isls cruise and when we arrived at this hotel we were greeted as if we were past friends. The staff were all superb. We let them know that we were open to suggestions, especially for food. We stayed 3 days and 2 nights and we were directed to very reasonable, delicious, different restruants for lunches and dinners. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. They are absolutely wonderful. They also have free breakfast every day and in the evening a roof top piano bar that overlooks the city with beautiful sunsets. I just would like them to know how much we all really appreciated their wonderful hospitality. If we ever go back to Rome, this is where we will stay. God bless you all and thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: petri2009
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in Rome with my 17 year old son. Selected this hotel largely based on comments found on tripadvisor. At the end of our stay we got a letter from the management suggesting to share out experience in tripadvisor if we have been satisfied. Nice marketing trick and no wonder there are so many reviews... However, i must say i was very happy with my selection. The experience matched very well with my expectations. The hotel was nice and clean, room was quite small (as expected) but very comfortable and clean. The rooftop restaurant was very nice and reasonable breakfast (although during weekend when we had a late breakfast one morning, it was very full and many food plates were empty most of the time..). The location was withing walking distane to central railway station and reasonably good bus connections to main sights. If i would have wanted to change something i would have liked to have this type of hotel just a bit closer to the main sights.. Anyway, i highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel but not the location”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateFamily
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel even before we arrived. We had our luggage shipped and it arrived several days in advance. The manager was kind enough to email us and let us know they would store it until we check-in. The rooms are small but clean and very comfortable. Breakfast in the rooftop garden is excellent. I don't think I have had a more delicious cup of coffee - ever! The only downside is that it is out of the way. They will call a taxi for you and it usually arrives in just a few minutes, but it will cost you $ every time you go somewhere. There is a wonderful grocery store a few doors down that we found on our last night - too bad. We got some wonderful cookies but I wish we had known about it sooner - they had a great selection of prepared food and cold meats and cheeses. So don't miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba_Kutie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with clean and classy rooms! Hotel staff was gracious and helpful. Delicious continental breakfast. Not far from the Train Station. Excellent restaurants on the same street too. Highly recommend and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pm914
Reviews.Content: The location was very good. You are walking distance to the bus & train and there are many very good restaurants within walking distance as well. Our group of 7 found the rooms to be very clean but small. Some of us had great views, others had views of an alley. There was very little street noise.The front desk people overall were terrific in suggesting restaurants, giving directions and booking opera tickets for us. They keep maps of Rome on the counter and they circle all the points of interests you inquire about and tell you how to get there. You just take your map and go! We arrived by train from Naples into the Rome Termini train station. We were warned to only use the official city taxi cabs that have the medallions on the roof so as not to get ripped off. They are lined up right outside the station at an official taxi stand. However, true to form, they saw us as tourists and told us it was 30 euros per cab to get to the hotel. When we got to the hotel the desk clerk said it was a 15 euro per cab ride. So you can still get robbed no matter how much you try. The roof top of the hotel is a great place for a nightcap. Breakfast was fine with a number of choices. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel. Be forewarned, like many elevators in Italy, theirs is TINY. It can barely fit two people and that's without luggage. If that bothers you ask for a room close to ground level.

Reviews.Title: “loved the roof top bar and breakfast area”
Reviews.Author: newzealandchris
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within walking distance of lots of attractions and very close to train station. We had room on refurbished floor with very nice decor and modern attractive bathroom. Room wasnt large but fine for a week. Friends had an executive room on same floor which was spacious and modern. Lobby was large with separate seating areas, lots of sofas and lovely decor. Rooftop garden bar and breakfast area had great views over Rome and was especially appealing for an evening drink with lights of city. This restaurant and other areas of the hotel seemed in need of refurbishement but not too bad, just shabby in places. Price seemed right for area and quality of hotel, it wasnt a budget type option but well worth it. Staff varied in level of friendliness - overall average.

Reviews.Title: “we had a fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: karle9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and the hotel was centrally located for all of our trips out and in a very safe location, the room was comfy but smaller than we expected but the roof terrace/garden was absolutely fantastic, breakfast every morning in the sunshine with views over Rome and we had a drink up there every night before going out to look at Rome lit up at night. This was our 1st time in Rome and it will not be our last, it is one of the best cities we have ever been to and it definately has the WOW factor

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Billywhizz40
Reviews.Content: Lovely roof top dining area with stunning views over the city of Rome. Buffet breakfast good and included in room price. Location in north of Rome was good to see the sights with most things being within walking distance and not far to catch the tourist buses located near Termini (Station). Rooms were well appponted with comfortable beds and shower rather than bath room. We had a room to the rear overlooking the internal courtyard so no view as such and limited sun light although this made it quiet as no road noise. Hotel is situated on a quiet road in any event and is surrounded by Banks so felt more like a business area than a tourist area. There are a quite a few local restaurants near the Hotel although the roof terrace is open for light evening meals. we found the best restaurants were situated in Vittorio Veneto near the Fontana del Tritone. The staff were all pleasant and helped in any way they could. Book the shuttle bus from the UK rather than an Italian taxi,much cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuluMK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful 5 day trip to Rome with my Mum which was a Birthday treat and staying at the Marcella Royal made it all the more special. The Reception Staff were very welcoming and were extremely friendly and helpful during our stay, nothing is too much trouble. They speak very good english. Our room was lovely, very clean with comfy beds and the bathroom had an excellent power shower. The Roof Top Terrace where breakfast is served has breathtaking views. The hotel is approx 10-15 minute walk from Termini Station which was handy since we took the train from the airport into Rome which worked out cheaper as there was just the two of us (€11 each as apposed to approx €50 for a taxi). The hotel is approx 15-20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the main shopping area around via del Corso. All the main sights are within walking distance although the Vatican which is the other side of the Tiber is quite a trek so is worth taking a taxi, bus or metro to get there. The weather this time of year was just right for sightseeing, warm and sunny, 22-24 degrees so perfect t-shirt weather and not too hot. Finally, there is an excellent pizzeria just around the corner from the hotel called Brancaleone on Via Sicilia. It gets extremely busy especially at the weekends so may be worth booking but they squeeze tables into every available space to accommodate people and although it can be a little wait for food, the staff are extremely friendly, the atmosphere is great and the food is worth waiting for. We have stayed in lots of hotels in Europe and this hotel was definitely the best and most memorable. Overall we had a fantastic time in Rome and would definitely return to the Marcella Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourLeader2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a girls weekend away and from the first emails sent they couldnt do enough to help us. They arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the airport and from the moment we walked into the hotel reception we knew we had made the right choice. They helped us with restaurant choices, city tours and taxi bookings - so for the 3 days we were there we didnt spend all our time trying to find things. The terrace to have your breakfast and drinks is wonderful and the view and sunset across Rome is to write home about We will definitely use the hotel again should we return to Rome...

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Musken
Reviews.Content: Welcome: - we were welcomed and greeted in a very friendly way. Felt like returning guests even if it was our first time at Marcella -luggage brought to our room - welcome "kit" with map of Rome and useful information about sights and hotel Room: - porter showed and explained aircondition, TV, minibar while we were "admiring" the extremely ugly wallpaper. The parts of the walls not covered in blue/pink/yellow flowers, were mirrors. We never really got used to this look. - mini-balcony outside room. A big plus. - very clean room. Absolutely nothing to complain about (and I am picky) - very comfortable bed. I had a double bed alone, which was great, of couse. However, the double bed (it was a double room) would have been a little small for two in my view, but it depends on what you are used to, of course. - very good aircondition - batroom OK. Could have wished for a bit more space so that WC did not need to be hidden behind door and some more space for putting toiletries. - wardrobe space OK Roof terrasse: - Good but not great view. I had expected even more after having read reviews here - Prices a bit over the top (simple ham/cheese toast more than 10 euro, one bottle of sparkling 40 euros = same as we paid in very high end restaurant) - very friendly and personal service Breakfast: - The best ham that I have found on a breakfast buffet! - Do not sit next to the toaster! Very hot. I would go back and recommend this hotel to everyone. Change the wallpaper and I will give this hotel 5 stars. (yes, it was that bad)

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: notgoth007
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late since our trip was back in December 07/January 08, but better late than never. The Marcella Royal is lovely hotel on Via Flavia, a very quiet block just a short walk from quite a few sights & transportation hubs. The Termini, Piazza Della Repubblica, the Borghese Gardens are all within walking distance. Even though we stayed there over a very busy and hectic holiday, the staff could not have been any nicer. And they were all fluent in English, which came in handy for us since our Italian is still a bit shaky. The concierge was always pleasant and had a couple wonderful suggestions for dinner. Our room was small, but nice and clean. A word of advice...if you are used to large American-style hotel rooms, you're not going to find that here. And that, to me, was part of the charm. We knew when we planned this trip that a lot of the hotels tended to be a bit smaller and cozy in Italy. And since we didn't plan on spending much time in the hotel room anyway, it really worked out well for us. The upstairs roof deck provided a wonderful view of the skyline in the morning. Definitely get up there when they open (7am, I believe?) and snap some photos of the early sun glistening over Rome. It's amazing. The free breakfast buffet up there was better than we expected. Cereals, eggs, bacon, Italian meats & breads, fruit juices, coffee and more. It'll get you ready for a full day of site-seeing, that's for sure. In the end, if you are looking for an affordable & quaint hotel a bit off the beaten path, you might want to give the Marcella Royal a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Romantic Rooftop Piano Bar”
Reviews.Author: SD2008
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The room and bathroom was large for a European hotel. The rooftop terrace and bar was our favorite. Very romantic and great place to relax after a full day of sight seeing. The hotel is close to the main train station, where we returned our rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Boomskilpaadjie
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal is a lovely little boutique hotel in the North of Rome. The staff are incredibly welcoming and the rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean, more than enough space for two travellers and masses of luggage. The views from the rooftop are breathtaking, I couldn't think of a nicer place to have breafkast. The only tiny down side is the location....Northern Rome is a bit far from the major attractions and at night the entire area is deathly quiet...making restaurant searches a little difficult. But if you're looking for a quiet hotel away from the crowds this is ideal. Other than that, a truly wonderful weekend and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooftop breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PhillyDoc
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Marcella Royal hotel during a recent vacation to Italy. We have two teenaged children, aged 16 and 18 and booked two rooms. The rooms were adequate sized. However I had not thought to request nonsmoking rooms. Unfortunately, it was obvious that both rooms had been occupied recently by smokers which was not a positive aspect of our stay. Our favorite aspect of the hotel was the rooftop breakfast. The setting was lovely and was a great way to start each day. The kids particularly appreciated the scrambled eggs each morning as this was more substantial than the typical European continental breakfast. We also went up to the roof one evening for a pre-dinner drink and that was terrific. There was a wonderful piano player providing accompaniment. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and provided restaurant recommendations and other advice whenever we needed it. Although we had a pleasant stay at this hotel, for future trips, I will probably try to stay at a hotel that is a bit more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfergirlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel met every expectation I had. To start off, the people at this hotel were excellent. They spoke great english and were very cheerful and kind. The rooms were very nice and the air conditioning felt very nice after a long hot day in Rome. The rooms were big and were very clean. This hotel is definitely not a 3 star. I would give it a 4 to 4 1/2. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: MyMuse
Reviews.Content: The room is nicely decorated, though very small (twin room). It was enough room for us. The bathroom you step up into and the shower is child-sized, quite a negative, however, the A/C worked wonderfully well. We did walk to the hotel from Termini and did get a little lost, but not too much. We got there very early, too early for our room to be ready, but I had emailed and we were able to leave our bags in a locked luggage room. After we came back later in the afternoon, I was delighted to be told our luggage already in the room. The elevator is quite miniscule but we never have any problems with it. The rooftop was very pretty, I don't know if that should be the sole reason to book the Marcella, but it is definitely a plus. We had dinner up there one evening and there was an actual and very talented pianist playing while we ate. The breakfast, also in the rooftop garden was decent as well. The typical array of pastries, yogurt and cold cuts (which I am not crazy about eating for breakfast, so I always skipped it). The coffee was pretty good as well as the juices. There was always a full house at breakfast. The staff were nice, helpful and courteous. I never did ask for reservations, but I did ask for direction help. I also got help with understanding my train ticket. :) The location was somewhat in a residential neighborhood, away from the tourist section. Our room faced the street and I heard every single noise, so you may want to ask for a room in the back or higher up. It was a 5 minute walk to the Repubblica station (line A, which was clean and modern underground) that takes you everywhere you want to go within minutes. The Borghese Gallery, Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain are within easy walking distance. And don't forget, right down the street, on Settembre, is Santa Maria Vittoria, which houses one of the greatest Bernini scultpures, St Theresa in Ecstasy. I would definitely recommend the Marcella, if you want to be out of the tourist area, yet still want to be close enough. If not, you may want a hotel closer to center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bayhomes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 8 blocks from train station and about a mile and a quarter from the Spanish steps. It is easily walkable from train station (15 minutes). Nice thing about location is that you are in a quieter neighborhood and it is away from the crowds. Location is in a commercial area with businesses and office buildings and the like. Felt very safe in neighborhood. Reception referred us to 2 neighborhood italian restaurants within 3 blocks, and both were casual with nice atmosphere. Food was good and house wines were great and reasonably priced. Best thing about hotel was rooftop restaurant (6th floor?). Breakfast was included in the hotel price and was best breakfast we had in 2 weeks of being in Europe. Try the orange juice. Great. Coffee. Great. Rest of breafkfast-great. Great variety. Staff was friendly. Wireless Internet available. Small reception area, but comfortable. 2 grocery/deli stores within 2 blocks. No shopping in area. A bit away from tourist areas, although we made the walk once or twice a day. A couple miles from the heart of Rome (Pantheon, Trevi, Piaza Venezia). A little farther to Coliseum, but Rome is very walkable. Would probably stay closer to heart of Rome next visit, but this was not bad. Rooms small as is typical in Rome. It is a neighborhood hotel, and a bit old but with character. There are a lot of hotels in this area, and all seem to be nice. A/C did not work well, so we opened window to street. Kind of loud, as there is a late night gelato store right in front of hotel. Awesome gelato-you can see them make it through a big picture window.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended, Lovely & Quiet, Sharp Staff And Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: VTWINTOE
Reviews.Content: Great location on a quiet street within walking distance of most of the sights. 10 to 15 mins from Trevi Fountain which is located amongst lots of shops, Cafes and Restruants etc.... We were allocated a new Standard Room and this was extremely well presented and very comfortable with excellent facilities.....Very comfy Firm Beds. Staff are very professional and want to help as much as they can, ask them anything you need to know, shopping, sights, transport, distances, language translations anything and they will have the answers. I'm Hiring a Moped next time they can bring it to your Hotel and collect.... Great Hotel Roof Terrace with its own Bar and Food available after 5.00pm with great Table service...... 5 Mins walk from Termini Station where you can get on any Hop on Hop Off Buses for 9 Euros each which last 24 hours, this will save you alot of money and time, buy a ticket on the Bus. Buses are Red ones or Green ones open top types.....The stops are all over Rome and you can get on and off anywhere in the City at these stops to see the sights, a real life saver...... When you walk to sights of interest from the Hotel, be aware the walks can seem long, but they are not, its just the Heat makes it feel further. Just stroll and allow plenty of time for each journey. From this Hotel its down hill going, but, up hill coming back..... Easy in shorts and T shirts, Sandles and Comfy Flip Flops.... We used the bus to get back to the Termini station and walked to our Hotel from there. ..No one dresses up for the evenings so stay as you are day and night to save going back to get changed. Formal Shirts and dresses are nice after a shower, especially if you go on the roof terrace at the Hotel after a hard days sight seeing, AWESOME ! But Food and Drinks a little more expensive. Alcohol Drinks from 6.00 to 15 Euros...'Large Drinks' Main Course 15.00 Euros each. It goes on your room bill no cash on the Terrace....Card payments maybe? When you go out for the day....Keep an empty Plastic Bottle with you at all times it will save you 20 Euros + a day, you can fill up on the Street water spouts, Not the Fountains thats for your Feet to cool down in, So use the Fountains for foot relief its a life saver. Low Fountains on every Piazza Square in the City, find them....You dont need a Towel. You will see people filling bottles all over the city do it, the water is fine, the locals use them and all the tourists. I'm fusy about water but this stuff is crystal and just like Evian. Best Shops are on these two streets, Via Nazionale and Via Del Corso both run off the Piazza Venezia. If you want expensive Gucci, Prada, Dior, YSL, D&G Shops they are all facing the Spanish Steps which is offthe long street of Via Del Corso (see any Tourist map,) By the 15th of Aust the Italians have shut the shops down untill september for ther Holidays. We just caught all the Sales, so go Early August not late....or wait to Sept. Learn to ask Parla Englese? Do you speak English? Infomation places shut at 12 noon till 2.30 so ask police for Directions or Hotel staff..... Best Restruants and Top class Hotels are away from the Busy Tourist Spots...... To find some of these these Travel up to the Northern area from the Hotel, its Main street is the Via Vittorio, its just south of the Villa Borgnese Park /the big Green Area on any map. This Hill/ street is full of the best Restruants we found all week, the Food was fantastic the Service was excellent with seats outside with Fans spraying cool mist out, this was the only one we ate at, on our last night, do yourself a favour Find it.....Wish we had earlier...All the Others looked just as good. The 5 star Hotels on this street are Awesome and we saw pictures outside them of Famous Stars who had stayed and ate there. Micheal Caine etc...Great shops at the top of the street too! If you go all the way to the top and want piece and quiet go in the Park its safe and Police are every where just for you... We walked through and saw couples all over the park Kissing and cuddling. Plenty of privacy and water Fountains for your feets to cool off. If you want to go on a night tour Bus? (recommended) pick the best one not the cheapest as you wont see anything and they dont stop often... Check them all out as you walk the streets you will see them, our bus was tatty inside and a little disorganised. We are going back to the Macella Royal Hotel for its Quality of service, quality of Rooms and Location away fom the hustle and bustle of the busy streets.....Chamber maid was excellent and two visits a day were made with little notes on the pillows each time....Enjoy, give our regards to the great Barman 'Salvatori' what a guy. He called me Mr Tony Hey its Italy.........Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Get About in Rome”
Reviews.Author: walshy13
Reviews.Content: What a super hotel. The reception area was bright, clean and elegantly decorated. The hotel staff were attentive and down right pleasant. The room was a good size with one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in for years on a hotel break. The room was spotless and all of the facilites worked brilliantly. Lots of hot water and a great shower. Air con cool. The breakfst was delicious and the Piano Bar/Breakfast area on floor 7 was a treat in itself. A great view out over the rooftops of Rome. The introduction of tea and coffee making facilities in the room would make this the perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jemtide
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice of the Marcella Royal for our stay in Rome. After many hours in the air travelling from Australia we welcomed the quietness of the hotel in the evenings. Our room was huge! It was a 'room of special comfort' - it had an entry/sitting area and spa bath with shower and a very comfortable bed, it looked to be newly refurbished and was very attractively decorated. We really liked the breakfast terrace, it's so quaint with its colourful potted flowers and has a fabulous view over Rome - makes for a really nice start to the day. Have to say thanks to the staff, particularly the very helpful man in reception, whose name I don't know. The airline lost our luggage - yes it does happen - and the staff were very helpful to the point of ringing the airline and company that was supposed to recover the luggage for us. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, only wish it had been longer and without the stress of trying to recover our luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hotspot08_8
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a friends wedding, I found the location great but it was a little ways from the "tourist" attractions. The rooms were a bit small, but most Hotels in Europe are. I had breakfast in their rooftoop garden restaurant, great views of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: NoName00
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for a week in June on a combined conference/holiday trip. We were a little late with the booking (approx two months prior to our trip), so the choice in good hotels were limited. Chose this one after reading so many great rewievs here at tripadvisor. At the time we booked, there were only one room avaliable for our entire stay. This was a superior room, which the hotel charges €350 per night for. We booked through expedia.com and paid far less:-) Upon arrival we checked in and were taken to our room. We got room 618, which was the third largest room in the hotel. It had a bathroom with shower/bathtub, a small hallway with lots of warderobe space, a fairly large "main" area with a big bed (which was quite comfortable), and a small narrow space by the window with a desk and minibar/fridge. And a great view of the Roman rooftops! Overall, the room was clean and nice. However, I would like to point out that the wall-to-wall carpet was extremely dirty... Other than that - no complaints. The room was cleaned once a day, clean towels were provided each day, they changed the sheets several times during our stay, and they checked the room in the afternoon as well (made up the bed if needed etc). Although our room was at the sixth floor, we did not experience any noise from the rooftop garden at any time of day. The room was located beneath the inner corner of the breakfast room, but we had no problems with loud noises from people walking over the tiled floor above, chairs being dragged etc as complained about in other reviews. In the outdoor area, the had put litle rubber "cups" on the chairs - probably to reduce the noise. In general the hotel is situated in a quiet neighbourhood, and we slept very well through the night - even with the window open. The price you pay for a quiet location, is that the hotel is located a bit far from the tourist places in Rome. The Pantheon is approx a 30 min walk away. This was not a problem for us as we are used to walking. Also, we did in general leave the hotel after breakfast and did not return until the evening. But if you want to break up your days and return to the hotel to relax during the day, you might want to look for a hotel with a more central location. On the positive side, the metro station Republicca is jus 5 - 10 minutes down the road which is convinient when going to the Vatican city and Colusseum. Also, there are several nice little places to eat right by the hotel, so you can easily go back to the hotel without having dinner and then find something to eat just around the corner. The staff was friendly and helpful and fluent in english. The rooftop garden was great, nice place to relax, do some reading or just enjoy the view. Spent some time up there during the day, and were left alone by the staff - no pressure to buy anything. We did not go up there to sit down any evenings, the policy might be different that time of day. It was really nice being able to eat breakfast outside at the rooftop terrace. In general, finding an avaliable table outside was not a problem. But in case of bad weather they do also have tables indoors. The breakfast itself was fair enough, nothing out of the ordinary. The hotel state that they offer complimentary wireess internet connection. However, they charge € 8 for 30 minutes (you buy codes in the reception) . This is extremely expensive, I've paid the same amount for 24 hour access in other hotels. Despite the price, we bought access for 30 min. Went up to the room to go online on our private laptop, but it did not work. Then went down to the reception area to try the hotel laptop, but it still did not work. Got help from the staff, but they didn't manage to get it working either. Got the money back without problems, so the service was good at least. But the "complimentary" wifi access is expensive and unreliable and something you should just avoid. All in all, our stay was just fine. The hotel has everything you need (except reliable internet connection and clean carpets), and the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy090
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a trip to Rome, Florence and Pisa and the hotel marcella royale was the best hotel we stayed in by far. It was a trip for a special birthday and the hotel made it that much more special. They recommended a hotel for a meal on the actual night - The Hi Res in Hotel Valdeira. would highly recommend this place for a special occasion. On our return for a nightcap in the rooftop terrace we were greeted by a rendition of Happy Birthday in English and Italian and glasses of champagne - agreat end to a perfect day. We had a junor suite which was superb - fantastic decor, brilliant service and superb airconditioning (very necessary) I really cannot fault this hotel - it was a superb experience and can't wait to go back there - we are planning our next trip already

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: GrubbyGrocers
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with this hotel - it was clean, the decor was pleasant (fairly recently done I would think). The rooms are not massive but adequate for what we needed. The bathroom was modern - no bath but a really good power shower. The roof garden was lovely. If the weather is nice you can eat breakfast (which was better than most that we have had a these sorts of places) on the roof and it is also really nice to have a pre-dinner drink there and watch the sun set over Rome - great views over the city. I am so glad that we used Tripadvisor - the comments were all really accurate. I wouldn't say this was ideal for people who want the sites right on their doorstep. The walks were managable but St Peters is about 50 mins walk, Trevi Fountain about 25 mins, Piazza Navona about 35 mins. The hotel will get you taxis and they are comparable to London prices

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: over50sNewMilton
Reviews.Content: just spent 3 days at this lovely hotel very clean ,and fresh sheets and towels everyday.Lovely comfortable room. Roof top restaurant brilliant wonderful views over rome great breakfast choice. Would stay here again was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rooftop!”
Reviews.Author: TheTallman
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews we decided to book the Marcella and i have to say that i am pleased we did. Much has been said about the beautiful rooftop gardens in previous posts but having sampled the goods myself i can only endorse the good comments. Believe me you will do a lot of walking in Rome! So the chance to relax with a night cap with views above the city and pleasant piano music playing in the back ground is well worth the wait. Indeed what better way to start a day than to have a nice breakfast with the same views. OK, the nitty gritty. You will need walking shoes although don't be afraid to use the metro/buses and taxis. The hotel bar is not cheap so expect to pay more euros for a beer than in many local restuarants (approx 8). A bottle of wine is better value! The rooms are fine if a little small and we were on the sixth floor but were not disturbed by the noise from the restuarant above. There is no iron so bring your own. The staff are curteous and helpful. It is a boutique hotel not a major chain so don't expect it to behave that way. Overall i would definetely recommend the Marcella Royal to anyone who wants to be near enough to the action without the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - a bit far out though”
Reviews.Author: Emma Dillon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marcella Royal Hotel last weekend (Friday 27th to Monday 30th June) and we had a great time in Rome. The hotel is lovely - the staff are really helpful and friendly. There is a lot of choice at Breakfast and being able to sit outside in the sun on the roof terrace is a great way to start the day! The rooms are quite small but for the amount of time you spend in your room it is fine. The air con is brilliant and very much needed after treks around the hot city!
