The shower is very powerful plus lovely and hot. The hotel is very clean and so are all the rooms. Really nice hotel. The roof terrace piano bar is very nice in the evenings and no more expensive than any bar in the area so have a drink before you go out - it's well worth it! The hotel is quite a walk from the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps but it's manageable! If you leave the hotel and turn right (outside the front door) then take the first road on your left and then turn right (onto the main road) walk all the way down the road until you come to a crossroad where there is a fountain on each wall (on the side of the road) turn right once you're at the fountain, this road leads you to Barberini metro station and the Trevi fountain is also signposted from here. It's really easy to get to Vatican City and the Colosseum on the Metro - do be aware of pickpocketers. They are not dangerous, just very quick and 'professional'!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Marcella Royal”
Reviews.Author: thenonna
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Marcella Royal in Rome. We stayed there on the reccommendations of Trip Advisor clients. We are a family of ten and the hotel management could not have been more welcoming or more helpful. Our rooms werelovely and we especially enjoyed the very attractive roof bar. The breakfasts were varied and good.This hotel is an excellent choice for both adults and children.We could walk to the Spanish Steps in 15 minutes and Trevi fountain in less than 20 minutes.The hotel neighborhood is residential and very quiet at night which we loved. The Marcella Royal receives the highest rating from us. Sincerely, Dede Shannon

Reviews.Title: “Beware.”
Reviews.Author: danmegan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are VERY small, “complimentary" WiFi is 6 euro to connect to, the rooftop terrace is terribly overpriced (8 euro for a draft beer! - any store about a half a block away beer is .90 euro) and the waiter was beyond rude. The location is a bit out of the way for most popular spots -- try staying closer to central Rome to stay within walking distance of most sights. I would recommend this hotel for single business travelers, defiantly NOT a family or couple looking for a romantic stay in Rome!!! Keep in mind 4 star hotels in Europe are close to American 3 stars, try to fork up more dough for a 5 star if you can, it will make your visit to Rome much more memorable

Reviews.Title: “Staff are wonderful - great location”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveller38
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 (grandparents, parents and kids) stayed at the Marcella Royal for 2 nights in May 2008, and really liked the place. The staff were very friendly and gave us excellent recommendations on restaurants. The rooms were very spacious in comparison with other hotels in Rome. Make sure to have a late night drink on the roof garden! Its very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lilushi
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, especially the friendly and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamilya
Reviews.Content: Read all reviews about this hotel and me and my friend decided to spend 4 days in Marcella. We enjoyed our stay at Marcella. Pluses: • Good location • Nice furniture and bathroom • Rooms are cleaned daily • Very helpful staff (receptionists are always happy to give you a map, directions and order a taxi for you), waiters are very good too, but speak very poor English. • Roof restaurant is actually very good as you can enjoy the sunshine and have a cigarette if you smoke • Quiet area • Minibar drinks are not too expensive • Nice reception area • Reasonable price • Safe box • Breakfast is included Minuses: • Location is central but it will take you 10-15 minutes walking to get to the nearest underground station • Rooms are pretty small • No balconies in standard rooms (I understand that most of city hotels don’t have it, but it’s always good to have one) • Plastic glasses in bathroom and minibar • No iron provided (I know that most hotels in Italy don’t provide irons for safety reasons), so don’t forget to take a travel iron with you. • Very thin walls, you always here that someone singing in the shower or closes their door and everything else. Even though they wanted to make them thicker (they are actually soft, but you can still hear your neighbours quite well) • Room key is very heavy (but you can leave them at the reception if you like) • Lifts are pretty small, sometimes you need to wait for 3 minutes to get one (specially during breakfast), but it’s not a big problem • Breakfast is quite basic, more continental. We got bored eating there after two days If you take a taxi from the Airport, only take a white licensed taxi. Prices are fixed for the Airport- hotel transfer. If you travel from Champio airport it will cost you 30 euros, Fuimicino 40 euros. You can also take a train from the airport to the main station Termini, it’s cheaper, but you will need to take 10-15 minutes walk to the hotel with a map. Restaurants. I wonder why Italians are not fat as they eat so much! You will have Antipasti first, and then have pasta or lasagne and after that they will ask you about the Main course (Steak, fish, whatever you like) and only after the main course you can have your dessert! I recommend you to only go to nice restaurants because prices are pretty much the same everywhere. Wine is very good in Italy; we always had it with a meal. Be careful crossing streets in Rome, it can be dangerous. Rome is a very special and extremely beautiful place to go to. We had a very good time there and I will definitely come back one day and will probably stay in Marcella.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, small clean rooms, residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Brymel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marcella Royal for 5 nights in May 2008, while in Rome for a conference. Like many, I chose the hotel based on the many favorable reviews, and in general I agreed with them. The staff were extraordinarily gracious and pleasant, and the hotel was very clean. Overall, good value for money and a pleasant stay. A few things to note: (1) There is a fair amount of variation in room size. I arrived quite late (11 pm) on check-in day, and was given the only room still available - I don't recall the room number, but it was so exceedingly small (even by European standards) that I could barely fit my suitcase in the room, and there was a rather drab view of the building across the street. I noticed a floor plan on the room wall and could see based on the room diagrams that I was in the smallest room on the floor. I called the staff to request a room change - they were very accommodating and moved me to a new room the next day - same price, but much larger room, plus a lovely view across the city rooftops (see photo). So - make sure you get the best possible room in your category. (2) The location will be a plus for some and a minus for others. It's definitely in a residential neighborhood - VERY quiet (I slept extremely soundly) and not particularly touristy. For those who enjoy walking and/or want the feel of living in a Roman neighborhood, it's great. It's not particularly close to any of the main tourist sites, though. The staff tell you that Piazza di Spagna is a 15-minute walk - I'm a pretty fast walker, and I really couldn't get there in less than 25 minutes. Other main sites (Forum, Pantheon, Colosseum, etc.) are further still. For me, this was a non-issue - I didn't care about seeing the tourist sites and quite enjoyed walking through the residential streets each day. But some may see the location as a bit out of the way. (3) One small complaint: there is no iron available in the room, or anywhere in the hotel. So, if your clothes are wrinkled from travelling and you need to press them, the only option is to send them out through the expensive laundry service, which takes a day or two. This may be an inconvenience for business travellers in particular - as I arrived late the evening before a conference, I had no way to press my clothes before the next day. (4) A final tip: there is a delightful little family restaurant just down the street called "La Pentolaccia". Very reasonable prices, delicious traditional Italian food (the cacio e pepe and the ossobucco were particularly good). Overall, a good stay - I'd certainly stay there again (but might bring my own travel iron next time!)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean & great views from rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerScotland
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was it's location. It's an easy 10-15 min walk to the railway station and underground. The rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. The staff very courteous, the rooftop bar has stunning views and the restaurant is here for breakfast, which was fresh and plenitful (continental). We ate at the restaurants in the same street, which was good value and had many locals dining there. We walked everywhere from our hotel, except to the Colliseum and the Vatican, we took the train.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: dhenry40
Reviews.Content: We had a five night stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel earlier this month. It was a fabulous hotel located pretty much in the centre of Rome. Rooms and hotel throughout was nicely decorated and clean. Staff were very pleasent and helpful. Would definately stay at this hotel again. Thank you very much for making our holiday to Rome so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: snapshotgraham
Reviews.Content: Arrive on 12th May, checked into room 622 (don't have this one!), by 2 rather grumpy and pre-occupied reception staff. Taken to our room by a cheerful little porter, but have to say room was looking very tired and small. No bath in room and tiny shower. I asked to be moved as I had requested a 'nice' room as it was my wifes 40th birthday treat!, but this was all they had left apparently! Disheartened, and told to check the following day if a better room was available, the wife and I went for a meal. Upon our return I thought we'd try the roof bar - BIG MISTAKE , how does 28 EUROS sound for a Vodka & tonic, and a Martini & lemonade. They were large, but did'nt make same mistake again. Breakfast OK, nothing special. Moved us to room 544 next day, much better, but view of the courtyard. Staff attitude improved, and were friendly towards the end, but I was all in all a little dissapointed in the hotel after reading such good reviews on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazCarleton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marcella with my sister and 3 friends to celebrate my 40th birthday.The staff made our stay an unbelievable experience through there recommendations and bookings,they couldn't be faulted on how friendly and helpful they were.The roof top terrace is a must with a bottle of wine or two.We enjoyed walking to the main attractions as we felt you saw alot more of Rome on the way.Would love to go back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaHerts
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel in a perfect area of Rome. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room was quite small, but very clean. This hotel is in a quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of Rome, but only a five minute walk from the metro. The hotel suggested restaurants close to the hotel and they were excellent and far cheaper than those in the tourist areas. Whilst in Rome we went on a wonderful guided tour of the Colliseum and Forum with a company called 'Through Eternity.com'. We booked online before travelling. The tour was brilliant and really brought the Forum and Colliseum to life, worth every penny. I would definately do a tour with them again next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: peripatetic4
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal is a nice hotel, located close to the train station and a 15-20 minute walk from many tourist areas. The staff was helpful and the rooms were clean, spacious and well appointed. I wanted to write this review to let future guests know a few things I hadn't seen mentioned: First, when you book, you may not want to be on the 6th floor if you don't want to wake up early. The sixth floor is directly under the tiled breakfast area, and the noise from breakfast prep -- footsteps, noisy scraping chairs, tables -- starts at about 5 a.m., and IT'S LOUD! Second, avoid booking a tour through the hotel concierge, unless they switch tour recommendations and dump Carrani Tours as their primary preference. We made reservations for a Vatican Museum tour through the hotel, because we weren't able to get them in advance and wanted to avoid the long lines during Holy Week. But this has to be the worst tour of the Vatican Museums in existence. It should have been advertised as "20-minute visit to the Sistine Chapel with a side trip to the gift shop" Basically, the tour consisted of a bus ride to the museum, lots of time spent standing around while the group waited for its tickets, followed by a dash through the hallways to the Sistine Chapel, 20 minutes in the chapel and a dash back to the bus and the gift shop. Fortunately, my family knew enough about the museums to leave the tour group before it went through the exits ... This is not a tour for anyone who wants to actually SEE the Vatican Museums. If you want to book a reservation, contact the Vatican directly roughly two- to four-weeks before your trip, visiteguidate.musei@scv.va Or, if you really want to take a guided tour of the Vatican Museums, do your research and find another company besides Carrani.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Gem”
Reviews.Author: BAC42
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel partly due to Favourable reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed . My Wife celebrated her Birthday whilst in Rome and the staff .(Alexandra who ordered the Roses,Salvatore at the Bar and Pietro who booked some cracking Restaurants and organised the Cake) all put themselves out to ensure that my Wife had a Special Day. Would Highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Meelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marcella Royal from April 6th to 9th. The hotel is great. Location good. Rooms are a good size. But I paid a rate of €100 each fro a twin room with breakfast and for that rate felt that it was not good value. If travelling to Rome again I would pay a little bit more to get a better hotel. A friend of mine stayed at the Sofitel and was very happy with it . I booked the Marcella Royal based on the number of reviews in trip advisor. There were many positive reviews. However when I got to the hotel - managemenet incuded a welcome note that advises one to write a review on this site. Breakfast was only OK - fruit salad was from a tin. No fresh fruit.. Only scrambled eggs and bacon availbale on the hot side. The location is good. There are a number of local restaurants that the reception will recommend that are really really good - I would recommend number 38 on via flavia - can't rememember the name. Also San Vincenzo is another good restaurant that is within minutes of the hotel. In summary - I was very happy with the hotel but felt that I would have paid a little bit more for a lot better. If you get this hotel at a rate of €75pp then book it otherwsie spend a little more and stay closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikkiPScotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, 10 minutes from Termini Station so easy to walk. 15 minutes walk from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain so well situated. Many nice restaurants nearby. Very clean hotel with chatty and professional staff. Breakfast looking over the rooftops of Rome was a highlight and the evening Piano Bar was a relaxing way to finish the day after walking for miles around the sights. Would definitely recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views from the Roof”
Reviews.Author: Tobago_Magic
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary through KLM; we were not disappointed. We had a superior room which had the addition of a small sitting room . the room was spotless and all the facilities were in good condition. Sad to say no Tea/ Coffee making equipment in the room. The staff were the most pleasant and helpful I have ever come across in a City Centre Hotel. Each night a Restaurant was recommended and again, we were not disappointed. The view from the Roof Restaurant was wonderful, across most of the City. Breakfast was provided with a range of foods from the standard Continental to Cereal, Scambled Eggs and Bacon and Pastries. Sad that it was not open for lunches. Taxi Bookings were spot on and punctual including one for our return trip to the Airport (saved 10 euros on the going rate). Its location was within walking distance of most of the sites with the exception of the Vatican. But the staff put us onto the right bus service so again, wonderful service. In conclusion I would recommend this Hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: skitzySuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a mid week break and it was perfect. The hotel was very clean, friendly and on a very quiet street 20 minutes walk from the hustle and bustle. The roof top terrace with its amazing views across the city was a lovely start to the day as was the breakfast with gorgeous croissants and pastries. We had a couple of drinks in the bar which like most hotels were very expensive but what the hell we were on holiday. Each evening we tried a different resturant in the same street as the hotels which were all very pleasant and busy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a short break in the Hotel Marcella Royal and I would recommend it to everyone. The rooms are nice and spacious, the staff are all excellent and speak fluent English and the rooftop breakfast room on the 7th floor affords the most amazing views of Rome. I will definitely be staying here again when I next visit Rome. Tip: there is a great restaurant on the same street as this hotel called Il Sorriso - highly recommended for great quality food and very reasonable prices. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love it ...a true home away from home”
Reviews.Author: valentino42
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic say I had. I was a single women and chose this hotel from another single woman's review. I must say, everything was very clean and the staff treated me like a queen. I booked a single room and wished I had taken a picture. Although it was very small, the sunken bedroom was a nice way to make a small room seen a little bigger. The neighborhood was very quite with many nice restaurants to enjoy a true Italian meal. Although it was a little away from the center of Rome,i never once felt unsafe as I walked everywhere. The buffet breakfast was very well done and well stocked: scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, pastries, toast, jiuce, coffe, tea, fresh fruit, coldcuts (ham and salami), and cheese (provolone and a white sliced cheese). Although it was a little chilly, I had the pleasure to enjoy a glass of wine up at their bar. The view is wonderful. Overall, a great value for the money. The staff treated you like you were at a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Paddy107
Reviews.Content: I am just getting around to reviewing our trip to Rome. i first have to tell everyone that Rome gets has an undeserved reputation as not being overly tourist friendly. My whole family felt that the people of Roma were very friendly and went out of their way for travelers. A good place to start is with the hotels stayed in. All the staff at the Royal Marcella were great, they could not have been any more helpful. Our family of 4 had a suite or an apartment. This is a nice setup because there was only one outer door, but behind that my girls had their room and my wife and I had ours. Everything was very clean and the service was great. The breakfast was very average for Europe but what a great view we had up on the roof. I also recommend a glass of wine at sunset. Thanks for being part of a great trip/ The only downside is that the hotel is a little out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: readingcoach
Reviews.Content: I was t here for 4 days and the hotel couldn't have been more perfect. The staff was friendly and fabulous about giving directions and advice to tourists. The rooftop restaurant offered a sumptuous breakfast with a view of the city! It was accessible to busses but in a quiet area. Rooms were large, too! Can't say enough good things. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Marcella Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SophC
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. Nothing fancy but clean. However, it was classified as a 4 star... and we didn't find there what we normallly would expect in a 4 star hotel (especially if you pay the price of a 4 star hotel). There is no bar, no pool. A little bit disappointed, but centrally located and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mysisfafu
Reviews.Content: My old man and I stayed at the Marcella Royal Hotel for four nights. We don't have much travel experience, and this was our first (of hopefully many) trip to Roma, Italia. The hotel itself is beautiful, not overwhelming, and stands with 7 floors. It lives on a quiet street near the Termini (but still at a safe distance from it). The concierge was quite helpful at ensuring we made the most of our day by helping us with directions, giving up tips on what to see, where to eat, and shop. Alessandro was most helpful at concierge and we really appreciated all of his advice. Now, the rooms. I've read many reviews prior to our trip to Italia, and many people complain about the rooms being very small in Europe. I felt our rooms were perfectly adequate for the two of us. We had a nice queen size bed, and our room was decorated with tasteful pieces of art. The bathroom was smaller than expected, but it served its purpose well. The best area of all, was the garden on the roof! The view was specacular of Roma, especially while the sun set. Every morning a fantastic continental breakfast was set out and you could feast on it while you gazed upon Roma in the morning light. So beautiful! I was so sad to leave Roma and our hotel! I hope the Trevi fountain makes good on its promise and returns me there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marcella Royal”
Reviews.Author: ej1970
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day break in Rome and stayed the Marcella Royal. I is quite difficult to decide on a hotel in Rome manly due to the large amount but I booked this hotel based on the favourable reviews posted on this site. My experience of the hotel is very good. Staff are wonderful, very welcoming and helpfull. The rooms are small but cosy, extremely clean there is even a turn down service at night, which is a nice touch. The breakfast is your standard continental breakfast with eggs and bacon. The breakfast is served in a wonderful breakfast room which has a panoramic view of the city - beautiful. The hotel is situated about 15 - 20 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain. It is on a quiet street which has a number of lovely restaurants so there is no need to go into the centre of the city from dinner. It was actually a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the city. Rome is a beautiful city, while we were there the weather was perfect and due to it being low season - no queues which was fantastic. If you are planning a trup to Rome I would highly recommend this hotel, it is not luxurious but it is very welcoming and cosy and helped make our trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoisinH
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in Rome last weekend and it was superb! Hotel was lovely. We upgraded to a 'room of special comfort' when we got there for 40€ extra per night. We didn't see the normal room but the room we had was lovely. great shower, bed, fridge, tv, views from window. hotel was lovely overall. breakfast was quite simple but did the job. piano bar and balcony were lovely but were quiet...i presume that is to do with the season. we did walk sometimes but to be honest we got a taxi to the vatican and to ancent rome for dinner one night...more laziness than distance. really enjoyable stay. would reccommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love Rome”
Reviews.Author: NottsUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent break in Rome. The hotel was clean, comfprtable and well placed for the city.. we walked everywhere. Great breakfasts too plus a fridge in your room. Rome itself blew us away. An amazing city and we will return. Jan was a great time to go in terms of no queues at any of the key sights... something that some of my pals have experienced. I think as we've now seen the key sights next time we go back we'll go in slightly warmer weather and just enjoy the place. Not that the weather was bad in Jan... reasonably mild and dry! This is one of our favourite cities... GO!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “an absolute pleasure to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: TripperIreland
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms and bathrooms. But the staff are what makes the hotel. They could not have done any more for us. Ten out of ten for service with a smile. I would highly reccommend the hotel if you want a hassle free trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: RomevisitorUk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked the hotel as a surprise so I had no preconceptions, but from the moment I arrived to the moment I left I loved every detail from the tasteful beautiful decore, the outstanding hospitality and assisstance of staff, the perfect location close yet quite and private. The roof top restuarant is the most romantic way to have breakfast you can imagine. The rooms are big and luxurious, yet homely and comforting. We stayed in 538, the view from the balcony is gorgeous, my boyfriend proposed to me on that balcony and we will also hold the hotel close to our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Martin22
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel, set about 15 mins walk from the centre of town. Very smart, very elegent, but not uncomfortably so. The rooms are nicely furnished and have good facilities. Breakfast is served in a room with great views over town. There's a bar on the roof with even better views. Cost £72 GBP for the one night I spent there in January, and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Book it”
Reviews.Author: The_Lost_Beaver
Reviews.Content: Basically you can (waste) spend alot of time looking for the right hotel.... dont bother just stay here. This hotel is a clean, ever so friendly, good safe location, big bedded and near restaurants! The staff to everything to help you out and you can have a very good breakfast every morning looking at St Peters. If I had to come up with some not so good points (and it's a bit of a struggle) I would say if you're after a hotel you could come back to during the day you probably wouldnt want this hotel- however you spend the whole day sightseeing so I dont see this as an issue. We walked it from the station (10 minutes) and had no problems at all while here. Altohugh I think staying in Trastevere could be a better experiance I would actually come back to this hotel thanks to the staff, quiet location and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Librarian757
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Marcella Royal in November and December for a two week vacation in Italy. This was my first trip to Italy so I have no other hotels to compare it to but I found it met our needs well. Our room was clean and the staff were very helpful. The majority of attractions were within reasonable walking distance (15-20 min. walk) and others could be accessed via the Metro or buses. Particularly, Pietro, a member of the hotel staff at the front desk took excellent care of my husband and I. We hadn't seen each other in 8 months due to military deployment and he set us up with great restaurant reservations and champagne toasts at one of them. He made sure we were well taken care of at the hotel and I can't thank him enough for making our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnjoewood
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed from the 30/11/07 to 03/12/07 to celerbrate our 30th Wedding anniversary. I chose this hotel from the previous reviews and can say we were not disappointed. The room was very good but did lack tea and coffee making facilities like in the UK. The staff were brilliant and very helpful the room was always immaculate and very comfortable. The main sites local to the hotel are the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain both within 15 to 20 mins walk. The weather was very good so we decided to walk to the vatican city which took 1 hour 20 mins and seen a lot of wonderful sites on route. ( You tend to sit in long traffic jams in a taxi which is on the meter) We are planning to visit Rome again and will only stay at this hotel because of the wonderful experience we have had. Joe & Janice Wood Cumbria England

Reviews.Title: “will go again”
Reviews.Author: bullpig
Reviews.Content: booked through last-minute.com. Price was a bit more than I would normally pay but i decided on this hotel based on reviews on tripsadvisor. Well worth paying extra for. great reception staff. clean room, with great view. we loved the terrace at the top of the hotel. Initially I thought it was a bit far from the centre, but in fact we could quite easily walk in to all the main sites. I would go here again, and am grateful for you other people who put in these reviews and caused me to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of hotel in great city.”
Reviews.Author: MarkyB73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 great nights in Rome. The hotel was very impressive from the start. Desk staff were great especially Allesandro who even managed to get us some football tickets for the Champions League match that we went to. Nothing was to much trouble. Views from the rooftop were breathtaking, and breakfast was very good . The hotel room was spotless and a good size with and additional single bed in the room. Location was ideal 10/15 mins walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. All major sites close by and easy to get to the Vatican by Metro. Would stay here again full marks to the Marcella Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, Rooftop Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: hobbitsky
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed in this hotel one night prior to flying out after a cruise. The staff were friendly and professional, which is something we found lacking in our other Rome hotel 3 weeks earlier in which we stayed for 5 nights. The roof top garden is a lovely area perfect for a meal or just to sip a drink or have a cappacino. The room was lovely and clean. The breakfast room was lovely overlooking the rooftops of the city and the food was delicious. Would recommend this hotel. The only drawback is It is a little further away from sights but transport is close. Listen to their advice on any trip you wish to take.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalwoman_7
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel was absolutely amazing! We highly recommend staying here if your travel plans take you to Rome. The hotel staff is extremely knowledgable and friendly. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The roof top bar offers an enchanting panaromic view of Rome and you can eat breakfast or dinner while looking upon the dome of St. Peter's Bascilica. The location is perfect with many wonderful, quaint and delicious restrurants on a quiet side street. The neighborhood is in the heart of the govermental district and is filled with embasies from all over the world. The location is perfect. The hotel is situated within a 15 minute walk of Via Veneto, the old outer wall, the Borghese Gardens, the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Nuvera and the Pantheon. This hotel was a definite value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Marcella Royal Hotel--Rome”
Reviews.Author: Zooga
Reviews.Content: The Marcella was a decent hotel overall. We didn't have what I'd consider to be complaints, but some aspects could have been better. Pros: The front desk were friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions. The room was a reasonable size with a good view (we had the 6th floor) of the city in the distance. It was clean and the room service did a good job as well. It was in a good part of the city. Breakfast was better than most with eggs, bacon, cereal, milk, tea, etc. Things that could have been better: Shower was extremely small but certainly not a deal breaker. Hotel was convenient to the termini but the rest of the city was distant. The best bet was to take a bus (which were often very crowded in the evening) or walk to the metro and take the subway (also crowded in the pm). Normally I wouldn't complain much about them being crowded but with the threat of pickpockets and thiefs it was unnerving. Overall a very good stay. I don't mean to point out the negatives but for nearly $300 US a night I want to expect more. However, maybe I have to resign myself to the higher prices of Italy/Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Unniepot
Reviews.Content: Marcella was situated in a good location just far enough out of the hustle and bustle but near enough for the sights. Staff were very helpful and recommended some very reasonable restaurants in the area upon our request. When we arrived, there was some renovation work going on in the hotel during the day. We contacted the desk to complain about the noise and the problem was sorted. The rooms are quite small for the price, but are clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was great, good selection. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sandiebeaches
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this fabulous hotel, which is located off a main road, 10 mins walk from termini, in a very pleasant area. The room wasn't very big but it was tastefully decorated and well laid out with plenty of wardrobe space. There is a beautiful roof terrace to have your buffet breakfast, or indoors, still with panoramic views. The breakfast was great - a continental type, but still came with bacon and scrambled eggs which pleased my husband no end! It certainly sets you up for the day! At night the roof terrace turns into a romantic 'piano' bar. To be honest, the pianist was awful and played only 'elevator music' badly. He looked and sounded like he wished he wasn't there and didn't interact with the few customers that were there. However, the really nice barman made up for it as he was so pleasant. We were only having a quick drink before heading off to dinner and maybe on the way back, its not the type of bar I'd stay at. For reference it was €6.00 for .4l or beer and €4 for a glass of wine. This rates as about the same you'd pay at the expensive cafes on the piazzas. The only other negative things I say about the hotel is that they don't have an iron available and the really old 'make a lot of noise but not much air' fitted hairdryer was dissapointing. For a four star hotel I would expect not to have to walk around all crumpled!!! On the whole though I was pleased with our choice, but if I was going again I would stay nearer the Trastevere area as it oozes charm and eating and drinking are very good and very reasonably priced. Tips for Rome - bring walking shoes, go on the open top bus first and get you bearings its great, go to the Cisten Chapel later rather than earlier as there is NO queue, but it does take an hour minimum to walk to the chapel once you get inside the vatican museum, so time it well as they close early afternoon. The best thing we did was bring binoculars, everyone borrowed them!! If you go up to the Capitol and look down on the Forum its brill and also for the ceiling of the Cisten Chapel. There's loads of restaurants near the hotel, but I felt ill after eating at the first one on the right coming out of the hotel. Apart from feeling ill it was the only restaurant we didn't enjoy on our trip. We highly recommend the pizzeria/restaurant further down the road on the right hand side, it brightly lit so you wont miss it, with tables outside, is reasonbly priced and packed with locals and travellers alike. I threw a coin the in Trevi fountain twice so with a bit of luck I'll get back to Rome a couple more times. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus7Ithaca
Reviews.Content: Having arrived on a wet afternoon my wife and I decided to walk to the Hotel from the Termini station. Not a good start. The Hotel dispelled all our fears and we had nothing but praise for the cleanliness of the rooms (fresh sheets & towels every day), the bed turned down every night with a little card and a couple of sweets on the pillow (not necessary but a thoughtful touch). The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was a self service buffet -style and a wide choice to suit all tastes - the roof garden in the early morning was a beautiful setting. We enjoyed a lovely weekend in very warm sunshine and were more than happy to walk to all of the major sites and found the Hotel within reach of almost all attractions except the Vatican which we reached by Metro from Termini (1 euro each one way). I very rarely respond to requests to review accommodation but was so impressed by Marcella Royal I feel it's only right to share a fantastic 4 days with other visitors. You will not find a better hotel in Rome for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ajfMinnesota
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella Royal Hotel in September. Overall the hotel was just "fine". We loved the roof top piano bar. It provided great views of the city and a was a wonderful place to unwind after a long day in Rome. The front desk staff was EXCELLENT! They always had great recommendations for dinner & were very willing to help. The location wasn't the greatest. Everything was about a 20 minute walk. Rome isn't the easist city to find your way around so if you get lost (like we did) a 20 minute walk easily turns into 40. The rooms were fine. Everything was clean, but small. The shower was REALLY small and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Marcella Royal”
Reviews.Author: kenmcewan
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about booking independently especially as this was our first visit to Rome. Our worries were soon allayed as the hotel was quite delightful. The front desk staff were extremely obliging and made excellent recommendations for nearby restaurants. The rooftop dining was very pleasant offering great views of the city. The room was small but comfortable and clean. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warning for single travellers!”
Reviews.Author: Icecoldlogic
Reviews.Content: A warning to all single travellers staying at this hotel: avoid rooms 316 and 318 otherwise you will have to climb three steps to enter these rooms and have to climb three steep steps every time you want to get from the bedroom to the bathroom. My elderly mother came with me to Rome and as we were staying for six nights you would have expected to receive better rooms than we did. When I asked for my mother to be moved to a different room I was told that there was nothing available. Not exactly the helpful response I was hoping for. Plus points for this hotel are a decent continental breakfast and a fabulous view from the rooftop garden but to reiterate my earlier warning : avoid rooms 316 and 318 and don't expect any help from those at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: American_in_UK2007
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a room at another hotel, was told they were overbooked when I arrived, and was being moved to the Royal Marcella. I was very annoyed by this but ended up extremely happy with the move. Royal Marcella is located on a quiet street with lovely views from the roof top, and clean, nicely appointed rooms. It's the staff that really shines though - they are friendly, professional and very gracious, which is especially appreciated by solo travellers, such as myself. I had a very comfortable stay in a lovely city, and will remember and recommend the Royal Marcella very highly.

Reviews.Title: “marcella royale hotel and romaround tours”
Reviews.Author: webbo110
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the marcella royale hotel, for a 3 night stay. excellant hotel although a little far out, but still within walking disatance of all the attractions. Room was on the small side, but very clean. Breakfast was superb and also the roof top terrace which was very relaxing after a long day. Would highly recommend the tour of the Vatican with Micheal Bird from 'romaround' tours, he was an excellant tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Scarrface
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is a bit out of the way of the main attractions - Spanish Steps about 10-15 mins walk and a bus ride to the Forum and St Peter's it meant it was relatively quiet in the evening. The roof terrace is fabulous although the views are spoilt by the number of cranes carrying out building work. There are lots of good restaurants in the area. The room was good although the shower cubicle was quite small. The food at breakfast time was adequate. The stafff on reception were very helpful with travel requirements to sights etc. This is a good quality hotel and would recommend it for a short break to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: parkfun
Reviews.Content: As others have said, while the hotel is just a little out of the way - still easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps, etc. - it is WELL worth the effort!! The staff couldn't be more kind, the rooms are terrific and the rooftop bar/breakfast are OUTSTANDING! I would definitely recommend the hotel and we will be staying there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at this friendly and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lellie1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely short break in Rome staying at the Marcella Royal Hotel. As this was a special birthday celebration for my mother -in-law we took particular care in choosing where to stay. We were certainly not disappointed with our choice. The hotel is located a little way out from the main tourist areas but certainly near enough to walk comfortably to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The hotel itself was extremely clean and rooms attractive and comfortable. Breakfasting on the roof terrace was delightful and a super place to return to in the evenings for a relaxing drink after a hard days sightseeing. All the staff were friendly and helpful and willing to give advice regarding good restaurants or directions to particular sights. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as a excellent base from which to explore the delights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great terrace, great service”
Reviews.Author: texas_cole
Reviews.Content: The hotel balanced traditional Italian decor with modern function and convenience. The room was elegantly decorated (though my partner found it nauseating) with patterned wall fabric and the bed was very comfortable. The nicest touch was the window which had an extra solid panel blocking out any light and noise. As the other reviewers mention, the real star of the hotel is the terrace which boasts great views, nice patio furniture and well-kept plantings. The breakfast was ok, but they skimped on the quality of the bacon and the coffee urn was filled with the distinct taste of instant coffee - quite unexpected in Italy. When we arrived, I asked about going to the Vatican, and it was suggested we go on a 7:15AM 3-hour tour costing over 50 euros each. Didn't feel like paying that much nor waking that early and was glad we didn't when we went on our own later. Perhaps the hotel got a share of the proceeds? When we got there, one of the two lifts was not operating. Surprisingly, it got fixed very quickly over the weekend - impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Bill Clinton stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMoxen
Reviews.Content: We had already read all of the wonderful reviews of the Marcella Royal Hotel before booking and when we arrived, we were not disappointed. The staff were excellent, the rooms were well presented and were serviced twice every day. The roof top terrace was a delight. We ate breakfast there and had pre-dinner and after dinner drinks there as we listened to the pianist. The only negative I can think of regarding this hotel is that they do not have irons available. So I'd advise you to take a travel iron. I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jetlag2007
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights exploring Rome and the Marcella was a nice place to come "home" to. The 7th floor bar and breakfast area was really nice with some good views of the city. The staff was very friendlly and the neighborhood sported some good restaurants and trattorias. We were very pleased and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to celebrate Ruby wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: WirralSunlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days to celebrate our Ruby Wedding Anniversary. The hotel was all we could have wished, with very friendly and helpful staff. Reception were able to advise on where to eat at night other than the roof garden. The room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was very good on the roof garden and it was nice to relax with a drink in the evening in the Piano bar.The location was very convenient for most of the main sites and travelling by bus was very easy and convenient as you can purchase tickets from hotel reception. Overall a wonderful experience for our 4 days in Rome. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: garcolm
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was convenient for Termini railway station (yet avoided the seediness of the immediate station area) and because it was only a short walk to the parkland of the Villa Borghese. The Marcella Royal is a little way off the bustling tourist area of the western part of the City (but only a leisurely walk away) and is located between government ministries and bank headquarters to the south and a prosperous residential area to the north. We benefited from easy access to the many small businesses that were geared to serve the native population rather more than the tourist industry and which was reflected in terms of price and quality. The hotel staff were at all times friendly and courteous and would go out of their way to be helpful. Our room was beautifully decorated in gold brocade fabric, double glazed and air conditioned and equipped with TV and minibar. The beds were bliss and were always beautifully made. The bathroom was perfectly equipped: toilet, bidet, washbasin, bath, shower, hair drier, big mirrors and lots and lots of soft white towels. Our room was at the front of the hotel and since my sinuses do not cope well with air conditioning, I prefered to sleep with it off and the windows open. The road outside could be noisy from about 6am but if the windows were closed, outside noise was not a problem. The roof top garden, breakfast room and bar were very pleasant indeed. Breakfast was self service but the layout meant that guests did tend to get into each other's way at peak times. It was nevertheless delightful to start the day with plenty of good food, fresh air and a panorama of the city. The roof garden was often deserted in an afternoon and provided a quiet and comfortable retreat after a long walk round the city. I particularly liked it in the evening for a night cap and the bar staff matched the friendliness and high standards of service of the rest of the staff. Staying at the Marcella Royal added significantly to the enjoyment of our holiday. The staff were welcoming and eager to please and the hotel itself provided a very comfortable base and welcome retreat from the exertions of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marcella Royal”
Reviews.Author: MarcellaT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I throughly enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Marcella Royal. The staff was very professional and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable.We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: takenote
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at this very nice hotel in a very hot July 2007. I read many other trip advisor reviews prior to booking direct on hotels own website (worked out cheaper then other hotel/accommodation web sites). I was pleased that most of the reviews turned out to be accurate and honest - the hotel was lovely. Situated in an upmarket part of the city (felt very safe at all times) and close enough to walk to several main attractions ie: Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Roman Forum to name a few. Vatican is a underground ride away, but it's kind of out on it's own anyway, so you're better off in this part of the city to be near a majority of sites. The hotel was small compared and extremely friendly and helpful. It was spotless and had everything you needed for a really comfortable stay. The roof terrace is the hotels best feature. Overlooking the city, with views of St.Peters dome, it was a real pleasure to relax after a day spent walking miles in 37oF and sip a cocktail or two. Breakfast, during the summer, is also served out on the terrace .. lovely. The reception staff are very helpful and always put us in the right direction (shopping/transport links/restaurants etc). I was advised by a well travelled friend not to book anywhere less then 200 Euros/night in Rome as it could be dodgy. I'm glad I followed their advise. I visited Rome back in 1996 and I have to say it's really cleaned up it's act. No dog mess on pavements!! and underground is air conditioned and spotlessly clean. We had a great weekend and the hotel complemented it perfectly. You wont be disappointed with the Marcella, it's a good 4 star hotel in a great location. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Marcella Royal!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLouWho
Reviews.Content: My family & I just returned from a three-night stay at the Marcella Royal. This hotel is worthy of its 4-star rating. The room was spacious (by European standards) and very nicely furnished. The staff was friendly & helpful, and their English was impeccable. I loved the rooftop restaurant. The breakfast buffet boasted lots of variety, although scrambled eggs & sausage were the only hot items. The pastries were yummy, and they had an excellent assortment of hot tea. We had dinner on the rooftop restaurant one night. They tell you they are not a full-fledged restaurant, but the offering was certainly extensive enough -- several different antipastos, main courses and desserts. The hotel is about a 10-minute walk from the metro, but, then, the metro in Rome isn't very extensive. It's close to Termini train terminal. I wouldn't want to walk it with a lot of luggage, but if you travel light, it's not that far. (We took a taxi from the train station; the fare was under 10 euros.) It's close to several nice restaurants, some nice boutiques, and a couple of major attractions, including the Baths of Diocletian and Rome's national museum. Next time in Rome, I've no doubt we'll return to the Marcella.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Marcella Royal”
Reviews.Author: cattailcruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella in Rome for two nights in June, 2007, before our cruise from the Port of Civitavecchia. We arrived at the hotel around 9 am; our rooms were not yet ready so the hotel staff stored our bags in a secure place. We hit the streets and were at the Trevi Fountain after a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel! We stopped for a latte (oh so yummy) and threw our 3 coins in the fountain to ensure our return visit to Roma! We walked to the Pantheon and then to Piazza Navona for our first Roman lunch... I had pizza and vino. After this we returned to the hotel; our room was ready, so we unpacked, rested a bit, and showered. We asked the desk clerk for a restaurant recommendation that was good, but walkable (since we were still a bit jet lagged)... The hotel manager escorted us to his favorite restaurant where we had a lovely dinner. Following dinner, we went to the Marcella's roof top bar for a cocktail and dancing under the Roman stars! It was lovely. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. The location was perfect, the breakfast was yummy, the rooms comfortable, the hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. What else could we ask for? A perfect start to a European vacation!

Reviews.Title: “marcella Royal was everything hoped and more.”
Reviews.Author: PJSPOINTSOFVIEW
Reviews.Content: Rome Marcella Royal Hotel. Reviewer Trip Advisor Member Leicester England We have recentley returned from 4 wonderful days in Rome at the Marcella Royal Hotel the hotel was everything we hoped for and more. Close enough to all of the spectacular historical sites churches etc. Taxis from thr hotel between 15/20 EUROS to most of these sites. Away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough. The staff were very friendly and helpfull with directions , booking tables at restaurants and taxis .Breakfast was a delight every morning taken on the roof terrace covered with flowering shrubs and plants. Breakfast was excellant with plenty of choices well layed out and constantly refilled there is also a bar for that nightcap after dinner. The hotel and its staff made our stay very enjoyable and we would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: SRome
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal is a great hotel. The rooms are nice, comfortable and quiet. The rooftop bar is a great place to relax before dinner or to listen to piano music later in the evening. The hotel staff was very helpful and polite, especially Michelle. They helped us retrieve our lost luggage, set up day trips to other cities and gave great restaurant recommendations. It is in a good location. It is within walking distance to all of the hot spots. We stayed for 10 days and were extremely satisfied with the Marcella.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TrevorHCo_Down_UK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Enjoyed breakfast alfresco on the roof. Staff very helpful and friendly. Room adequate. Standard double room had shower in stead of bath. Room very clean and well appointed but would have benefitted from coffee making facility in room. However would thoroughly recommend the Marcella Royal and will use it again - thanks for a very enjoyable stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Marcella!”
Reviews.Author: carybro
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome after a six day stay which was totally enhanced by staying at The Marcella Royal. As we always do when travelling, we relied on Tripadvisor for hotel choices. We arrived early and had booked one of the two suites,which was ready.However, it was the wrong suite( I had requested the jacuzzi suite) and we were told to return in an hour. The staff then tracked us down to the roof terrace( no idea how they knew we were there! ) and had moved all our luggage to the requested suite,even re-hanging our coats in the wardrobe. This was a lovely, very spacious room ( 428). All the staff were SO attentive and always smiling-and very helpful with restaurant bookings etc; Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eyeluvitaly
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our 17 day vacation throughout Italy and Prague. We stayed here for 5 nights. This was by far our favorite hotel. It is worth the cost! The front desk men were the best part of the hotel. They helped us book dinner reservations and tours, showed us on a map where to go for a day and all the stops we should make along the way, etc. They were such a huge help and if you stay here you should definitely take advantage of that. The room was decent size, bathroom was large, safety deposit box in closet and nice size closet. We had windows that opened to the street. Breakfast was good: cereal, pastries, croissants, eggs, bacon, ham, prosciutto, orange juice, etc. It is served until 10am. Many days we had a hard time waking up for that(because we would go out the night before). The rooftop area was nice to go on for drinks. We did not eat at the restaurant there. It is not in a central location of all the tourist places but I actually liked it better. It was quiet. I went with my best friend and we had a blast! Most of the people staying at the hotel were older couples. We walked to most places. The Trevi Fountain and Pantheon were about a 30-45 minute walk but we would stop a long the way and were walking pretty slow. The Colosseum was a 15-20 minute walk. There is plenty of good restaurants right around the hotel. If you are young and looking to go out you should go to Campo De Fiori - bars, pubs and clubs. A great place to go for dinner is Piazza Navona - it is an area not an actual restaurant. There are so many restaurants in and around that area. Right around the Spanish Steps is all the high end designer clothing stores (Dior, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, etc.) Of the three cities we went to in Italy(Rome, Florence and Venice), Rome was by far our most favorite. We stayed five nights and could have stayed longer. Definitely take a tour of the Vatican, Sistine Chapel and St. Peters Basilica(should be one package). We learned so much and you skip the 3 hour long line. I will most definitely stay at Marcella Royal again! Great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment at the Marcella Royal Roma”
Reviews.Author: ItalianHoliday
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel for the comfort, cleanliness, size, location and professional staff. The rooftop garden for breakfast was a wonderful way to start each day in Rome. Salvatore made each evening all the more special with his gracious hospitality and humor while enjoying the Roman sunsets. My friend became ill on our last night and the staff helped in every way to assure our comfort. They all took special interest and helped beyond measure. Thank you to Alesandro, Alesandra, Michele, and all of the staff for helping to make our stay memorable. We will return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bosham
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a 5 days at the Marcella Royal Hotel. Our first time in Rome and it won't be our last, already planning our next visit! We decided not to pay for transfers to and from the hotel to the airport as the train station was close by (11 euro's by train 45 by taxi!) We speak no Italian but had no problems getting to where we wanted to go. Recommend you take a good street map as walking to the various sights means you see so much more of the City. The Hotel itself was very clean and the staff exceptionally helpful. On our first day we had problems with the air conditioning unit in our room but once we mentioned this we were immediately moved to another. Recommend you ask for a room with balcony, these appear to be more spacious and have a bigger bathroom. The buffet breakfast served on the rooftop garden had plenty of choice, cereals,toast,fresh fruit,egg and bacon, cold meats and cheese, and my favourite- pastries!!! The whole trip was excellent and we will definitley be making future visits to see the sights we were unable to fit in this time.

Reviews.Title: “Wot? No upgrade........??”
Reviews.Author: Skipoet_&_Screamalot
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed for three nights over a weekend - I'd e-mailed the hotel back in November to book an upgrade and received a confirmation e-mail back assuring me that everything would be in order. I was a little disappointed on arrival to be told that no upgrade was available even though I was brandishing the written confirmation. However, the room we had (644) was extremely comfortable with a street view but no balcony. But it was a nice touch (maybe a conciliatory one?) to find a very pleasant bottle of chilled Prosecco waiting for us when we returned from the Spanish Steps that night. We didn't eat in the hotel at night, so can't comment on that, but the front desk recommendations were generally very good. Hotel location is mercifully quiet in such a vibrant city, but a little way out from the centre - however it's only 20 - 25 mins walk to the Colosseum. We didn't walk to St Peter's, but I'd guess at 45 mins to an hour? By the way, it's definitely worth booking a Vatican tour in advance as we did - either through the hotel or on the internet. You'll still end up in a queue of other tour parties, but only for 30 mins at most - if you turn up on your own, bank on at least a couple of hours........ Breakfast was basic, but sufficient and it was very pleasant to have the roof terrace - even though I must disagree with previous postings about the view - it's not that great..Salvatore mixes some excellent cocktails and loves it if you attempt some Italian, so give it a go with your phrase book. Reception staff were all excellent - extremely helpful, full of advice and very affable. All in all, definitely recommended - very comfortable and a very welcoming home from home. Ciao !

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended”
Reviews.Author: WandererLancashire
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in May 2007.It was Lorraine's ??th birthday & we wanted to see Rome (for the first time).We chose this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor & we were not disappointed.It is a little bit away from the main attractions, but a 7 minute walk takes you to Termini from where you can get anywhere.The hotel was very clean, the service was excellent,the breakfasts were good (by Continental standards), and above all the rooftop Oasis was the jewel in the crown.We wholeheartedly commend this hotel to anyone - we will certainly look no further when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfkb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 2007. Single room was quite small, but adequate and nice bathroom. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very nice, bacon and eggs along with the usual continental fare of fruit, ham, cheese, bread and pastries. About 10 minutes walk from Termini station on a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2007Ireland
Reviews.Content: Spent ten most enjoyable days in Rome staying at the Marcella Royal. This Hotel surpassed our expectations in every respect. The staff was always available to assist in every way possible, they carried out all requests in an extremely courteous and efficient manner. The Hotel is in a good location, convenient to places of interest and with excellent restaurants and shopping within a short distance. The Hotel is spotlessly clean, our bedroom was spacious and very comfortable. We will definitely return to this Hotel on our future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “would return but”
Reviews.Author: raon
Reviews.Content: While overall we had a good experience here-clean sheets,comfy bed,quiet room,helpful staff,beautiful roof garden with good buffet breakfast choice-it wasnt your usual 4* experience. When we arrived we were a little surprised at the decor in our room-620-it seemed quiet dated(mustard coloured royal wall paper with matching throw on bed,wooden sliding shutters on window covered in what looked like blue contact,step up to get in to shower room and again to small seating area.Similar to the many royal hotels in Irish towns but these would be 3*. However the peacefulness of this hotel grew on us and while it was a good 25 min walk to the spanish steps and about 12min to Termini we would stay here again for the quietness and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: thinkitdoit
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel made really good by the friendly, helpful and attentive staff. Rooms are a good size, location is in a quiet area but near some excellent restaurants,the roof garden is splendid - sitting there after a hard day sightseeing with a cold beer and overlooking Rome - it doesnt get much better. We will definitely be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: william55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella Royal in March for a short break to celebrate a birthday. The hotel was extremely well situated for access to the sights of central Rome and in a safe and comfortable area. The hotel itself met all our expectations of a 4* hotel. The standard of decor is high and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would happily book the hotel again for another visit and recommend to friends .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UkPh
Reviews.Content: From first to last we felt looked after throughout; room was big enough (altho bath a bit narrow, but then im bigger than i used to be!!!!). Michel especially was great - cheeful and helpful (even got the cricket updates from him!!) and he gave us a spot on recommendation for a romantic restaurant too. Other staff were friendly too - and having a Harvey Wallbanger on the roof terrace gazing out at St Peters church is a decent enough combo in anyones book! Easy to walk everywhere in Rome from it (we did!!)...oh and DEFINITELY book the Vatican Museum tour - worth getting up early for the Sistine Chapel alone of course, but seeing the zillion mile long queue that we jumped made it even better!!!! Paul and Olivia, UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marcella Royal for four nights in February and thought it was an excellent hotel. Our room (314) was large, very clean and well decorated. It was on a split level which made it feel more spacious as did the use of mirrors. The bed was extremely comfy and well needed after walking around the city all day! The breakfast room and roof garden were lovely and offered beautiful views of the city. There was a good choice for breakfast, including pastries, fruit, toast, ham, cheese, yoghurts, cereals, bacon and scrambled egg. The staff are very friendly and eager to help; for example, my partner was ill for one of the days and had to stay in the hotel and they phoned the room to check if he was ok and if he needed anything. Also in the morning when we handed our key into reception they asked how he was which we thought was very nice. The hotel is perhaps a little away from a few of the main attractions but we had no problem walking to any of them and thought the location was good. We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on here and finding a ‘four nights for the price of three’ offer. We weren’t disappointed and would definitely recommend this hotel. (if you get a chance to go on the Naples and Pompeii trip which you can book through the hotel, do, it’s definitely worthwhile).

Reviews.Title: “Room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: JeffStranks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in March 2007, and chose the hotel on the basis of reviews here. There were pros and cons. Staff - yes, very attentive. Nice location too, and good breakfast in a pleasant room. My room (312) was a single room and was pretty small - more than one night in a room this size would not have been a pleasant experience, I reckon. Maybe double rooms are better - in which case my overall recommendation would simply be to avoid single rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Beatts
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our first trip to Rome and had a wonderful time .... the hotel, the weather, the city .... nothing was a disappointment. The Marcella Royal is a lovely hotel set in a relatively quiet street with some really nice wine bars / restaurants nearby. It is a ten minute walk from the main Termini station and we found our way there quite easily. We even walked to the Vatican taking in Trevi, Pantheon and Piazza Navona on the way .... slightly sore feet was worth the hour it took us to get there (with a few stops en route for photo's and a drink). The hotel is only a few minutes walk from one of the stops for the 'hop on, hop off' tour bus which costs 18E for a day pass and a local bus into the city costs 1E. This hotel is immaculate and we managed to get four nights for the price of three by shopping around which made it quite good value as the prices do shoot up near to Easter. Our room had a kings size bed with TV, mini bar, air conditioning and a bathroom with corner shower .... it was decorated in gold material on the walls with matching bed cover. The breakfast could be taken in the dining room or on the rooftop terrace which gives fantastic views across the city and there was plenty to choose from. We had one evening meal in there which was also good although the menu doesn't have much choice .... the wine was resonably priced. We also booked a trip to Naples / Pompei via the reception staff who recommended nearby restaurants and provided us with maps, leaflets etc .... they were very friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel is a must if you want a location slightly away from the noise of the city and don't mind walking or taking local transport to the sights ..... we can't wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: clairejb66
Reviews.Content: Just back froma wonderful 3 night stay at the Marcella Royal Hotel. We carried out alot of research before booking our hotel, and were certainly not dissapointed by our choice of accomodation. The hotel was clean, friendly and the Interior was beautiful. Our room exceeded our expectations greatly and we loved coming back there after a long days sightseeing. The breakfast buffet was great and really set us up for the day, but the best thing about the Hotel was the beautiful roof garden where we sat outside overlooking the city, whilst listening to the piano being played untill midnight each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hard to fault !!!”
Reviews.Author: ElPozo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay and I must say that the recent reviews are spot on. We could not fault the hotel or the staff, our room 426 (recently refurbed) was spotlessly clean and a good size for Rome. The breakfast room on the 7th floor doubles up as the piano bar at 7pm and the view is fantastic, prices are really good (15 euros for a bottle of pinot grigio) and all round extremely good value. Locality is ideal as you are just far enough off the tourist path so you can enjoy great food and atmosphere in a number of restaurants frequented by locals who know where to dine. Will definitely return to the Marcella when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Id stay here again”
Reviews.Author: doctordeeps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights of our 12 nights in Italy (our honeymoon!). The hotel was easy to find, the concierge was very helpful and the lobby was beautiful... Our room was typical euro small size, but it was a corner king size room and there was chilled bottle of champagne for us to celebrate our anniversary. i liked it here. it was ina great location- right near Spanish steps, near termini we took the bus tour...everyone was helpful and nice. the breakfast was good. the rooms were nice, modern with plasma screen. it was one fo the better hotels on oru stay and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: StRoamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marcella Royal for the first 3 nights of total 12 night trip to Italy. We arrived on Cristmas night and had a cozy dinner down the street where the front desk guy made reservation for us. It is a quaint, clean hotel with pleasant service. The rooftop breakfast room has an unbeatable view of the city and offered a pretty big spread for Italy standard.(eggs and bacon) The drawbacks however were the shower in the bathroom was very small, even for Italy. It was no bigger than 3 feet by 3 feet space with a curtain around it. You literally had to just stand and shower without moving around. I was afraid I would fall out of it during the shower. Another drawback was that though the location was pretty good in terms of the city, it was just slightly outside of the middle of the city. Close to Piazza Republica, Borghese, and Barberini but little ways to Trevi, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. Overall, we did like the hotel. The staff was professional, breakfast was wonderful and the location was acceptable if you don't mind doing a little walking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sacramentoexplorer
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and I spent hours on the internet planning our trip including finding the perfect hotels for my family of five. We required two affordable rooms that connected. When we arrived from Florence by train, we were able to walk to the Marcella Royal Hotel. The Bellman greeted us with a smile, took our 5 large bags and showed us to our room. We were extremely pleased with how large both rooms were - plenty of space for two adults and three children. Two well equipped bathrooms (a little on the smaller side) but they were extremely clean! The roof top dining is everything they promised in the web site although outdoor seating is best used in the summer time. The breakfast buffet was plentiful. The location is on a quiet street which I appreciated after a full day of walking in and around the sites of Rome. Although the hotel is at the farther end of where most sites are, I liked being in a somewhat non tourist area. We frequented a little neighborhood itialian grocery store and took out dinner one night from a wonderful Greek eatery that was located on the same street and one block away from the hotel. Not only did this Greek restaurant have great food, my son had left our back pack on the table and the next day when we went to see about our back pack the following day, they had it locked up downstairs waiting for us to claim it.. There were also other restaurants and cafes located on the block. I thank all my trip advisor friends (reviewers) for their candid assessment of the Marcella Royal Hotel for that is the sole reason on why I booked this hotel. I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “rome marcella”
Reviews.Author: rometravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over the Christmas period. Our room was very clean and super quiet. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever had. Space in the room and in the bath was sufficient considering you are in a Rome hotel. Staff was very efficient and friendly. Breakfast on the top floor with a view over the city was a nice start for the day. The location is a bit away from the main attractions, a good 35 minutes walk let's say to the Pantheon. Otherwise this place is worth every praise.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family that needed 2 rooms”
Reviews.Author: BeamMeThere
Reviews.Content: This was a surprisngly nice hotel. We were a family of 4 and needed 2 rooms and had asked for connecting rooms ahead. I'm always appehensive about these requests since most of the time you get there and they say they're out of connecting rooms. In this case it was perfect. Rather than connecting rooms, this was one that had one door and once you enter the room, it further splits into 2 rooms. The rooms were good size and very clean. I must say either the people next door were quiet or the hotel has good sound insulation as we did not have any issues with noise at all. We only made it to breakfast once but it was suffiecient and the terrace is lovely. The location of the hotel to sights is not very convenient but the bus nearby helped. The hotel staff were very helpful, we bought bus tickets from them which made it very easy. Also the really nice thing about this hotel is that if you walk down the street just about a block there is a little market.and you can buy water at the normal price locals pay - less than 1 euro for a giant bottle. The market was closed on Sunday and we bought water near the Colloseum and it cost us 2 euros for a small bottle! Also remember most Europeans like thier water with carbonate so if you don't ask for "still" or "no gas"! All in all this was a good hotel choice, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Son123
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal gets a big thumbs up. We enjoyed our stay there immensely. The service, decor, and food were all impeccable. The location is convenient. I especially loved the bacons every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Bostonians
Reviews.Content: WE found the hotel easily enough having got a bus from the airport, and being dropped off at the train station, it was a maximum of 10 minutes walk. We where well recieved by the receptionist, who was pleasent and helpful, willing to suggest local eating places. The room was nice and clean, not the biggest, but then again for what we paid I didnt expect that the room would be as good as it was, and its fair to say the hotel offered good value for money. Breakfast was fresh with plenty of choice, and a good view over northern rome. We walked most places, but got the underground to goto the vatican, so the choice is yours. If you want a decent hotel with value for money, then this is ideal

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: Thompsons-Abroad
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible job finding a hotel at short notice at a reasonable price. Having read the reviews here we thought the Marcella was well worth a go. In a city that seems to pride itself in ripping off tourists, the Marcella is a haven of peace. Well, it would have been completely apart from two 'swinging' couples who were partying down in the room next door for three nights. We're glad our German wasn't too good .. some things just shouldn't be translated. I'm afraid it was down to the single dividing door in our room - it just didn't cut out any noise at all. OK, I'm sure we could have been moved and there's no way you can blame the hotel for the behavior of all its guests. Just a pity. That said - it's a great little hotel. Loved the bacon and scrambled eggs for breakfast, loved the roof restaurant. Good staff on the front desk, with recommendations that don't line their pockets. An easy walk from the main railway station - we never bothered with public transport except for the journey out to the Vatican. Having seen the budget hotels around the main railway station - if you're thinking you'll be saving £20 a night ... don't do it. Marcella Royal it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marcella”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacays
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location. The King bed was very comfortable. The hotel serves breakfast in the morning which is nice. I would recommend having breakfast inside of the cafe; otherwise, the pigeons will eat alongside with you on the same dish. The Concierge was extremely helpful. We took a nap and were starving by the time we woke up. He referred us to a restaurant nearby the hotel (about 2 blocks away) and had absolutely wonderful food. The only drawback of the hotel for us was the clogged drain which if we had addressed it, I'm sure it would've been resolved. We would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanBuck
