Reviews.Content: The staff are super friendly and helpful and the hotel is very comfortable. Our room was spacious and clean and the service was excellent throughout the stay. Reception has loads of restaurant and transport info and they are very willing to make calls for you. It's five minutes from the station and a ten minute walk into the centre, which can be a bit of a pain if you've spent the day on foot. But the welcome back is worth it and the hotel is on a quiet street. The Marcella Royal is an ideal base for Rome and we will definitely return. Danny & family, London

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowen Island
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in September and want to report that they are 100% deserving of praise in every area. Our room was charming and quiet and exceptionately clean. The bathroom was modern and well appointed. The hearty breakfast served on the roof top garden was a wonderful way to start a day of busy sightseeing in Rome. In the late evening, we often ate a light meal up there with live music and a fabulous view over the city. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We would most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amore”
Reviews.Author: jpcheer25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marcella Royal for our honeymoon (August 7-14). We were somewhat weary booking online as we had never been to Europe, and had heard stories of hotels "not having your reservation". We did not have ANY issues or complaints. The staff was incredible, the room was amazing, the view was beautiful, and the location was very desirable. The Marcella is wonderful because you are afforded the opportunity to stay on a quiet street, without scarificing proximity to the sights. We requested a good view, explaining that it was our honeymoon; I think we got the best one in the hotel! On our first night, the Marcella brought us a bottle of the best champagne we have ever had. The Marcella, and Via Flavia represented all of my fantasies about Rome and what I had envisioned my entire life. In terms of breakfast, it was pretty good! The sugar covered donuts with chocolate truffle filling are amazing...you'll gain 10 lbs. : ) We had some amazing pictures of the hotel and Via Flavia to post, but NWA lost our luggage in which they forced us to put our digital camera, which got stolen...Though that was a true disaster the Marcella Royal was a dream come true. We can't wait to go back!!! Jen and Chad WIlson, Carlsbad CA

Reviews.Title: “Just Remember Your Voucher”
Reviews.Author: NickC66
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Marcella Royal. The hotel was friendly - service excellent and couldn't be faulted ... apart from a check in delay. Having booked on line and paid "upfront", I had a PC failure several months later. I had printed the booking but not confirmation voucher (to say we had paid) and this completely threw the receptionist who initially insisted we needed a voucher ... once the confusion was resolved (admittedly only 5 minutes worth but off putting all the same after an early morning flight) we got checked in. Not the best of starts but once resolved, no one could have been more accomodating ... the bellboy and bar staff in particular. Started the afternoon with a "Bernini Walk" (thanks DK) ... Lgo. S Susanne, Pza Barberini, Quirinale, Trevi, Pantheon and Pza Navona with a a stop for dinner near the Pantheon. A good easy afternoon/evening stroll. About 5/10 mins from Republica it's a steady walk to the Metro for Vatican / Popolo one way and Colosseum the other so easy to get around using public transport if not keen on taking the bus. Admittedly it is quiet in and around the hotel - ideal for couples wanting a city break close enough to access the city but not in the hustle and bustle. The 7th floor terrace bar (where light meals are served) is a wonderful location on a warm late summer evening ... helped by the friendly manner of the bar staff ... a few free Italian lessons were thrown in as well! We had a lovely time at Marcella Royal and would recommend the hotel (and citry). Personally I would have added another night to cover a little more (tackling Vatican Museums, St Peters and Castel St Angelo in one day is virtually impossible given the queues whilst a good full day is needed in Colosseum, Palatine and Forum). As an aside, the Roman Holiday tour of the Colosseum & Palatine were great - enthusiastic and fun tour leaders! Thanks for a great break Roma, arrivederci. PS If you you have little command of Italian, don't worry, pratically everywhere we went was transalated into English. PPS Everyone says it, watch out for the traffic (particularly scooters) ... zebra crossings, red lights, green pedestrian crossings don't mean thing. Just put your head down and go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Marcella would love it!”
Reviews.Author: LuBelle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Marcella Royal in Rome and found it to be very tourist friendly, especially arriving after a 10.5 hour flight! They are very accomodating and the staff speaks perfect English. This hotel has comfortable clean rooms and bath, but the highlight is the roof top restaurant and bar. Breakfast was served there every morning as we enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the city. But the best is in the evening under the stars with soft candlelight and music. It's the perfect place to have a bottle of wine after a busy day touring. The desk staff not only helped us with train tickets, and driver; but also provided us with a Europeon calling card that made calling home to the U.S. very easy from everywhere we stayed in Italy. I would not hesitate to stay there again on my next visit to Rome, and I highly recommend that you do, too!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debsbmw
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel. The staff was very heldful. The location was not as good as I would have liked. It was not as close to the Spanish steps, as advertised. The breakfast was very good and the restraunt was a rooftop. It was nice. Not much real close to the hotel as far as restaurants. Had to take cabs a lot of places. Of course, Rome is big and probably would have had to get transportaion anyplace you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Raych
Reviews.Content: We have had a fantastic 4 days (3 nights) in Rome, staying at the Marcella Royal Hotel. The hotel is roughly 10-15mins walk from the Termini, and after a few wrong turns (possibly down to map-reading skills?) we found our way there. Maybe next time we would get a taxi there. The hotel is accurately represented on its website, and first impressions certainly didn't disappoint. Our room wasn't quite ready for us (and I'm not quite sure it was really a SUPERIOR triple room, though the size was fine for the three of us), but by bedtime the covers were turned down, with a fruit sweet left on the pillow. The bathroom was a great size, with shower over the bath. Everything was SPOTLESSLY clean. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful way to finish an evening. The food is very basic, but ok. We certainly appreciated being able to eat at the hotel after a long day of sight-seeing. Staff are efficient and friendly. They booked a sight-seeing tour for us, giving us advice about it, and organised a car to the airport for us too. Their local knowledge was much appreciated. This hotel was perfect for us. It is on a quiet street, and a short way out of Rome's centre. We were happy to walk everywhere from the hotel, but many tours will pick up from there without extra charge. I hope to return to Rome - 3 days isn't long enough! And when I do, I hope to stay again at Marcella Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: wishiwas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marcella for 4 nights in August 2006. Very nice room - we had a triple and I felt there was adequate space. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful and the room was well maintained - beds turned down each night, sweets on the pillows etc - nice touches. Breakfast was good but limited. The roof garden/ piano bar was one of the main reasons I booked this hotel - it had a great view of Rome and it was nice to either relax over breakfast or have an evening drink up there. You can walk to most of the main sights quite easily in about 20 minutes, although the Vatican (on far side of town) is quite a step. Buses are plentiful and cheap (tickets from hotel) with bus stop just around the corner. On a couple of days we walked down and taxied back (about 7 euros). This hotel is not central but I feel that this works in its favour. Set on a quiet side street full of local shops and a couple of good local restaurants, it is lovely to escape the busy city centre after a days sightseeing. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: silesia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the marcella for four nights in August and couldn't have asked for a more enjoyable stay. The service at the front desk was top class especially Pietro, very helpful and entertaining. The open roof garden is a marvellous way to end the day with a breath taking view of Rome. No shortage of excellent restaurants nearby which the front desk can also assist with. Would highly recommend this friendly and warm hotel and most definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “What more could we want?”
Reviews.Author: Allycat7240
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked this hotel after reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor. I e-mailed the hotel with our requirements and special requests and recieved confirmation back within the hour. On arrival we found the room to be perfectly adequate and the staff both freindly and helpful - Maria on reception actualy used to live in London so her English is perfect if like me you have very limited Italian. We asked for a room downstairs as I don't like lifts and there seemed no problem in arranging this. The room was large, air conditioned and cleaned every day which included fresh towels in the bathroom. Although not brilliant the breakfast was adequate (typically continental) and the serving times of between 7.00 and 10.00 a.m. gave the option of pressing the snooze button when required. Its location 300m from the main Termini station proved invaluable for travelling to all the sites around Rome although we actually walked to the coluseum in approx.15-20 mins. The acid test has got to be would we stay here again - the answer to that has got to be "we can't wait."

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for everything”
Reviews.Author: AmLitTeacher
Reviews.Content: For three nights this past June, my husband and I and dear friends spent three nights at this awesome hotel!! We loved spending the evening on the rooftop garden where we had a great view of the Rome skyline. It only took about 15 minutes of walking to get to the Pantheon, Spanish sSteps, or Trevi. The hotel was immaculate, the front desk help incredibly helpful with everything...directions, reservations, stopped up shower!!! You name it, it was taken care of immediately with a smile. The breakfast buffet is incredible and again with a beautiful view of the city. We liked it because it was convenient but not on a bustling city street. It is also very close to Termni station. There were also several excellent restaurant choices nearby. This will most definitely be the place we stay when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: zeetoons
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marcella for four nights in July 2006. Assistant manager Allesandro Cuzziol really made our stay special! When we asked him how to get to sites we wanted to visit he spent a lot of time mapping out our routes. And he did it in a very f riendly manner with great humor. He had us laughing so hard! He was very professional and several times when we needed to confirm activities he helped us quickly and efficiently. He always greeted us in a welcoming manner when we left and returned to the hotel. When Allesandro was off Michale was a great help. He confirmed a schedule for us quickly when we brought it up and was very friendly and welcoming. He recommended a great little local restaurant (La Lampada) that served very good, reasonably priced Italian dishes. A lamp in our room that needed repair was taken care of immediately. The small in-room safe was not functioning correctly and that also was righted quickly. The first three nights we stayed in a very nice, comfortable room. Family members were in the next room and there was a convenient door linking the two rooms The rooftop cafe served a nice breakfast and offered light meal choices in the evening. The view from the rooftop was a real plus. When we returned to the Marcella for our final night in Italy our room was smaller but still comfortable. It had been smoked in so we kept the window open for the fresh air. Because of the way we were treated and helped and for the quality of the rooms we would gladly return to the Marcella Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! We visited the Marcella Royal Hotel June 22-25 during a heat wave for Rome. The staff was very accomodating, especially Michele at the front deck. We had an issue with two of our rooms which was quickly remedied with room upgrades. Our family throughly enjoyed the rooftop garden/bar to watch the World Cup and to relax after a long day sightseeing. We definitely would stay at the Marcella again when visiting in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The charm and location of The Marcella Royal is only exceeded by the hellpful and very friendly service. Micheal at the front desk really made our Rome experience remarkable. He was particularly good about suggesting wonderful restuarants that matched our needs.....just great. He also took the stress out of our rental car confirmation.....would highly recommend this hotel to anyone...rooms are first class. quite and the property itself is warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Family of three stayed 29/5/06 to 2/6/06. While the hotel offers nice rooms sleeping for us was non existing as the noise from the street below and surrounding areas was unbearable and as a last resort had to wear ear plugs to sleep. The local area needs to be cleaned up as it was lined with industrial garbage bins everywhere and the resturaunt next door has a man that stares at evryone as they walk past with his cigarette hanging from his mouth. The Hotel does not have a dining room and offers a light meal that is microwaved italian meals which we thought was poor for a hotel of this standand and the front office lacks local knowledge a s when we asked where the nearest post office was they could only advise about 3/4 streets away.The hotel was not as convenient as we thought as you have to walk 10/15 minutes to the nearest train station.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel ,Via Flavia 106, Rome I have been to Rome on several occassions mostly for sporting events like Football and Rugby and stayed in various hotels which did not live up to the publicity. The Marcella Royal exceeded all my expectations from the excellent super friendly staff to the roof terrace at breakfast which has a panoramic 360 Deg.view of Rome.The same terrace in the evening serves an excellent dinner menu under the stars, something not to be missed. My partner and I very pleased with the quality of the bedrooms and on suite facilities. Altogether a very nice hotel in a quiet street filled with affordable good quality restaurants in the area including my favourite Giovanni's. It was a bit of a wrench leaving the hotel and I will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Marcella is great”
Reviews.Author: smith5
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal is an old style hotel near the Via Veneto. a quiet street with nice restaurants. The hotel offers a terrific roof top breakfast,clean spacious rooms but most of all a staff that will go out of their way to make your stay a memorable one. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary with our children and both Michele and Allessandro could not have done more to make us feel special. We had just left Florence where the front desk personnel never even said good morning. This was so refreshing and made us feel right at home. Thanks Michele for all you did and we will definitely recommend the Marcella Royal to others!

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Limekiln
Reviews.Content: For €220 a night - defo not worth the money - 4* - I dont think !!!!!! stayed for 4 nights for a relatives wedding & have to say we were very disappointed - staff are freidly & the roof top terrace is nice - breakfast below standard - 4* hotel that serves fruit salad from a tin - not good !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Marcella Royal and we were not disappointed. As it was our first time in Rome we wanted to stay somewhere fairly central to most of the attractions and only got the Metro once the whole time we were there! They have a lovely roof top restaurant where you can see the dome of St Peters over breakfast and the rooms are immaculate. From the moment we checked in the staff couldn't do enough for us and even arranged for a bottle of bubbly to be delivered to our room when they realised it was my birthday! We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What pleasant, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: windycitygal
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely week stay at the Marcello Royal Hotel. The rooms were pleasant, clean and quiet. The bathrooms were clean and large compared to past European experiences I've had. The staff was lovely and helpful, particularly Michele. The location of the hotel made walking to most all major sites easy and quite enjoyable. For the price and location, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMCKNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Easter Monday and were always treated well. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The bedroom was elegant with chandalier and fabric walls instead of wall paper. We were on the 4th floor and there was a great view of Rome from their restaurant. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Rome. It is within easy access of the city centre, with buses constatly passing nearby. Also it is excellently located near the Terminal station to give access to the whole of Rome and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SarahSBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stay at Marcella Royal 5 days April 2006. Surprise trip for my mother's 75th birthday. Staff were excellent, very helpful ande co-operative. Arranged trips, booked taxis, restaurants etc. Room was absolutely delightful - junior suite. Cleanliness was excellent. Buffet breakfast was good. All in all, wonderful experience. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “the staff was awesome”
Reviews.Author: plasticbike
Reviews.Content: Considering past reviews, I went to Rome with mixed expectations of the Marcella. I was amazed at how helpfull and friendly the staff was, and at the number of languages that each front desk clerk was able to speak clearly! The rooms were larger than most I have stayed in in Europe and the showers were a nice change from the others that I had used in recent days elsewhere. Larger and cleaner. The hotel is in a less travelled location (tourist-wise) which worked out to be a huge plus! I read that it was too far from the sights, but Rome is SO SMALL, we walked slowly from the Pantheon to the Hotel in 35 min! There is also a bus line a few blocks away to take you directly to the tourist meccas, so we were never more than 10 min away from sightseeing. Nice restaurants nearby and some great cafés make this a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: stroppysiggy
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Marcella are great. The terrace breakfast room and bar is lovely although the dinner menu is basic. They don't however pretend otherwise and were able to point us in the direction of fantastic real italian restaurants nearby. We did not find the area scary at all and were happy to walk around the interesting side streets. The Hotel itself is very clean, friendly and quiet enough not to hear traffic all night but close enough either on foot or using public transport to get to all the typical tourist sights and more! The room was a good size and perfectly well appointed albeit not with any particular wow factor. Maybe you shouldn't expect this for the very reasonable price! All in all very good and to be recommended. We'll take my Parents there next year, they'll love the friendly unpretentious Staff.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant week”
Reviews.Author: djwVeraAlmeriaSpain
Reviews.Content: first class hotel,from introduction at reception right through to restaurant and bar on top floor everyone was very friendly and helpful.rooms were very comfortable and kept exceptionally clean,hotel was spotless,restaurant provided a good selection at breakfast(including cooked if required).bar area and evening staff were especially good.wonderful roof garden for breakfast,evening meal or just to have drinks relax and look out over the top of rome.the only reasons why it did not qite rate as 5 (excellent)was the lack of any view from the bedroom window,and the hotel is not as near the centre as it implies.my wife and i spent 8 happy days there and would certainly return and would encourage others to visit too.

Reviews.Title: “more 3* than 4*”
Reviews.Author: PH&LH
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was nice and the staff very friendly I think it is overpriced. Its more like a top 3* hotel with its facilities than a 4*. Small bathroom with a bath that u could only sit in and not lay down in, plastic cups in bathroom not glass. My wife and I stayed there in March 2006 and as it was our anniversary we asked for a good room and got one with a view over the city towards the Vatican and a complementary bottle champagne in an ice bucket. The breakfast room on the top floor has great views over the city and outside patio area with tables for the summer. The breakfast was a self service buffet with fresh bread and pastries and the usual cheese meat cereals and fruit juice. They also had limited scramble eggs and bacon. The hotel is situated in the business sector north of the city. Like all big cities Rome has a traffic problem with too many cars which is aggravated by the small side streets which constantly have cars parked everywhere. I was surprised at the amount of graffiti and the dusty dirty streets which we saw no evidence of the authorities trying to clear up. You go to Rome for the sites of course which are fantastic with the Trevi Fountain, Vatican, Colosseum, Pantheon and the Basilica of St Paul’s being our favourites . Stunning architecture, mosaics and sheer size of the construction will take your breath away. it’s a shame some of the classic monuments suffer the lack of attention as the streets in the city do by way of litter and rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Marcella. The hotel is lovely, no complaint in regards to the staff, whom at all times were extremely helpful. As already said the hotel is not in the centre on average it took app 20mins to walk to the Trevi, be warned the walk back is up hill, but it burns off the dinner! Our rooms were Kitsch , only complaint was the bathroom tiling could do with modernising, it was the only thing that lets this hotel down. Best part having our breakfast on the roof terrace with the sun shining and a beautiful view. In our opinions a good choice for your stay in Rome. Resturant wise too many to recommend, but 'Thats Amore' near the Trevi is good. One thing not mentioned was we visited the Vatican, which is well worth a visit, but if you want the tour headphones make sure you have ID, without it you can't get them.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mruther547
Reviews.Content: My father and I recently stayed at the Marcella Royal, and we both loved it. The rooms were decorated simply but elegantly, and the breakfast buffet was perfect for a morning's start before a full day of sightseeing. It even had delicious scrambled eggs and bacon for those of us with American palates. Vastly contributing to our stay was the excellent staff. Michele, in particular, was very friendly and knowledgeable. His restaurant recommendations were superb, and he could not have been more gracious or helpful. We highly recommend the Marcella Royal. And as for the poster who complains that the Marcella is not in the very center, this is true, but cabs are fairly inexpensive, and we didn't find the location to be much of an impediment. In fact, Via Flavia itself was a wonderful nook with its own ambience and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Too Much Trouble”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Rome staying at Hotel Marcella Royal. It had got excellent Reviews on reading them before we went and we must agree the Hotel and staff were excellent. Nothing was too much trouble and you only had to ask in reception for where to eat or what buses to catch and they were more than obliging. The hotel room was very clean and well maintained each day, the only dissapointment was no tea or coffee making facilities, also the room was smaller than we have been used to in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wellingore-Wanderer
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in the Marcella regularly over 8 years ago and remembered it as a well run hotel with friendly staff. Nothing has changed, the staff, some of whome havn't changed, are excellent as is the standard of the rooms. The hotel has been significantly modernised and the view from the roof terrace/bar is as stunning as ever. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella Royal on March 3rd - 6th for 3 nights, and found it absoluetly great! Reception staff were extremely helpful and polite - couldn't ask for friendlier people! The rooms, despite being traditional, were thoroughly clean and extremely comfortable. The entrance to the hotel is also very welcoming. Breakfast was good, with a wide range of cereals, savouries and hot food, as well as equally friendly staff. A lovely view welcomed you on the 7th floor roof terrace, stretching across the sites of Rome. The only (minor) critcism, was the actual breakfast room - although nice, it was rather small and in need of a little modernising and redecorating. There was also no bar area to relax in during both day and night times however it didn't bother us in the slightest as evenings and daytimes were spent either sightseeing or eating in several brilliant restaurants in Rome centre. Marcella Royal is conveniently situated near to numerous sites such as Spanish Steps and villa Borghese, although was not central with the action packed centre and streets of Rome - but only the expensive 5* Grand hotels were!!! Overall, i would recommend Marcella Royal 100%, as likewise to us, i am sure you will have a fabulous break in wonderful hotel accommodation in the beautiful city of Rome!!! The Marcella Royal, in our opinion, lives up to its rating of quality and would believe it is approprate to be a 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Even the rain couldn't spoil it!”
Reviews.Author: Toffeecat
Reviews.Content: Four of us visited for a short break Sat to Tuesday. It was my friends 50th birthday. Sun & Mon were mild with cloud & sunshine but it did rain like mad on the Tuesday!!However,we had a lovely time saw the sights and had two great meals out in the evening as recommended by 'Michael'one of the hotel receptionists.He booked our taxi & arranged a couple of special surprises for the birthday girl. The staff at the Marcella are extremely friendly, helpful and cheerful- they made our stay memorable.The hotel is small & well cared for with a well presented and extensive breakfast choice. It was lovely sitting outside in the sun for breakfast on our fist morning, even in February! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys welcoming and friendly hospitality. If you like sycophantic fawning this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the Christmas holidays. It it small, as are many Italian hotels. However, it is well appointed and very comfortable. The front desk staff is friendly. They speak English and several other languages. Michelle was particularly helpful. He gave us lots of suggestions about places to go and things to do. The hotel has a lovely breakfast buffet and evening piano lounge on the roof/ top floor. We visited during winter so the roof garden was a little chilly, but it was still beautiful. It was the perfect place to unwind after a long day of walking through the streets of Rome. The hotel does not have a dedicated restaurant. You can get a good breakfast and light dinner there. However, if you are looking for good Italian meals you will have to visit some of the local restaurants. The good news is that there are plenty of restaurants and the front dest staff will make suggestions and reservations when necessary. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute joy to stay in”
Reviews.Author: cambriajoan
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I had been to Rome a few times so we didn't want to do all the touristy stuff. we loved staying in more of a residential area. The staff was wonderful. Their restaraunt recommendations were amazing. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK”
Reviews.Author: Joeleeo1227
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Marcella Royale in August and did not have the same positive experiences as many of the other reviewers. The staff was acceptable, but certainly not meriting the glowing reviews we have seen. They were moderately helpful, but nothing great. They gave us a terrible restaurant reservation in Trestevere and we were especially disappointed when we saw the other charming options. The bartender at the bar was a greater resource. The rooms are also acceptable-clean and not too cramped, but the bathroom was very cheap feeling. The location is mediocre at best. While it is close to the train station it is a LONG walk to almost any place else you want to visit. My wife and I like walking, but the walks from this hotel nearly did us in. The neighborhood around the hotel is not particularly inviting. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop bar. It is a great place for a cocktail in the evening and a wonderful place to enjoy breakfast and begin the day. We did like the free internet service in the hotel-very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marcella Royale from Feb. 2 - Feb. 7. I was traveling with my mother and we had the best experience. The entire staff was so wonderful and made us feel so welcome (even upon our arrival when my mother was suffering from air sickness)After dinner that evening we were surprised when a bottle of champagne was sent up to our room for my mothers birthday. On the roof top bar the piano player sang happy birthday to her. Pietro and Michele at reception were wonderful, and Salvatore at the rooftop bar was the best. I loved Rome enough, but the people at this hotel made it even better. The rooms were lovely, clean, and the beds were suprisingly very comfortable. I felt that we were unintentionally high maintenance guests, but the staff never let us know if they were getting tired of our requests. I will definetly come back to Rome and this is the place where I will stay. Brava to all the staff at the Marcella. We will miss you!! Ciao, Amber & Mary

Reviews.Title: “Book this now, great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: CuCulann
Reviews.Content: I've recommended this place to lots of family and friends because it's the best hotel I've stayed in that I could afford. Clean, cosy, friendly with a good breakfast that'll keep you going well into the day, what more does anyone need. If you go to Rome stay here. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: hml006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11th january 06 to 14th January 06.there were 6 of us - 2adults & 4 children and we thought it was great. The rooms were perfect they gave us a double and a quad/family romm which was very spacious. We were in close walking distance to the Via Veneto & from there you could reach anywhere. Yes we did a lot of walking but what a great way to see Rome.We even walked to the Vatican and then came back via the Pantheon & strolled through all the streets & it was no problem for our children. The staff were very friendly & helpful and always very welcoming. we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two old friends in a triple superior room, which we booked via the internet with a great special rate. Right from the start everyone was so helpful (typical of all Romans we encountered). Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean with fresh sheets every morning. Breakfast was copious and choice extensive. The rooftop bar was a favourite before and after dining at the excellent local restaurants - recommomended by the staff and we especially enjoyed singing along to the Pianomans Les Dawsonesque renditions of Beatles favourites! I would definately recommmend this Hotel for its friendliness, cleanliness, position and total lack of pretention. My kind of Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for a Holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Haberdasher
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a delightful short break in Rome, staying at the Marcella Royal. Excellent hotel, very pleasant and helpful staff and the highest standard of cleanliness I have come across in a long time! Thanks very much and well done to everyone at Marcella Royal, the Wise family

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice”
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Marcello for 4 nights booking it on recommendation from Trip Advisor comments, and we were not dissapointed, hotel is abot 1.5 km from Termini, Bus,train and metro station Hotel is comfortable, clean, stylish, our room 626 was a reasonable size. The staff are great, ask reception for tourist information, they are really knowledgeable and helpful Get day/3 day passes to travel round on, 4 euro per day each, then you can use buses, metro and trams, really easy and so many buses pass near hotel. reception staff will tell you which ones and ask them to indicate what buses go to the main attractions We had a room on sixth floor and had some views over rooftops, lower floors will have no view, but roof terrace was a great bonus even in winter. Breakfast adequate without being lavish, plenty of restuarants around to eat at in the evenings, again ask reception for best ones. Henry Cow, wine bar 30 yards to right, on opposite side was ok for casual dining

Reviews.Title: “Clean and perfect ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and perfect. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room was really clean and comfortable. We will definately stay there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I decided to have a girly trip to Rome. We arrived on a very wet Wednesday in January to the Marcella Royal to a very warm welcome from the hotel staff. From the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice of hotel. Our room, which comfortably slept three was delightful with a samll balcony over-looking the street. The ensuite bathroom was also a good size. The hotel was well heated, being January this was important, and also very clean. Our room was also serviced every day. The roof-top restaurant was excellent, offering a superb breakfast of juices,coffee,teas,cereal,toast, scrambled eggs and bacon. There were also a selection of fruits, cheeses, hams and pastries. On top of that the view looking west over the city to St Peter's Basillica was wonderful. Although our first day was wet the remainder of our trip was sunshine and blue skies and about 14 degrees. On 2 evenings we ate in the rooftop restaurant, which although it didn't offer a large menu, was very good and excellent value for money. The hotel itself is situated in the north east of the city, near the British, American and Japanese Embassays. One can take a bus, less than 3 mins walk to the cities attractions. For the more energetic, the Spanish Steps are only 1 mile away which would take approx 15 mins to walk through a very nice area. There are several good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel which are good value for money. I would recommend the Lampada restaurant which had a high number of Italian diners, always a good sign. I cannot sing the praises of the hotel staff enough. They were all extremely helpful and very courteous. Overall a wonderful place to stay and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: md1ctc
Reviews.Content: We spent a week over New Year 2005/06 at this lovely little hotel and can't fault it. The decor was really lovely, the staff were friendly and helpful and it was really and clean and comfortable. It is about a 15 minute walk from the Spanish steps, which was a little bit further that we thought it would be, but Via Flavia has quite a few nice little restaurants to eat in in the evening if you don't want to venture too far after a tiring days sightseeing. It was lovely to watch all the fireworks from the roof terrace on New Year's Eve. I would certainly recommend it as a base for visiting Rome. It was just a pity the weather we had for 3 out of the 7 days we spent there hadn't been kinder to us, but that was just one of those things. We will have to return in Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not great location”
Reviews.Author: jen611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our honeymoon in Italy, and in Rome stayed at the Marcella Royale. The hotel is located in the middle of a block on a side street. It has an absolutely beautiful interior, courteous and friendly staff, and serves a great breakfast (called the “American breakfast” with hot food like eggs, pastries, toast, yogurt, meats/cheese & fresh fruit). The breakfast was served on the top floor balcony, which provided a beautiful view of much of the city (at 7 floors, this hotel was one of the tallest buildings in the area). This room also turns into a wine bar with a small menu at night. The only downside was the location—kind of on the outskirts of the city, a far walk to any major sights or nightlife. If you are looking for a quiet, luxurious hotel, and don't need to be where the action is, then it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: marknyy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel by accident when we decided to stay a second night in Rome. The first hotel we stayed at did not have a room for the second night and we found this a little farther down the street. All I can say is WOW! The staff was extremely courtious and the hotel was beautiful. The view from the roof top bar was spectacular. It was so relaxing sitting up there at night looking out over the city. We will definately stay there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: Catlover9
Reviews.Content: I booked the Marcella Royal mainly because of the reviews on TripAdvisor--and they weren't wrong. This hotel is clean and comfortable with a marvelous staff. We were an odd family, with a senior, disabled member (me) and a teen (13). This hotel was ideal for both of us. We had a triple, and it was roomy and spotlessly clean. The staff was unfailingly gracious and helpful. The rooftop breakfast buffet had anything one could want. We were there on New Year's Eve and were able to enjoy Rome's fireworks while dining on the rooftop, and the staff did a marvelous job of both offering champagne and serving it at midnight. I cannot walk far, and we found great restaurants nearby, so the location was perfect for us. This is an ideal place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Lives Up to Press!!”
Reviews.Author: bkbelle
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before staying here & found that they were uniformly glowing, and so I took it all with a grain of salt. However, what a pleasant surprise to find that it was all TRUE!! From the elegant lobby to my coziily luxe, sexily red, red room, to the wonderfully kind staff... not to mention that fabulous rooftop and sumptuous breakfast buffet!! This is truly a gem. I had a super visit and would go again. Also wanted to mention that I am a black woman and was travelling alone, and felt extremely comfortable and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reception: Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: kb241152
Reviews.Content: My choice of this hotel was based on the favourable reviews on Tripadvisor; it was a very good choice. I stayed in this hotel with my family at the beginning of October 2005 and was extremely impressed. At first sight, the rooms could perhaps be described as a little quirky when it came to decor, but this was a minor aside as the staff were the most helpful of any of the many many I've stayed in throughout the world. A smiling face was guaranteed at reception and they advised us of some very good restaurants in terms of ambience, price and quality of food. Would recommend it to anyone, the reception / concierge staff were wonderful, I cannot praise them enough.

Reviews.Title: “simply superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned on Fri 9/12/05 after spending 5 nights here celebrating our siver wedding anniversary. We can not rate the hotel highly enough, after reading most other visitor's reviews we must agree this hotel earns every one of its 4 stars. The staff are very friendly and most helpfull in every way and the hotel is quite luxurious. The one and only slight drawback is its claim to be close to The Spanish Steps, it took us around 20 minutes and we are'nt slow walkers. This apart I would still recommend this classy hotel to anyone visiting Rome and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hidden treasure, the marcella royal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hidden in the central rome area, near the embassies, and the via veneto, is a lovely well managed hotel. the rooms are lovely, it has so much charm. exceptionally clean and the management of the hotel is superb. staff is friendly, the breakfast and the roof top bar are are lovely. a lovely boutique hotel....the difference is the staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “What a birthday treat!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jan241142
Reviews.Content: As a surprise birthday treat, my husband booked a City break to Rome where we stayed at the Marcella Royal Hotel. The hotel itself was a real treat. Our room had very pale powder blue walls with beautiful mirror details. We were pleased to find that the bathroom had a shower cubicle. Our chambermaid couldn't have been more helpful and the room was always spotless. The hotel has a 7th floor piano bar that doubled as the breakfast buffet of a morning and what a buffet!! You would have to be extremely fussy not to find something to your liking there. The hotel is well situated for touring Rome - not in the centre but within walking distance of all the main sites. The receptionists were extremely helpful. I will certainly remember this holiday for a long time to come - and have wonderful photos to prove it. Jan & George Siewertsen

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome, had a great time. This hotel is excellent. We stayed in Room 542 which was so comfortable with plenty of space. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast in the roof top restaurant was very good. We found hotel just perfect for touring Rome on Foot! Salvidore who works evenings in the piano bar was very professional and helpful. Would love to stay again... Well done to all the staff. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves five stars.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is Bravo, Bravo to all the staff at the Marcella. We spent nine nights and eight days here and it was the best. From morning to night the service was excellent, breakfasts were wonderful and the location is good for restaurants and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Marcella Royal is a special find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay one night, but it was a highlight of a fabulous two-week trip through Greece and Italy. The staff was most accomodating; we arrived early in the day, but we were allowed to check in long before the "official" check-in time. The room's walls were coverd entirely in beautiful fabric. The bed linens were truly exquisite. The entire property was spotless - housekeeping staff everwhere, working hard. The hotel is in a great location. Close to points of interest, but just far enough off the noisiest roads. This is a jewel of a hotel (not too large!). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Macros
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely hotel! We booked this after reading comments from Trip Advisor. The staff were terrific, and very knowledgable about good tourist spots and places to eat. We upgraded our room to superior and it was amazing - jacuzzi bath and gorgeous big bedroom. Candlelit dinner with music accompaniment on the rooftop, overlooking the city, was also fantastic. Overall highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet all our pictures!”
Reviews.Author: DeweyNewYorkNYUSA
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based in part by the reviews found on the TripAdvisor website and booked it through the tour department of the airline we flew from the USA to Rome on. The cost per night was USD298.00 based on two people sharing. We realize that lower prices are available throuh various websites but my company was paying for the land portion so they handled that end of it. We were given a room with a balcony and a charming view of surrounding roof tops, however the size of room 534 was quite small and contained only one rather uncomfortable desk chair. Previous reviews about the attentive service(Pietro was a delightful gentleman), cleanliness, and lovely rooftop breakfast room and terrace are all absolutely true. However for the daily rate of USD298.00 it fell short of our expectations...we expected something more. Living in New York City we are used to walking but felt the hotel really was not very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PJSLeicestershire_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked this purely on its place on this web site. A good choice - thanks to all of you who wrote in good reviews. Agree with everything already said about rooftop terrace/dining room - the views are magnificent. Our room was excellent (triple on 5th floor) with the double and single beds in separate rooms. Staff very helpful, although those who said it's a fair walk to the major attractions were right. Even so, we managed to be on our feet all day for 4 days in a row. Would certainly recommend, and stay there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Marcella Royal-Well priced, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Indielynx
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of tripadvisor reviews and was not misled. We had a twin room with plenty of room for 2 friends to share. The room was over the main entrance, a bit noisy at times, but was always clean and had all the services we needed. The rooftop terrace was a great place to sit and have breakfast, which was plentiful. Staff were always polite and helpful and we had a good dinner at a nearby recommended restaurant. On the downside the hotel is a little out of the centre. I was happy to make the pleasant walk but my travelling companion found it a little too far so we used the very reasonably priced taxis. Rome is wonderful and this is an excellent hotel to use as your base.

Reviews.Title: “What a washout”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews made me think I was looking at the wrong hotel - if floral carpets, elderly curtains, and tired 1970s bathroom suites are your idea of 'tastefully decorated' then fine. Otherwise this shabby third tier lodging house is better avoided - breakfast was unpleasant - tinned fruit, doughy croissants, stewed coffee, in a narrow dining room. Our room was on the top floor, unfortunately it rained for 2 days which led to water leaking through from the roof terrace and soaking both beds and the carpet. We packed up our bags (at 1am!) and were moved to another room, sadly the shower didn't work. When we complained on checkout we were told we were lucky to have been 'upgraded' to a 'superior' room for no extra charge, but that we could book a superior room for the price of a standard on our next visit....I don't think so. Stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: gsbdiver
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about this hotel. It's in a good location near the train station. The rooms, while small, are comfortable and the price is fair. The roof bar and restaurant are real draws, with good views of the whole city (including Saint Peter's dome) and the surrounding hills. While there is not a lot of activity near the hotel, the street has several good places on it. Sadly, they did not recommend the better places to us, which brings me to the first of several problems. When a hotel recommends something to me, I expect something more than just the place that gives the hotel a kickback....I want something objective. They recommended a place called Taverna Flavia, which was a real disappointment (second worst dining experience of a 16 day trip). This restaurant (you'll know it by all the moviestar photos on the wall) was expensive, poor service, poor wine and really mediocre food. A very bad experience, despite (as other reviewers have pointed out) other good places nearby. Why they recommend such a poor quality place begs speculation about objectivity and means that you won't want to trust their recommendations. The second problem that we had was that we got there is generally cool weather, but one day it was warm and humid. We couldn't get the air conditioning to work (it was promised to us at booking) and when we called the front desk, we were informed that they only run it during parts of the year. If you get an A/C day when they don't want to run it, then your stuck, despite the aminity being listed as available at the time of booking. Bottom line, you might want to consider them as being A/C-less. Problem #3: We had an 8AM flight, we absolutely needed to be up by 5:45 to get it (ya, that's cutting it close, but ...), so we got a wake up call .... but they never made it. Fortunately, the blackberry backup worked but, failing to make a wake up call can lead to serious problems for the guests. If you can live with these problems, then it's more of a 4 level place. We were satisfied, just not delighted.

Reviews.Title: “An All-Around Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not knowing what to expect in arriving in Rome, I was more than pleasantly suprised at this hotel and its' staff!! It is located on a lovely street in Rome, the street itself lined with fine restaruarants. Upon entering the hotel, I was immediately greeted by staff that turned out to be one of the most helpful and friendly I have encountered in any of my travels anywhere. They most definitely added to a wonderful experience!! (They also have some greast suggestions for restaurants around!!) One of the best areas of the hotel is the roof restaurant!! Sitting out early in the morning, overlooking Rome, listening to the city below, is incredible. Just having that bit of time in the morning outdoors set the pace for the whole day. And lastly, the room was very nice - a good size single room, with a dressing area, and a large enough bathroom to be comfortable in. In no way did I feel that I was cramped into a little corner of a hotel. I will most definitely make this a place to return to!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our accomodations and service at the Marcella Royal. The location was close enough to the heart of the city to allow us to walk. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. Bathrooms were modern. Breakfast offerings were extensive and the rooftop terrace restaurant for breakfast or a drink and music at night very nice. The front desk staff, in particular was very friendly, helpful and accomodating. We would recommend this strongly and would certainly come here again upon return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Gem in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel, centrally located in Rome offers a beautiful rooftop garden for a sumptuous breakfast or an evening glass of wine al fresco. This is our fourth time at this gem of a hotel. Try to get a room with a balcony, or a corner suite, which has two balconies so you can explore the busy streets below! During one of our earlier stays they were beggining a full renovation, done with tasteful European flair. The staff is always friendly and accomodating, and we've gotten to know them as wonderful friends, especially Allessandro, Michele and the ever affable Pietro. They are full of ideas and new places to explore. Located on via Flavia (off of Via XX Septembre), you can walk to most everything. The train station is 5 minutes away too. Reasonable rates for a beautiful hotel with spacious rooms. We've stayed in Manhatten for a lot more with a lot less. This is Roma, and when your sitting in the garden sipping a heady cup of espresso, taking in the viewnothing else really matters. La Dolce Vita! Edmond and Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbjones94102
Reviews.Content: The Marcella Royal Hotel, is a gem tucked away on the Via Flavia. We chose this hotel because of the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. We arranged our room via email, when we arrived everything was perfect. My wife and I were travelling with our twenty one year old daughter. The triple room was very spacious and immaculate. The bathroom was spacious. Very different from our experience in Paris a few years ago. The rooftop breakfast was a wonderful way to start a full day of sightseeing. The sightseeing actually began at breakfast. The view from the dining area was breathtaking. Recommend the Marcella Royal Hotel highly. A previous reviewer stated the hotel had a ghost, we did not experience any supernatural events, only natural ones. The staff at the Hotel were excellent. We did have a dinner at the rooftop restaurant, which was very unspectacular but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marcella Royal at the end of September for a special occasion and it certainly heightened our celebrations. The service and friendliness of all the staff were second to none, from front desk to Edwin the bell boy to the chamber maids, breakfast staff and barmen, they were all so helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel was well situated, and in fact we walked from Termini in about 10 minutes with our bags. It is only about 15 minutes from Trevi. Also, just a couple of minutes around the corner are regular bus services that take you across and around the city for only 1 Euro. The decor in the hotel is very nice. It is not modern, but smart and very well kept and in keeping with the hotel style and location. The room we had was very large, very clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was of very good quality, setting you well up for a day's exploration of this wonderful city, and the views from the breakfast room are stunning. Overal, I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. I travel quite a bit across the world with work and this is one of the best places I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: user111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marcella and found it comfortable and clean, and the location, though a bit far out, was OK - you can still walk around the city. But the last night we were there the management put up a sign saying there would be a total blackout in the middle of the night because the lights were being fixed, and failed to mention this meant that the overhead 'emergency' lights would come on, making the room totally bright in the middle of the night and impossible to sleep. In the morning at check out the hotel made no apology for not having warned us, and were hugely begrudging at giving us a discount for that night, making for very bad feeling. It may have been a one-off, but I felt the hotel staff were ungracious (especially as I was 6 months pregnant), and we left unhappy with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooftop Terrace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall this Hotel is quiet good. I am a Travel Consultant and had booked this Hotel as the Roof Terrace was what appealed to me. The decor in our room was far from my taste but it was very clean. The Breakfast is good, Ham, Cheese, toast, bacon & egg and pasteries. The setting on the roof terrace is great as the weather was gloroius and it was fabulous looking out to St Peters in the distance. The staff were helpful if you needed any info. I would probably rate it 3star plus but Rome seem to have their own way of rating hotels. We walked everywhere the first day as the 110 bus trip from Termini had a hugh Q. 10-15mins walk from Termini to the Hotel (we were quoted Eur25 for a taxi - watch out it should only be Eur 6-8). 20 mins walk brings you to a lot of areas, Trevi Ftn, Spainish Steps also Piazza Navona , Campo di Flori ,the Pantheon and Via Veneto for dining. Beer Eur 8 around the main squares otherwise Eur 3.50. Overall, Hotel was fine- would have liked to be a bit more central. Rome is fantastic - 5 nights and we still did not see all. Will have to return !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the above hotel and can highly recommend it. It is a small hotel but we were lucky to have got one of the bigger rooms. The cleanliness was excellent and there was a lovely roof top bar where (weather permitting) you could enjoy a drink at night or breakfast was served there also, again depending on the weather. Whilst it was a little farther from the centre (possibly 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps), a taxi would have you there in 5 minutes and for about 8 Euro. Where this hotel really gains such a high rating from us was the more than helpful and pleasant staff. Congratulations to Michele and Pietro for all their help. They will certainly not put you wrong regarding restaurants. We had a memorable stay and if you are considering Rome, go no further from this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kamig
Reviews.Content: After a 16 hour journey to Italy for a wedding that resulted in Alitalia losing ALL of our luggage--we trudged into the Marcella Royal exhausted and frustrated. Immediately we were dazzled. This small hotel tucked down a quiet sidestreet in an upscale business district was first class. Allessandro at the front desk greeted us with warmth and friendliness--and was helpful and attentive in our lost luggage escapade. Although it was 4 hours before check-in time--he graciously insisted we head to our room to nap and relax while he looked into the luggage situation. ALthough no luck on luggage--his charm and kindness had already transformed what seemed like the start of a rough trip into something very special. Rome was delightful--again thanks to the map and directions, plus shopping and restaruant selections Allessandro and the staff provided. The location of the hotel was perfect--out of the way of tourists--but providing a nice, safe long walk to any of the historic sites (except the Vatican by bus). We found the restaurants along the hotel's street Via Flavia to be the very best in Rome. The rooftop terrace is perfect for a final glass of wine for the evening--although the "piano bar" was actually an electric keyboard with a handsome karoke-sounding Italian man doing covers of lite-rock hits. The rooftop breakfast was the best in Italy--complete with eggs, bacon, breads, fruits, cheeses, meats, yogurt--and everything including very aggressive pigeons. While our room was small--it was immmaculate and beautifully appointed with silk linens, nice bathroom etc. We liked the Marcella so much we booked this hotel on our way back through Rome--and for the same price Allessandro surprised us with a HUGE corner room with a balcony, kingbed etc. All in all--this hotel is absolutely a perfect way to experience the charm of an incredible city. The staff is classy, dependable, and kind. While we will always treasure our dream trip to Italy--and it truly was made a wonderful experience in large part to the unforgettable Marcella Royal. Kami Gilmour Fort Collins, CO USA

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marcella Royal for a week in early August. Overall, the hotel was quite good. Service was reasonable and the breakfast that was included was a nice touch. The area is quite reasonable and safe at night. On the negative side, the rooms were small and the hotel restaurant at night was mediocre. The food was very average which wasn't a real problem as there were many dining options on the street the hotel is in. One thing for tourists to watch - every hotel claims to be close to the sights and Spanish Steps. It is not. There is quite a walk from the Marcella Royal although it is manageable and the staff are quite helpful. Also, taxis are very fast and efficient. Overall, I would recommend it as it is reasonably priced (for Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, very friendly service, very clean, situated just away from major attractions but within walking distance. Great piano terrace on 7th floor, wonderful views over Rome at breakfast time and in the evening. Food adequate - breakfasts good, evening meals light but acceptable Highly recommended - we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Marcella Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dear All, I stayed in this hotel for four days untill the 16th sept 2005. and I would highly recommend it. In a good area with shops ( via XX september) and small little restaurants nearby. The hotel staff were all lovely, kind and very helpful. They have a beautiful roof terrace where breakfast is served, which is very good. The roof terrace also is a bar from 1700 in the evening, serving a very wide variety of drinks and cocktails as well as light dinners. Resonably close to the Spanish steps and the termini train station ( 10-15 minute walk) The room was spotlessly clean, linen changed everyday, nicely decorated. It is a four star hotel, so not for the budget watchers, However having stayed there and having stayed in a cheaper hotel, and finding no comparison and not a great difference in price.. It is more than worth it. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place I ever stayed in!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: einnod23
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome, staying at the Marcella Royal. Now I know why the customers are giving this hotel high praise. This is probably the best placed I've ever stayed in (and I thought the B&B I stayed at in San Francisco 4 years ago wouldn't be topped!!!!!). It is very uncommon for a hotel to clean the room for the day, and then come back and make the bed up at night. It is also uncommon for a hotel to have a rooftop garden with music and a view of the Vatican. And while it is common for a hotel to have breakfast, it is very uncommon that among the contents of the meal are bacon with eggs, salami, and prosciutto!!!!!! The Marcella Royal is all that it's been written about. If I ever get back to Rome, I will most definitely stay at this spot again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marcella in Rome where we rented the junior suite. We had a wonderful room, very clean and comortable, truly a nice and authentic Roman hotel in a good and safe location. One word of caution: beware of the fruit basket that is presented in the bar/restaurant area. When my daughter took a banana the waiter didn't hesitate charging us 6 Euros for the banana (US $7.50). No sympathy from the hotel's management, either. Fruit is not complimentary unlike what is typically offered in four-star hotels in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbieuc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a pleasant stay at the Marcella Royal, the final 3 days of a two week trip to Italy. The hotel was above average for the price we paid and better than other hotels we have stayed in in Italy (we have been visiting for the past 15 years due to a family connection). Although quite small, the rooms were extremely clean, decorated in an old Italian style (fancy fabric wallpaper, lighting etc). The chambermaid kept our room immaculate, not easy when you are sharing with a 13 year old! All the staff were polite, efficient and friendly - again, far better than other hotels in Italy. It really does make a difference. The free internet access on the sixth floor was a boon for our son as were the sky sports channels where he was actually able to watch his team (Liverpool) play Sunderland. The only difficulty was prising him out of the hotel! The roof terrace was lovely - in the evening for a drink, in the morning for breakfast, or to sunbathe on the loungers provided. We did this one afternoon after sightseeing and were totally oblivious to the fact that there was an earthquake ( 4.5 on the richter scale) going on below us! The breakfast was lovely, hot water perfectly hot for tea, fresh rolls, meat, cheeses and delicious filled croissants. We did have a meal on our first night on the roof terrace which we found very disappointing for the price - I would definitely recommend eating out. One place we did try - and loved - was the Hard Rock Cafe on the Via Veneto. Excellent food and atomesphere at a great price - ok, so it's not traditional Italian fayre but our son loved it. Try the starter combo!! I agree with previous comments about the prices in Rome - we knew it would be expensive having been before, but on one occasion sheltering in a bar from the rain were stung with a 20 euro bill for 2 beers, a coke and an iced tea. Our main gripe though was the cost of the taxi back to Ciampino airport - we were quoted 50 to 55 euros by hotel reception who booked it for us. A 40 minute journey took 25 minutes due to the manic driving of our taxi driver who managed to steer and operate two mobiles at the same time. When we got there he told us it was 65 euros. After a bit of arguing I paid up, however please be warned. Also be careful of pickpockets - we met a lovely swedish couple who were out buying postcards on their final day to show where they had visited, as the previous night their camera had been stolen while at the Spanish Steps, complete with all their holiday snaps. The hotel is a bit of a walk to the main attractions but we did manage to get transport - the 62 bus to the Vatican and the metro, but if you are not fit you will find it a trek. Overall, this is a very nice hotel. It doesn't compare to 4 star hotels in UK, but then you don't get four star hotels in the heart of London for approx £70 for three people including breakfast. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but be careful in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMisky
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel based in central Rome. The staff were wonderfully helpful and the hotel itself is very comfortable indeed. However whilst the hotel was a haven for us Rome itself was a "tourist rip off zone". Ice cream cones priced at €4, taxi rides for 1 km journeys €12, mediocre meals priced at €50. THE ONLY WAY WE TOURISTS CAN EFFECT CHANGE HERE IS EITHER BY NOT SHOWING UP OR ASKING THE PRICE OF EVERYTHING BEFORE WE BUY.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a view.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful, warm and friendly. My mother and sister arrived at 9:00am and they had them checked in within and hour. We were also allowed a late checkout. The rooms were small but lovely. The hotel was very clean and well decorated. We started our days with a wonderful breakfast on the roof top terrace overlooking Rome. And we ended our evenings with a cocktail at the terrace piano bar. There is internet access on the 6th floor which is a nice touch. The only draw back is that the hotel's location is not central to the major sites. We stayed at 5 hotels in Europe and the Marcella Royal Hotel was our favorite; the staff was the deciding factor.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal Hotel is the best. The rooftop garden for breakfast in the morning and for the piano bar and restaurant in the evening was so enjoyable. The staff were helpful and courteous. The room was perfect. The location is ideal. We walked to the train station, to the spanish steps, to the colosseum and everywhere in between. I always enjoy visiting Rome, but staying at this hotel made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a charming hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lornagreene
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us stayed in the Marcella Royal for 3 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were relatively small, but well serviced. The staff were excellent, very knowledgable, friendly and helpful (especially Alessandro!!) and it was a pleasure to have breakfast overlooking the city on their rooftop terrace. It's also in an excellent location, within walking distance of all of the major attractions. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay!! Thanks to all of the staff at the Marcella Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Go and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: the-surrey-two
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in July - and it was everything I hoped it would be from the reviews. If I get the downsides out of the way first, it will be easier. The only things I could possibly complain about are: 1) it is quite a long walk to many of the sights. But I knew that. Rome is a big city and wherever you stay you have to travel about. There are bus stops close by that take you pretty much anywhere for €1 - as we discovered travelling back from the Olympic stadium after the U2 concert! Plus it's fun exploring, so this really isn't a complaint as far as we were concerned and the walk home is good for you after pizza and pasta! 2) there were no bread rolls on sunday morning, only cut bread. Hardly worth complaining about though eh? So that's it on the downside, what about the good things. Well, we flew into Ciampino and got the bus into town, dropping us off at the Termini station. Ten minute walk to the hotel. Not the most inspiring of facades, but pleasant enough. Inside it was pukka - and the aircon was very welcome. Friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Easy check in and straight to the room. We were on the 4th floor and the room was lovely. Huge bed, pristine bathroom, funky wall 'paper' and everything very clean. Again the aircon was brilliant given the mid 30c temperatures outside. We then headed up to the piano bar. This made the place for us. How nice to sit on the roof, sipping cold drinks looking out over Rome. Ok, so some of the view consists of roofs and aerials, but you can see St Peters, the hills and a lot of the city. Breakfast is served from 7 -10 am and we ate outside each morning which was lovely. It felt like being on a beach holiday in some ways - that may sound strange but was how we felt. So much nicer than being cooped up inside eating breakfast. We asked for a late check out on the last day and this was no problem at all. Again the staff were really helpful and smiled all the time - it is so simple yet makes all the difference. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. It is not the plushest, most facility-laden hotel in the world, but is a great base and is not overpriced and pretentious as so many of the other hotels seem to be. Free internet access on floor 6 is a nice touch. I was chuffed I chose it for a surprise weekend away - and it will always hold a special significance for us as we got engaged on the roof terrace! Go and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got to this hotel through TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Nice quiet location with a great staff. Nice clean rooms. There are some single rooms with steps up to the bathroom that my 76 year old mother had and was able to navigate. But anyone with steps issues should request a room that you doesn't have any. Rooftop area was great for drinks and lounging. Free internet nice touch versus a 4 star hotel we stayed at in Venice where it cost 4 Euro for 40 minutes! Not too convenient to the sites but I would definately recommend this hotel for a very pleasant stay in Rome! Also, if you are in need of a guide service, Angel Tours provides fun and intelligent guides to make your visit a great one. Small groups too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveller08
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Marcella was wonderful. I arrived at 10:00 a.m. after an overnight flight and immediately checked in and had delicious breakfast. The roof top terrace overlooked the city and was a delightful way to start the day. The room was very comfortable, complete with a large bathroom which included a real shower with good water pressure. The location is great...close to Termini, but close enough to walk to all the major sights. Dining was close by. The neighborhood was quiet and safe at night. Can't say enough about it. Would stay here again. A special comment must be made about the staff, especially the concierage. Michele was especially helpful...after spending a half hour trying to help me purchase a train ticket on line, he sent one of his staff to the station to purchase a ticket for me.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right - A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IloveStewie
Reviews.Content: Marcella Royal is a great hotel in a quiet neighborhood of Rome. It's a bit of a walk to some of the sites, but nothing that cannot be accomplished with some gelato breaks along the way. Additionally, taxis in Rome are not too expensive and offer a good alternative to walking; especially when travelling from the hotel to the Vatican, which is quite a hike. I very much liked the hotel's close location to the Villa Borghese Park, which is a great refuge from the crowded and noisy attractions. The rooms range from small to large, but all are more than adequate in size to fit two people comfortably. I really liked the internet access that was available on the 6th floor, free and with no wait. The breakfast was excellent, with a wide variety buffet. The best part of this hotel, however, is its staff. Everyone is friendly and helpful, and many staff members speak very good english, so communicating is not a problem. Overall, this is a very nice hotel and good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We where very pleased with the Marcella Royal Hotel. We found the staff to be very pleasant, helpfull and efficient. The morning breakfast was very good, the 7th floor location overlooking the roof tops was great. A nice place to relax in the afternoons also. The front desk staff were helpful in explaining bus routes to locations and also in recommending local reastaurants. WE will be recommending this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Love at first site...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Marcella Royal! Wonderful location for walking around the city and I was delighted with my perfect room with balcony on the 5th floor. The staff is friendly and efficient with extensive experience. They can solve any issue quickly. The ambiance is relaxing and gracious with lovely lobby and rooftop garden for dining and sunning. Alessandro should be commended for his excellent management of this beautiful hotel. I will stay there again on my next trip to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely roof terrace, service good”
Reviews.Author: UKElr
Reviews.Content: I had changed my booking to the Marcella based on previous reviews. The standard of the Hotel was good, but I do think the other reviews are a bit over-rated. My partner and I stayed for 4 nights in a smallish room. The bathroom only had a shower cubicle, but was more than adequate. The main attraction in staying at this Hotel is the views from the roof terrace - you can see the top of St Peter's (lovely at night-time). A word of warning though. We were recommended the Flavia restaurant as a good place to eat. We waited over 30 minutes before being seated - the staff there didn't manage the queue of people very well. However, we didn't mind at the time because we thought the food would be good. Don't expect large portions of food (I'm a woman and I thought it wasn't enough). I ordered a pasta dish with mushrooms and truffles - well the truffles must have been in hiding! Aside from this really quite small matter, was the bigger matter of the restaurant trying to rip us off when the bill arrived. We had been charged for 3 bottles of wine instead of 1 - that's an extra 38 euros. Now that, I do object to. Of course we told the waiter who duly amended the 'mistake'. I would recommend this Hotel for its location (nearest attraction is a 15 min walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps) and roof terrace, but I would say the service was quite standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel in Rome with a very efficient, friendly, and knowledgeable staff. Hotel has a rooftop breakfast area that becomes a piano bar in the evening. Lovely. Rooms are spaceous and clean. All in all a great experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukuser2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September for 4 nights at the Marcella Royal hotel. Extremely handy location near to all sites, walking and via the metro. Very, Very Friendly staff, gave recommendations for dining and very approachable. Great roof top bar where you can have drinks at night and also have breakfast in the morning.
